Lore: Alliance \b spy\b0  and \b scout\b0. Often flies support missions for General Madine's commandos.
Gametext: Deploys -2 aboard Tala 1. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Tala 1, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. When opponent deploys a spy or scout to same (or related) exterior site, opponent loses 1 Force.
IsPulled: General Crix Madine
Combo: Colonel Cracken + Double Agent

Lore: \b Scout\b0. Special forces \b leader\b0. Convinced superiors that wilderness survival and recon training are necessary for military dominance, despite technological superiority.
Gametext: While at an exterior planet site, power +2, immune to attrition < 3 and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. When present with a Scomp Link, cancels Surprise Assault at a related site where you have a spy or scout.
IsPulled: Blizzard 4

Lore: Responsible for defense of control bunker. \b Leader\b0. Worked closely with Moff Jerjerrod to plan the installation's defense. Instructed to hold troops in reserve.
Gametext: While at Bunker or an Endor battleground site, prevents Ominous Rumors from being canceled. Your [Endor] troopers may move as a 'react' to same site.
IsPulled: Blizzard 4
Combo: Colonel Dyer + Endor Operations Objective\par -----\par Colonel Dyer + Commander Igar + Scout Recon\par

Lore: One of General Dodonna's chief strategic advisors. Planned the Rebel fleet's approach to the Death Star.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Power +2 on Yavin 4. When at Massassi War Room, doubles Rebel Tech bonus to Attack Run. While present with Rebel Planners, that Effect applies separately to every system and is immune to Alter.

Lore: Senior test pilot ordered to shake down first TIE defenders assigned to fleet operations. Occasionally given honor duty of flying Vader's shuttle.
Gametext: Adds 3 to power and 1 to maneuver of anything he pilots. When piloting Onyx 1, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

Lore: \b Leader\b0  of Gray Squadron. Prefers to fly venerable Koensayr starfighters instead of newer models because "they've always gotten me home in one piece."
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When he is piloting a Y-wing, once per battle you may cancel and redraw your battle destiny just drawn. While he occupies the Renegade system, Imperial Control is flipped and Imperial Occupation may not be flipped.
IsPulled: Princess Organa\par Yavin 4: Massassi War Room (V)
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-4)\par Salm may only cancel and redraw a battle destiny of a battle he is participating in.

Lore: Imperial Security Bureau (ISB) officer assigned to brief Tarkin. Also ordered to ensure absolute loyalty to the Emperor. \b Leader\b0. Will stop at nothing to fulfill the Emperor's will.
Gametext: Power +1 if at the same site with Tarkin, Chief Bast or General Dodonna.
IsPulled: Blizzard 4
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-4)\par This Imperial is power +1 with any or all of the three cards mentioned in its game text (not power +1 for each).

Lore: \b Enclosed\b0  Ubrikkian Talon I Combat Cloud Car. Speeds up to 1,875 kph. Exceptional maneuverability makes this a favorite of outer Rim security forces.
Gametext: Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. At cloud sectors, power and maneuver +1, may deploy as a 'react' and may move and be targeted by weapons like a starfighter.
IsPulled: Battle Deployment

Lore: Imperial troops remain prepared for quick deployment to seize valuable terrain.
Gametext: USED: If a battle was just initiated, draw destiny and activate up to that much Force. STARTING: If you have not deployed an Objective, deploy from Reserve Deck one battleground site (or two <> sites) related to your starting location. Place Interrupt in Reserve Deck.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-4)\par See Careful Planning.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-3)\par Careful Planning\par The starting text of this card is intended to mean "deploy from Reserve Deck one battleground site or deploy from Reserve Deck two <> battleground sites." The location (or locations) deployed must be battlegrounds immediately after its (their) deployment.

Lore: Imperial troops remain prepared for quick deployment to seize valuable terrain.
Gametext: If your starting location was a system, deploy a related site (must be a battleground if the system is a non-battleground or Endor) with < 3 (Dark Side) icons and up to thee Effects that are always (Immune to Alter) from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Place this Interrupt in Lost Pile.
Information: Player Created Card\par Original concept by Kevin Brwonell,\par Illinois Staes, 2004.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-4)\par See Careful Planning (V).\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-3)\par Careful Planning (V)\par Non-unique sectors and sites may not be deployed using this interrupt because such locations are not related until they are deployed to the table.

Lore: Being stationed at Endor during the construction of the second Death Star allowed Imperial pilots time to train in the latest starfighter combat techniques.
Gametext: Deploy on table. During your deploy phase, you may reveal one unpiloted starfighter from hand to take its matching pilot character from Reserve Deck (or vice versa) and deploy both simultaneously; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Prepared Defenses.\par -----\par Please check Sonn's list here:\par http://www.swccgpc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?t=6509\par
IsPulled: Desperate Counter\par Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans\par You Cannot Hide Forever\par You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-4)\par Once an unpiloted starfighter (or pilot) is revealed, if no matching pilot (or unpiloted starfighter) is found, the opponent is permitted to verify. If a match has been found but the player does not have enough Force to deploy the cards (or there is no location where they can be legally deployed), then the card revealed from hand is returned to hand, and the card taken from the Reserve Deck is placed back in the Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

Lore: Efficient cooperation allowed the Rebels to coordinate the attack of their small starfighters effectively at the Battle of Yavin.
Gametext: During a battle, target opponent's starship present with two (or more) of your starship weapons. Add all weapon destiny draws together. Apply that total separately for each weapon in an order of your choosing.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-4)\par (Errata) This Interrupt combines the firing of two or more weapons into a single action. You may choose to fire any or all of your applicable weapons, at normal use of the Force.

Gametext: At each system where any player does not have both a starfighter and a capital starship present, that player's starships there are power -2. At sites related to systems you occupy, during each battle opponent may draw no more than one battle destiny. Once during each of your deploy phases, you may deploy one combat vehicle from your Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

Lore: Pilots are often reassigned at the last minute for a variety of tactical reasons. Darth Vader ordered DS-61-2 and DS-61-3 to accompany him to the Battle of Yavin.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to target a starfighter having one or more permanent pilots. Draw destiny. If destiny > 2, deploy on starfighter to remove all permanent pilots (otherwise, Effect is lost). May add one pilot for each permanent pilot removed. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: The most obvious use is against the Rebel Leader cards. A destiny draw of 3 or higher will knock out any starfighter's permanent pilot, and Red Leader In Red 1 or Gold Leader In Gold 1 are most annoying\par Unfortunately, Han, Chewie And The Falcon is immune to Come With Me.\par \par A more subtle use is to use Come With Me on one of your own starfighters to add a better pilot aboard. For example, you could deploy the Obsidians, then use Come With Me on Obsidian 8, and replace it's permanent pilot with one of the myriad ability 2 pilots available to keep a destiny draw together.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, D-2)\par Operatives are identified by their title, X Operative, with X being a system. The operative is considered a 'matching operative' for system X (e.g., Kiffex Operative is a matching operative for Kiffex). \par Operatives are restricted by special rules as follows: \par - You may not voluntarily deploy or move your operative to (or through) a location on its matching planet where you already have an operative (even if inactive) of the same card title. \par - If, at any time, two of your Operatives (even if inactive) of the same card title are at the same location on their matching planet, you must choose one to be lost (you may choose an inactive operative to be lost). \par - Your operative character on its matching planet may not apply its ability toward drawing battle destiny. Your operative may not control a location on its matching planet for any reason unless you have other cards there capable of controlling the location (e.g., an ability-1 character or a battle droid). Your operatives still occupy that location (and may battle or be battled), but may not Force drain or flip an objective alone.

The operative is considered a 'matching operative' for system X (e.g., Kiffex Operative is a matching operative for Kiffex). \par Operatives are restricted by special rules as follows: \par - You may not voluntarily deploy or move your operative to (or through) a location on its matching planet where you already have an operative (even if inactive) of the same card title. \par - If, at any time, two of your Operatives (even if inactive) of the same card title are at the same location on their matching planet, you must choose one to be lost (you may choose an inactive operative to be lost). \par - Your operative character on its matching planet may not apply its ability toward drawing battle destiny. Your operative may not control a location on its matching planet for any reason unless you have other cards there capable of controlling the location (e.g., an ability-1 character or a battle droid). Your operatives still occupy that location (and may battle or be battled), but may not Force drain or flip an objective alone.

Lore: Imperial stormtroopers use tactical training to regroup and mount a surprise counterattack, such as when they halted Han Solo's wild pursuit.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to cancel a Force drain at one location. Draw one destiny for each character, starship and vehicle the opponent has present. Compare your destiny total to opponent's power total. Player with lowest total loses Force equal to the difference.
Information: Counter Assault can be one of the more powerful cards in the game, if used correctly. The ability to cancel a Force drain is terrific in any circumstance, and the added ability to nail your opponent for additional Force loss makes this card even better. However, there are several factors that make this card a risky proposition. First, there is a possibility that your opponent will match or beat your total, potentially increasing the damage. Also, the Light Side tends to have a higher destiny curve than the Dark Side does. Finally, due to the present rulings, Counter Assaulting in space is a risky proposition at best.
Combo: Counter Assault + Luke? Luuuuke!\par The power reduction on this card can make it easier to have a successful Counter Assault, especially if the Utinni Effect is targeting Luke. \par -----\par Counter Assault + Lateral Damage\par (Indiana Jones Jedi Knight)
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-4)\par The total power and number of destinies to be drawn is determined immediately when this Interrupt card begins resolving, and neither changes during the resolution. Thus if a character, starship or vehicle is introduced to the location during resolution of the Assault (such as via Tauntaun Bones) it does not add power and does not permit an additional destiny draw. Similarly, if cards are removed from the location during the resolution (such as by a Program Trap), they will still contribute power and still add a destiny draw for purposes of resolving the Counter Assault. This Interrupt does not cause a battle and thus cards may not be forfeited to reduce Force loss. Remember that, at a system location, characters and vehicles aboard starships are not present at the system. Therefore, for Counter Assault there will ordinarily only be one destiny draw per starship at the system but none for any cards aboard. Counter Assault may technically be played at a holosite but, since there are no characters present (only dejariks and holograms), no destiny will be drawn and zero will be compared to the opponent's total power.
Cancels: A Force drain at one location
IsCanceledBy: Hear Me Baby, Hold Together (V)\par It's A Hit!\par Major Olander Brit\par Surprise Counter Assault

Lore: The Imperial forces on Endor quickly responded to the Rebel intrusion. Commander Igar had a plan in place to deal with such a commando force of Rebels.
Gametext: If a battle that opponent initiated just ended, initiate a new battle at same location. 'Reacts' are allowed only for opponent, but cards may not 'react' away or hide from battle. Loser ignores battle damage. If your trooper present there, add one battle destiny.
Information: Counterattack gives the Dark Side player the opportunity to initiate a second battle at same location. Especially if your running troopers, since two destiny draws in a second battle can account for some serious attrition, since your opponent has already lost someone from the first battle.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-5)\par This card explicitly allows characters, vehicles and starships at the targeted location to battle again this turn (and since this is a battle, they may fire any applicable weapons). It does not allow any characters, vehicles or starships to 'react' a second time this turn. When determining the order of actions for this second battle, treat it as though it were the turn of the player who played this Interrupt. If a card was excluded from the previous battle, it may participate in this battle unless it is still prevented from participating (e.g., was targeted by Imperial Barrier).

Lore: Despite being alone, trapped and desperately outmatched, Luke continued his battle with the Dark Lord of the Sith.
Gametext: One of your Skywalkers present during a battle at a site, for remainder of turn, loses immunity to attrition but adds ability to power (he or she may not apply ability toward drawing battle destiny). OR During a duel, add one destiny to your total.
Information: If you have a deck which is designed around setting up big beatdowns (eg. with Jedi Presence and supporting cards like Courage of a Skywalker), Treva is your most effective way of stopping your opponent using Ghhhk to avoid the battle damage when combined with Draw Their Fire. The other methods of achieving this result - Frozen Assets and Beggar - are each canceled by the Fanfare shield, so Treva is probably the best way to abuse Draw Their Fire in this way. (Psychobabble)
Combo: Courage Of A Skywalker + Draw Their Fire + Treva Home (Psychobabble)

Your Force drains are +1 at systems where you have a squadron present. \par \b Flip\b0  this card if opponent controls at least two Dantooine locations. \par \b Place\b0  out of play if Dantooine is "blown away."
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-5)\par This card establishes a deploy cost for squadrons based on their current power. The squadron's power may be modified (e.g. S-Foils), but because the deploy cost is equal to this power, the cost may not be modified (e.g. Haven, Rendezvous Point). The reference to squadron on this objective card refers only to the starship class: squadron. It does not include starships such as Red Squadron X-wing and Gold Squadron Y-wing.

Lore: Corrupt Pacithhip businessmen. Report to the Empire on who makes contributions to the Alliance.
Gametext: While at a Dantooine site: adds 1 to your Force drains there, is power +1 (or +2 if your thief is on Dantooine) and, once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one site to Dantooine from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
Pulls: One site to Dantooine.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, D-2)\par Operatives are identified by their title, X Operative, with X being a system. The operative is considered a 'matching operative' for system X (e.g., Kiffex Operative is a matching operative for Kiffex). \par Operatives are restricted by special rules as follows: \par - You may not voluntarily deploy or move your operative to (or through) a location on its matching planet where you already have an operative (even if inactive) of the same card title. \par - If, at any time, two of your Operatives (even if inactive) of the same card title are at the same location on their matching planet, you must choose one to be lost (you may choose an inactive operative to be lost). \par - Your operative character on its matching planet may not apply its ability toward drawing battle destiny. Your operative may not control a location on its matching planet for any reason unless you have other cards there capable of controlling the location (e.g., an ability-1 character or a battle droid). Your operatives still occupy that location (and may battle or be battled), but may not Force drain or flip an objective alone.

Characteristics: \b Black Sun agent\b0, \b bounty hunter\b0, \b gunner\b0
Lore: Cocky \b gunner\b0  and \b bounty hunter\b0. Maintains a residence on Nar Shaddaa, the spaceport moon of the Hutt homeworld. To his companions' delight, he's nearly as good as he boasts.
Gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. Adds 1 to weapon destiny draws of anything he is aboard as a passenger.
IsPulled: Double Back\par Double Back (V)

Lore: "The Force is with you, young Skywalker. But you are not a Jedi yet."
Gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle, you may do one of the following: Add one destiny to your total power only. OR If you have a character weapon present, select one opponent's character present to lose all immunity to attrition for remainder of battle.

Lore: Imperial leaders are ruthlessly effective when working together. Tarkin, Motti and Tagge presented a deadly combination as they plotted to "crush the Rebellion."
Gametext: If Tarkin and either Tagge or Motti are in a battle together, you may add two battle destiny. OR Cancel Restricted Deployment or Rebel Barrier.
Cancels: Rebel Barrier\par Restricted Deployment

Lore: "Perhaps you think you're being treated unfairly?" "No." "Good. It would be unfortunate if I had to leave a garrison here."
Gametext: Deploy on Bespin: Cloud City if you control that sector and at least three related sites. At each Cloud City site, your total power is +4 and your Force drains are +2. Effect canceled if opponent occupies four Bespin locations. (Immune to Alter.)
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Combo: Dark Deal + Aqualish

Lore: The huge Imperial officers corps, with its high rate of turnover, is ripe with competitiveness and ambition. Advancement comes at the expense of another's career.
Gametext: USED: Cancel Dark Collaboration or Lone Pilot. LOST: If two Imperials each with ability > 2 are in a battle together, use 2 Force to draw two destiny. Subtract that amount from opponent's attrition and total power.
Cancels: Dark Collaboration\par Dark Collaboration (V)\par Lone Pilot

Lore: "The ability to destroy a planet is insignificant next to the power of the Force."
Gametext: Deploy on your side of table. When Surprise Assault is played, may use 1 Force to add one destiny to your total. Also, when Sense or Alter is played, may use X Force to exclude X Jedi from being the highest-ability character."
IsPulled: A Dangerous Time\par Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-5)\par When this Effect is deployed, and Alter is played as a response to cancel it, Dark Forces has not had its result yet and thus will not affect that Alter. (See actions.)

Lore: After surviving Tarkin's extortion, kidnapping, threats of execution and the assault of the Interrogator droid, Princess Leia was asleep when her rescuers came.
Gametext: Select one site under "nighttime conditions." Target every character there (except droids) and draw one destiny each. If destiny > ability, character 'sleeps' (power, forfeit and ability = 0, "game text" unusable) until the end of your next turn, then lose Effect.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-5)\par The person who plays this card decides in what order to target the available characters. When targeting a character, if the player who played this card has no cards left in their Reserve Deck, then their opponent may choose what happens to that character: either put to 'sleep' or left 'awake.' A 'sleeping' character cannot move, drive or pilot.

Lore: Multifaceted jewels focus light into a deadly blade. Projects a meter-long beam of pure energy. A lightsaber is constructed personally by a Jedi as a part of training.
Gametext: Use X Force to deploy on your warrior where X = (7 - warrior's ability). May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature using X Force. Draw two destiny. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
Information: Can be deployed from Reserve Deck on a trooper with Blast Points.
IsPulled: I Will Finish What You Started\par Jabba's Through With You\par Mara Jade, The Emperor's Hand\par Maul Strikes

Lore: A Dark Lord's presence motivates Imperial troops. "See to it personally, Commander."
Gametext: If one of your Dark Jedi is present during any battle, use 1 Force to cause all other Imperials there to battle at double power.
IsCanceledBy: Throw Me Another Charge\par Twilight Is Upon Me

Lore: Imperial TIE fighters, while easily damaged, are very fast and agile. Sophisticated tactics are executed to take advantage of Rebel X-wing and Y-wing weaknesses.
Gametext: Add 2 to maneuver and 1 to power of any starfighter for the remainder of this turn. If it has hyperdrive, also add 2 to hyperspeed. (Interrupt may even affect the result immediately after a destiny draw targeting the starfighter's maneuver.)
Information: Combo Card: Dark Maneuvers & Tallon Roll
Combo: Dark Maneuvers + Tallon Roll

Gametext: Add 2 to maneuver and 1 to power of any TIE for the remainder of this turn. (Interrupt may even affect the result immediately after a destiny draw targeting the TIE's maneuver.) OR Target two starfighters (your TIE/ln and any Rebel starfighter) present at same system or sector. Each player draws destiny. Opponent totals destiny and starship's power. You total destiny, TIE's power and TIE's maneuver. Lowest total loses starfighter (if tied, neither starfighter is lost).

Lore: While Qui-Gon meditated to regain strength lost during the ferocious duel, Darth Maul paced impatiently outside the energy barrier like a caged krayt dragon.
Gametext: If opponent just initiated a duel, use 3 Force to cancel it. OR Take Deep Hatred into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR If Maul has no combat cards, target a Jedi to place one of their combat cards (random selection) in opponent's Used Pile. (Immune to Sense.)
Pulls: Deep Hatred
Cancels: A duel.

Lore: Many have experienced the awesome power of the Dark Lord in battle. Few have lived to tell about it.
Gametext: If you just targeted with a lightsaber, add 3 to your weapon destiny. OR Cancel Swing-And-A-Miss. OR Lose 1 Force to cause one opponent's character just 'hit' to be immediately placed in Lost Pile.

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-5)\par This Interrupt adds 3 to the total weapon destiny for a lightsaber, not 3 to each destiny draw.
Cancels: Swing-And-A-Miss

Lore: Swamp predators require damp and cluttered environments to enhance their camouflage and stealth. "Something just moved past my leg."
Gametext: Deploy on any exterior planet site (except Hoth) or any interior vehicle site. Opponent's Force drains are -1 here. (Immune to Alter when a swamp creature is present.)

Lore: Biggs improvised this maneuver shortly after joining the Alliance. By spinning his starfighter while firing all four cannons, he was able to destroy multiple incoming targets.
Gametext: During a battle at a system or sector, if you are about to draw a card for battle destiny, you may instead use the maneuver number of your starfighter in that battle.
Information: The advantage of 'replacing' a battle destiny draw with the maneuver number is that opponent may not cancel your 'draw' (because it is no draw).\par -----\par Combo Card: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
IsPulled: Luke Skywalker (V)

Lore: Jawa who has inside connections with the Empire. Frequently speaks with his Imperial contact, whom he reports to regarding Rebel activity in the Outer Rim.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. If opponent initiates a battle at same system, may reveal the top card of your Reserve Deck. If it is a Star Destroyer, may deploy it here for free. Otherwise, card is lost.

Lore: Apprentice to Darth Sidious. Sent to capture Queen Amidala on Tatooine. Full of anger and fury as a child. Sidious used Maul's pent-up rage to train him in the ways of the Sith.
Gametext: Deploys -2 to Tatooine. During your control phase may lose 1 Force to duel opponent's Jedi present. Both players draw 2 destiny. Loser is lost. Unless opponent's character of ability > 3 here, opponent's total ability here = 0. Immune to attrition < 5.

CardName: Do They Have A Code Clearance?
Lore: Imperial officers are always on the lookout for Rebel espionage.
Gametext: Deploy on table. Unique (*) Imperials of ability = 3 are forfeit +3. If opponent just retrieved Force using an Interrupt or Utinni Effect, you may place that card here. Opponent's Force retrieval is reduced by X, where X = number of cards here. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Prepared Defenses.\par -----\par Unique Imperials of ability = 3 are:\par \par Admiral Motti\par Admiral Motti (V)\par Admiral Piett\par Baron Soontir Fel\par Captain Gilad Pellaeon\par Captain Needa\par Captain Piett\par Colonel Dyer\par Commander Brandei\par  Commander Igar\par General Tagge\par General Veers\par General Veers (V)\par Grand Moff Tarkin\par Kir Kanos\par Lieutenant Commander Ardan\par Moff Jerjerrod\par Myn Kyneugh\par The Emperor's Reach (V)\par Veers\par Veers (V)\par -----\par Dark Side grabbers are:\par \par Allegations Of Corruption\par Allegations Of Corruption - Defensive Shield\par Do They Have A Code Clearance? - Defensive Shield\par Do They Have A Code Clearance?\par Something Special Planned For Them (V)\par Tentacle\par There'll Be Hell To Pay
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-6)\par The reduction this Effect applies to Force retrieval is an automatic modifier, and as such applies before any other comparisons or actions are made. This means that the value of X on Secret Plans is reduced by the number of cards stacked on this Effect. Note that a retrieving card is stacked on this Effect after the retrieval is completed, and is optional (thus automatic actions may occur first, such as placing the card out of play). A card that "retrieves" a specific card by name is still retrieval, and can be reduced. For example, Baragwin says "Once per turn, if the top card of your Lost Pile is a weapon, device or transport vehicle, may use 1 Force to retrieve it." If there is at least one Interrupt or Utinni Effect stacked upon Do They Have A Code Clearance?, that will reduce the Baragwin retrieval from 1 card to no cards.

Lore: News of Imperial defeat inspires the citizens of the galaxy. A major loss seriously undermines the Empire's ability to function.
Gametext: Deploy on table. All immunity to attrition is -3. You may not fire [Permanent] weapons. If opponent just lost a Dark Jedi or a battle, they lose 1 Force. During your draw phase, use 3 Force or place this Effect in Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Heading For The Medical Frigate.\par -----\par Article at DeckTech, September 19th, 2005\par Top 5 Battle-Aiding V-Cards (Light Side) by Armaedes and Shewski\par \par This is much better than the dark side version, A Day Long Remembered (V), because it doesn't hurt you if you decide you want to keep it on the table. When facing Imperial Justice (V), the immunity reduction is good because otherwise it could be problematic cracking Lord Vader's immunity < 6. Also, since you are battling you can count on making your opponent lose lots of Dark Jedi as well as lots of battles, so the additional Force loss is important. Furthermore, the card is destiny-6 and easily cycles back into your Reserve Deck for easy tracking. If you generate enough Force - and every mains deck should have solid generation - it will be an easy thing to pay the 3 Force "upkeep" cost if you should need to.\par \par SHEWSKI'S TAKE:\par ADLR is #2 on my DS listing, and I have to take exception with DWTE being better than it. These cards aren't meant to stay on the table- this card is wonderful to cycle through your deck for destiny of whatnot. The upkeep is manageable, but I can't think of any time I've used this card and kept it on the table by paying for it.\par -----\par Article at DeckTech, September 19th, 2005\par Top 5 Battle-Aiding V-Cards (Dark Side) by Armaedes and Shewski\par \par Deploy on table. All immunity to attrition is reduced by 3. You may not fire permanent weapons. Whenever a Jedi is lost, or opponent loses a battle, opponent loses 1 Force. During your draw phase, lose 1 Force or place this card in your Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)\par \par Much like my #1 pick, I like the DS card a little more than the LS version. There are more Jedi that see play than Dark Jedi, and many have little immunity or none at all, which can mean guaranteed Force loss. This card is not meant to stay on the table, but cycle through your deck to show up as a big destiny draw or to deploy again for more Force loss. This works well w/ #1 as well, since you can't fire with your EPPs. The attrition reduction is a two-edged sword; so make sure you have some fodder. I can't tell you how many times it has turned a weak destiny draw into a site clearer. A great card that is fun to use along with other battle winning cards like Insignificant Rebellion.\par \par ARMAEDES' TAKE:\par I agree completely with your assessment of the strengths of this card. The light side version made my list, but for dark side I just think there's far better battling helpers available. The strength of most of the powerful light side decks is EPP hit-and-run. I really only see the dark side version of this card being useful if you keep it on the table for a turn, so your opponent loses a Force from their EPP strike, or if you are going against an immunity-mains deck like Profit, which is unpopular at best, or the Careful Planning (V) Endor deck, which this card would work quite well against.
IsPulled: Don't Tread On Me (V)\par The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once

Lore: Thug. \b Smuggler\b0. Twisted 'doctor.' Disfigured by blaster. Has death sentence in over 12 systems. Notorious partner of Ponda Baba. Aliases: Dr. Cornelius and Roofoo.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. The not-so-good doctor may 'operate' on any other character present that was just 'hit' or just Disarmed; 'patient' is lost.

Combo: Dr. Evazan + Disarmed + any character weapon\par -----\par Dr. Evazan + Dannik Jerriko + any character weapon\par -----\par Dr. Evazan + Ponda Baba

Lore: One of Dagobah's deadliest predators. Has razor-sharp fins, powerful constrictor coils and large fangs. Feeds on almost anything. Often mistaken for a swamp slug, due to its size.

Combo: Draw Their Fire + Frozen Assets\par -----\par Draw Their Fire + Deneb Both\par -----\par Draw Their Fire + I Did It!\par If your opponent wants to be able to use any Interrupt in a battle you initiate, they will have to lose 2 Force each turn (provided you meet the conditions on I Did It!). (Psychobabble)\par -----\par Draw Their Fire + Treva Home\par If you have a deck which is designed around setting up big beatdowns (eg. with Jedi Presence and supporting cards like Courage of a Skywalker), Treva is your most effective way of stopping your opponent using Ghhhk to avoid the battle damage when combined with Draw Their Fire. The other methods of achieving this result - Frozen Assets and Beggar - are each canceled by the Fanfare shield, so Treva is probably the best way to abuse Draw Their Fire in this way. (Psychobabble)\par -----\par Draw Their Fire + Jawa Siesta

Gametext: Deploy on your Gungan. May target a character for free. Draw destiny. If destiny > defense value, character is power -4 for remainder of turn. At the end of a battle here, may place this electropole on top of Reserve Deck.
IsPulled: Portable Scanner

Lore: Long-range stereoscopic sighting device connected to the cannons of an Imperial walker. Calibrated to allow the AT-AT commander to accurately fire at distant targets.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your AT-AT Cannon. It may fire at targets two sites away. Also, when used to Target The Main Generator, adds 1 to total.

Lore: A Givin pilot who can seal his joints to withstand the vacuum of space. Makes slaving and spice runs to Kala'uun. Has made many special modifications to his ship, the \ul Hinthra\ul0.
Gametext: At any time (except during battle), target any or all of your characters at one site to 'transport' (relocate) to any one other site. Draw destiny. Use that much Force to 'transport,' or place Interrupt in Lost Pile.
Information: Lana Dobreed (Coruscant U) has same function, but is limited to players move phase and can only transport from exterior sites.\par -----\par Lobel (DS) / Sic-Six (LS) prevent characters from moving to or from same or adjacent site using Elis Helrot or Nabrun Leids.\par -----\par Quite A Mercenary is the counter-card against Elis Helrot.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-6)\par (Errata) The following actions are part of the initiation of this Interrupt:\par - targeting the characters to be moved;\par - targeting the site to move them to;\par - drawing destiny; and\par - paying the cost (using the Force required to transport the targeted characters).
IsCanceledBy: It's A Hit!\par Quite A Mercenary makes all characters transported by Elis Helrot lost.

Lore: Commander Igar selected the Empire's most dedicated stormtroopers to guard Endor for the Emperor. All they know is killing and white uniforms.
Gametext: Power +2 while armed with a blaster. When using a blaster, subtracts 1 from Force required to fire it. Adds 2 to forfeit of each stormtrooper of ability < 2 at same site.
IsPulled: Blizzard 4

Lore: Like many Duros, Madak has natural piloting and navigation skill. Former scout. Freelance instructor. Makes runs to important trade worlds Celanon, Byblos and Yaga Minor.
Gametext: Deploy on your non-pilot character (except droids) to give that character pilot ([Pilot]) skill. Adds 2 to power of anything that character pilots. OR Deploy on your pilot. Adds 1 to power of anything that character pilots. (Immune to Alter.)
IsPulled: Leslomy Tacema (V)\par The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Wokling (V)

Lore: Many Elom commit sabotage and theft against the Empire to avenge the invasion of their homeworld. Experts in adapting stolen equipment for use by the Rebellion.
Gametext: Power +3 at same site as an Imperial. For remainder of game, Plastoid Armor is an Effect, is not unique, is immune to Alter while on table, and it deploys only on a Rebel or alien at same mobile site as Elom (character is now 'disguised').
IsPulled: Arleil Schous\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, F-2)\par Errata.

Lore: Piloted Red 7 at the Battle of Yavin. Part of the Griffon flight wing, a Rebel squadron sent to fight the Imperial subjugation of Ralltiir.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 7 during battle, adds one destiny to total power only. When at Ralltiir system, adds 1 to each of your Force drains there.

Lore: TIE fighters are stored in large racks far above the hangar deck. Catapulted into space by powerful tractor beam generators, TIEs can quickly scramble to engage the enemy.
Gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle where opponent has more than double your power, reveal up to 3 cards from your Reserve Deck. Of those 3, deploy anywhere (for free) any characters, starships, vehicles, devices or weapons.  Any others are lost.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-6)\par Although this card allows you to deploy 'anywhere,' it does not give you permission to ignore deployment restrictions. For example, the Hoth energy shield will still prevent Dark Side deployment to most Hoth sites.

Lore: Sith Master and \b leader\b0  of Galatic Empire. Dark side mentor to Darth Vader. Controls the Empire by instilling fear in its subjects and greed in its governors.
Gametext: Never deploys or moves (even aboard a starship or vehicle) to a site opponent occupies. Where present, subtracts 3 from attempts to cross Vader over. Once per turn, you may take Force Lightning into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition.
Information: Emperor Palpatine personas are:\par \par Emperor Palpatine\par Emperor Palpatine, Forseer\par The Emperor
Pulls: Force Lightning
IsPulled: According To My Design (V)\par Sith Fury (V)
Combo: Emperor Palpatine + Force Lightning\par -----\par Emperor Palpatine + I Have You Now\par Add one battle destiny (two if Rebel is Luke) if a Dark Jedi and a Rebel with ability > 2 are involved in the same battle.\par -----\par Emperor Palpatine + Force Field\par Cancels an attempt to target a Dark Jedi with a character weapon.\par -----\par Emperor Palpatine + Janus Greejatus\par -----\par Emperor Palpatine + Overseeing It Personally
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, D-4)\par Personas - Palpatine, Sidious, And The Emperor \par While in the saga of Star Wars we learn that the Emperor, Senator Palpatine, and Darth Sidious are one in the same, for game purposes they are treated as three distinct people. They will be referred to as Emperor, Palpatine, and Sidious, respectively.

Lore: Transport used extensively by Emperor Palpatine. Extremely well guarded. Pilots ordered to maintain constant contact with all nearby Imperial strike forces.
Gametext: May add 1 pilot and 4 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Emperor deploys for free aboard. While Emperor aboard, immune to attrition and adds one battle destiny.
IsPulled: Commander Desanne
Combo: Emperor's Personal Shuttle + Emperor Palpatine

Lore: From his throne room aboard the second Death Star, Emperor Palpatine monitors activity throughout the galaxy.
Gametext: Deploy on your Throne Room. You may not Force drain here. While Emperor here, opponent's characters are deploy +2 to Death Star II sites and, once per turn, you may lose Effect (or 1 Force from top of Reserve Deck) to add one battle destiny anywhere. (Immune to Alter.)
IsPulled: Death Star II: Throne Room\par Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans\par You Cannot Hide Forever\par You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points

Lore: Palpatine's cruel vision of his Empire included the enslavement and subjugation of entire species.
Gametext: Deploy on table. Droid Merchant game text is canceled. Also, while none of your ability on table is provided by aliens, retrieve 1 Force after each battle in which opponent's alien is lost (or 2 if Ewok, Elom or operative). (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Prepared Defenses.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans\par You Cannot Hide Forever\par You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points
Cancels: Droid Merchant game text.

Lore: Pirates, smugglers and Rebels operate from tiny camps which can be set up quickly and relocated at a moment's notice. A surprise visitor made Luke an unhappy camper.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on any exterior planet site where you have a Rebel or alien. You may deploy characters at this site, even without presence, regardless of location deployment restrictions.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once

Lore: The turning of Vader and the loss of Palpatine was the beginning of a new era for the entire galaxy.
Gametext: USED: Cancel Overseeing It Personally. OR Use 4 Force to cancel Vader's game text for remainder of turn. LOST: If Emperor just lost from table, draw destiny. Opponent must lose Force equal to the destiny draw.
Cancels: Overseeing It Personally\par Overseeing It Personally (V)\par Vader's game text for remainder of turn.

Lore: "Join me, and together we can rule the galaxy as father and son."
Gametext: USED: During a battle at a site, instead of firing one character weapon, cause one opponent's character present to be power -4 until end of turn. LOST: During a battle at a site, use 3 Force to cancel one battle destiny just drawn.
Cancels: One battle destiny just drawn.

Opponent loses 9 Force.\par If \b Luke\b0  loses, opponent must choose: Cross Luke to the Dark Side and lose X Force, where X = Luke's ability. OR Lose Luke and lose triple X Force.

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, D-2)\par Operatives are identified by their title, X Operative, with X being a system. The operative is considered a 'matching operative' for system X (e.g., Kiffex Operative is a matching operative for Kiffex). \par Operatives are restricted by special rules as follows: \par - You may not voluntarily deploy or move your operative to (or through) a location on its matching planet where you already have an operative (even if inactive) of the same card title. \par - If, at any time, two of your Operatives (even if inactive) of the same card title are at the same location on their matching planet, you must choose one to be lost (you may choose an inactive operative to be lost). \par - Your operative character on its matching planet may not apply its ability toward drawing battle destiny. Your operative may not control a location on its matching planet for any reason unless you have other cards there capable of controlling the location (e.g., an ability-1 character or a battle droid). Your operatives still occupy that location (and may battle or be battled), but may not Force drain or flip an objective alone.

Gametext: Deploy on table; shuffle your Reserve Deck, peek at top three cards, and stack them face-up here. During battle, may take a stacked card into hand to prevent all battle destiny draws from being modified or canceled (each player may draw no more than one battle destiny). (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Heading For The Medical Frigate.\par -----\par Article at DeckTech, September 19th, 2005\par Top 5 Battle-Aiding V-Cards (Light Side) by Armaedes and Shewski\par \par The reason this card is on the list is because it makes light side immunity mains good again. Now instead of dropping your EPP and taking out a couple of characters, you can drop down your immunity main and take out a couple of characters and still have the immunity main around next turn to drain on the location. This also stops your opponent from messing with your destiny draw via the senate objective, which is important if you want to really cause some battle damage. Although this card appears more defensive in nature it can actually be a very powerful offensive card.\par \par SHEWSKI'S TAKE:\par This ranks just outside my top 5 on both sides. CD/AAA have already conditioned you to getting more mileage out your immunity mains, this just reinforces that principle. I don't like this in the early game in case a key card gets trapped under the Effect, but mid-game onwards it is a welcome play. I think this will also give those decks that rely solely upon immunity mains (THGG, WHAP, Invasion) a little bump into playability. Remember, total battle destiny can still be affected!!\par -----\par This is the card old-school Star Wars CCG players have been waiting for since Reflections 3, a card that finally makes it to where your opponent can't use Boba Fett, Bounty Hunter, IG-88 With Riot Gun and 4-LOM With Concussion Rifle aboard Zuckuss In Mist Hunter to instantly end the game in a battle destiny-adding frenzy. Play this card - which you can start - and three battles per game you can limit both players to one battle destiny. Play two of this non-unique card and it's good for six battles per game, and few games have more than six battles (and not many have more than three).\par \par So besides limiting destiny-adding fetishes, what does this card really mean for light side? For one thing, it means light side immunity mains are back. Ben Kenobi being immune < 5 used to mean nothing when he was facing multiple draws. Now immune < 5 can only be cracked by a solid destiny draw. Luke Skywalker, Jedi Knight armed with his saber is basically immune to attrition. Obi-Wan Kenobi (V) is even better.\par \par This card also works well in space. Playing I'll Take The Leader to give your Outrider immunity < 6 is huge now. The Millenium Falcon with the same Admiral's Order out is only going down to a draw of 7 or better. Home One is basically invincible.\par \par This card really brings SWCCG back to where it should be - when main characters are able to stay on the table for more than a turn or two, and your opponent really has to bring the beats to get rid of a big, bad main. Matching pilot starships are also a lot stronger now, and all of this is tempered by the fact that you can't play Bright Hope (V) and Tantive IV (V) and rule the sky by cancelling your opponent's only destiny draw. This is also a great card to use if you find yourself going against a destiny-cancelling team, as using this effect will prevent your destiny draw from being cancelled.\par \par This card is going to make a lot of light side decks viable again, as they won't have to worry about the Super-Fett beatdown as much. Dont' get goldenrody though - your opponent will still be able to brign a lot of power in your direction. Below is a deck that takes advantage of the newfound respect light mains are going to get due to this card.
IsPulled: Don't Tread On Me (V)\par The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once

Gametext: Deploy on any site. 'Expands' your "game text" for that site to add to your "game text" at the adjacent sites.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Combo: Expand The Empire + Tatooine: Cantina + Tatooine: Lars' Moisture Farm + Tatooine: Jundland Wastes\par Deploy Expand The Empire at Tatooine: Lars' Moisture Farm, and it will add the gametext of that site to both adjacent sites. Now the Cantina is Force Drain +1 (making a total Force Drain of 3), and the Jundland Wastes are Force Drain +1 +1 (making a total Force Drain of 3).\par All this, and at all 3 sites you can add 1 to each of your weapon destiny draws.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-6)\par This Effect 'expands' game text to the adjacent sites, but it does not expand card titles, marker numbers etc. Thus, for example, it does not allow docking bay transit to or from a non-docking bay site. If Expand The Empire causes a site to have two copies of the same modifier, this does not violate the cumulative rule. For example, if a site has "Force drain +1 here" in its game text and adds another copy of the same game text ('expanded' from an adjacent site), then Force drains are +2 at that site. If game text expanded to an adjacent location contradicts the existing location game text, then the existing game text takes precedence.

Gametext: Plays on table. If opponent moves from a location you occupy during your turn (unless 'moving through' the location), they lose 2 Force. At end of opponent's turn, if you control two battlegrounds (a site and system) and opponent deployed a card with ability and did not initiate a battle, may retrieve 1 Force.
Information: Article at DeckTech, November 1st, 2005\par Top 5 Damage-Controlling V-Cards (Dark Side) by Armaedes and Shewski\par \par Much ballyhooed when first released, these "offensive" Defensive Shields became a popular staple among most Shield lists. It's very easy to play since its initiation conditions are similar to another standby, Battle Order/Plan. These shields work to discourage cowardly play, like running away from battles on your turn (Watch out for Honor reducing this!) or not fighting you when they deploy to the table. Many decks have been built so that they can take full advantage of this gametext. [...]\par \par ARMAEDES' TAKE:\par Excellent choice, this was actually #6 on my list. It barely missed the cut because the second portion of the text requires that you control a site and a system to make it work, and hardcore battling decks rarely do this. The part of the card that makes the opponent lose Force can be good, but frankly if your opponent has a choice between taking a beating and losing a measley two cards (which, as you point out, is reduced by Honor Of The Jedi), they're going to lose the 2 no questions asked. In other words, those this is a card that should be played in every battling deck, it doesn't actually help your big battles happen because the opponent is still able to use their "escape" cards, they just have to lose a couple of Force to do so - which oftentimes is a fair trade.
Combo: Firepower (V) + Ability, Ability, Ability\par During opponent's deploy phase, opponent must choose to deploy a card with ability or lose 2 Force.\par -----\par Firepower (V) - Defensive Shield + Set Your Course For Alderaan/The Ultimate Power In The Universe
Rules: (Errata) The game text '(unless 'moving through' the location)' added.

Gametext: If your pilot (or permanent pilot) is defending a battle alone at a system or sector, add one battle destiny. OR If Luke is defending a battle alone at a system or sector, add 1 to power and add one battle destiny.

Lore: "All right, don't lose your temper". Hoth hath no fury like a Wookiee scorned.
Gametext: USED: Cancel Wookiee Roar, Han's Back or Life Debt. LOST: If Han and Chewie are in a battle together, draw two destiny. Subtract total from opponent's attrition and total power (cannot fall below zero).
Cancels: Han's Back\par Life Debt\par Wookiee Roar

Lore: Installed at many facilities throughout the Empire to provide power to the Imperial spacefleet. Supplies starships with energy necessary for sub-light and hyperspace travel.
Gametext: Deploy on your starship at a system or sector where a related docking bay is on table. Adds 1 to hyperspeed, power and maneuver.

Lore: Uses standard fusion technology. Provides starships with energy for hyperspace travel. Installed at docking bays and throughout the Outer Rim Territories.
Gametext: Deploy on your starship at a system or sector where a related docking bay is on table. Adds 1 to hyperspeed, power and maneuver.
IsPulled: Corporal Beezer\par Portable Scanner

Lore: Standard medical droid used by Imperial field units. Enhanced programming allows FX-10 to treat a wide variety of battle wounds.
Gametext: Once per turn, your 'hit' non-droid character at same or adjacent site may go to your Used Pile rather than your Lost Pile.

Lore: Model nicknamed "Fixit" by Rebels at Echo Base. Though obsolete in advanced hospitals, FX-7 droids still operate at many Rebel outposts as assistant surgeons.
Gametext: Once per turn, your 'hit' non-droid character at same or adjacent site may go to your Used Pile rather than your Lost Pile. \b Cumulatively\b0  subtracts 2 from X on your Bacta Tank.
Information: Deploys free to Redemption.
Combo: FX-7 (Effex-Seven) + Bacta Tank

Lore: Notorious 'gaffi' weapon favored by Tusken Raiders. Built from scavenged metal. Intimidates and evokes fear.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on any Tusken Raider. If a battle has just been initiated where present, target a character for free; draw two destiny. If total destiny > 5, target's weapons are 'knocked away' (may not be used this battle).

Lore: Mosep's assistant. Accountant. \b Tax collector\b0. Enjoys tending to Jabba's skiffs with Barada.
Gametext: Deploys free to same site as Mosep. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While at Audience Chamber, adds 1 to your Force drains at Jabba's Palace sites.
Information: Game text is canceled by Freon Drevan.\par -----\par Game text is suspended by Loje Nella.
Combo: Gailid + Mosep
IsCanceledBy: Game text canceled by Freon Drevan if at same or adjacent site.

Gametext: Immune to Revolution.   While you occupy, once per battle you may choose a target just 'hit' by a blaster or rifle (except [Permanent Weapon] weapons) to be lost.
LightSideText: Immune to Revolution.
DarkSideText: While you occupy, once per battle you may choose a target just 'hit' by a blaster or rifle (except [Permanent Weapon] weapons) to be lost.
IsPulled: Commander Merrejk\par Kuat Drive Yards (V)\par Mobilization Points\par You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points

Lore: Strange wanderer. Rumored to have sacrificed himself in battle so that his comrades could live on. Survived and now stranded on Tatooine. He misses everything he'll never be.
Gametext: Adds 1 to power of anything he pilots. While Gamall is in battle, your other characters present with him may not be targeted by opponent's weapons. Place Gamall in Used Pile if he was just 'hit.' Power -2 while on Tatooine.
Information: Gamall Wironicc protects characters present with him from the targeting of a weapon.\par -----\par Beware of cards like Sorry About The Mess, Clash Of Sabers (Gamall must be in battle for his game text to work), Choke, and Chewbacca, Protector.
Combo: Gamall Wironicc + Chokk\par Power 11 while defending a battle and they double the weapons protection for your characters.

Lore: Works every time.
Gametext: If any gambler is defending a battle alone at a site, add one battle destiny (draw two destiny and choose one). OR If your Lando is defending a battle alone at a site, add two battle destiny (draw three and choose two).
Information: Gamblers are:\par \par Dash Rendar\par Devaronian\par Figrin D'an\par General Calrissian\par Han\par Han (V)\par Han Solo\par Han With Heavy Blaster Pistol\par Lando Calrissian\par Lando With Blaster Pistol\par Lando With Vibro-Ax\par Lieutenant s'Too Vees\par Max Rebo\par Sergeant Doallyn\par Tamtel Skreej\par Wioslea

Lore: Built by Snogrutt, a Gamorrean engineer. Ax head contains an ultrasonic generator. Jabba's Gamorrean guards sometimes switch the power off to prove their might.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your Gamorrean. Adds 1 to power. When present at a site, Gamorrean draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. May target a character or creature for free. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny > defense value.
Information: Gamorreans are:\par \par Gamorrean Guard\par Ghana Gleemort\par Ortugg\par Thok & Thug

Lore: Big. Strong. Dumb.
Gametext: Deploys only to Tatooine. Power -1 when not at a Tatooine site. May be sacrificed (lost) to cancel an attack just initiated by a creature present.

Lore: Well-known as a \b gambler\b0  and a \b gangster\b0. Gardulla was the former owner of Shmi and Anakin Skywalker before she lost them in a bet to the Toydarian junk dealer, Watto.
Gametext: When you retrieve Force from Boonta Eve Podrace, any or all of your retrieved Force may be taken into hand. Once during your control phase, may use 1 Force; opponent draws one destiny. If destiny > 2, you retrieve 1 Force. Otherwise, lose 1 Force.

Lore: Long-nosed, male Kubaz from Kubindi. \b Spy\b0. Squealed on Obi-Wan and Luke outside Docking Bay 94. Works for Jabba the Hutt or the highest bidder. Not particularly brave.
Gametext: When at same location as a Rebel of ability > 2, deploy -1 there for any Imperials, and during your move phase, Imperials at an adjacent site may move there for free.
IsPulled: Murttoc Yine
Combo: Garindan + Nevar Yalnal

Lore: Saurin combat expert. Hired by Jabba to train his Gamorrean guards. Regrets taking the job. Dislikes Jabba and his henchbeings. Plotting to kill Jabba.
Gametext: While at Audience Chamber, all your other Saurins are forfeit +2 and all your characters trained by Sai'torr Kal Fas are power and forfeit +1.

Lore: Free-trader who imports ice chunks from rings of Ohann and Adriana, outer planets in Tatoo system. Sales remain cold ... due to steep Imperial taxes and bribes.
Gametext: Adds 1 to power of anything he pilots. Adds 1 to forfeit of each of your characters at same Tatooine site. Subtracts 1 from forfeit of each of opponent's characters at same Hoth site. Game text suspended if at same site as a tax collector.

Lore: Snivvian \b scout\b0. Enjoys exploring new planets and charting difficult terrain. Paid very well by Jabba to do so. Unsure of his employer's motivations.
Gametext: During your control phase, if at an exterior planet site, may use 2 Force to search your Reserve Deck, take a related site into hand and reshuffle. While at Audience Chamber, all your other Snivvians are forfeit +2.
Pulls: Related exterior planet site.
IsPulled: General Crix Madine\par Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control).

Lore: Bad-tempered \b smuggler\b0. Makes a few credits more helping Jabba collect debts. Highly regarded for his uncanny anticipation in battle. Searching for Debnoli.
Gametext: May deploy for free to your [Independent] starship. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Power +2 when present with an opponent's smuggler. When targeted by a weapon, subtract one from each weapon destiny.
IsPulled: Elis in Hinthra (V)\par Murttoc Yine

Lore: \b Leader\b0. \b Gambler\b0. Fair pilot. Lando was given the rank of General for "a little maneuver" at the Battle of Taanab. Willing to lead Rebel starfighters in a crazy attack.
Gametext: Deploys -2 aboard \ul Falcon\ul0. Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting a freighter, adds 1 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. When he attempts to "blow away" Death Star II, adds 2 to total.
Information: Lando Calrissian personas are:\par \par General Calrissian\par Lando Calrissian\par Lando Calrissian (V)\par Lando Calrissian, Scoundrel\par Lando Calrissian, Unlikely Hero (V)\par [Lando In Millennium Falcon]\par Lando With Blaster Pistol\par Lando With Vibro-Ax\par Tamtel Skreej\par \par Lando Calrissian (Dark Side)\par Lando Calrissian (V) (Dark Side)
IsPulled: Balanced Attack\par Cloud City: Security Tower\par Lobot (V) as a 'react'.\par Rebel Leadership (V)\par Seeking An Audience (V)\par Strike Planning\par Yavin 4: Massassi War Room (V)
MatchingWeapon: Lando's Blaster Rifle

Lore: One of the original founders of the Rebel Alliance. Former civilian strategist with the House of Organa. Somber \b leader\b0  of Echo Base.
Gametext: Adds 1 to power of each of your Rebels present at same Hoth site. May use 1 Force to cancel Death Squadron. While at an Echo site, opponent must occupy an additional Hoth site to cancel Echo Base Operations.
IsPulled: Balanced Attack\par Hoth: Echo Corridor (V)\par Princess Organa\par Rebel Leadership (V)\par Strike Planning\par Yavin 4: Massassi War Room (V)

Lore: Military advisor to Mon Mothma. \b Leader\b0  of commando project. Corellian native. Defected to the Alliance shortly after the Battle of Yavin. Rescued by Rogue Squadron.
Gametext: Once during each of your deploy phases, may take one scout of ability < 3 into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While at your war room or aboard your capital starship, adds 1 to immunity to attrition of all your scouts who have immunity.

Lore: Skilled tactician and natural \b leader\b0. Planned attack on Death Star after analyzing technical readouts provided by Princess Leia. Star Destroyer captain during Old Republic.
Gametext: Increases Rebel Planners by 1, doubles if at same site. May use 1 Force to cancel Wrong Turn. Each Rebel present with him at a Yavin 4 site is power +1.

Lore: After uniting the Gungans and the Naboo, Boss Nass promoted Jar Jar Binks to General. He's still a bit clumsy.
Gametext: Once per game may take Brisky Morning Munchen into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per battle, may use 1 Force to target an opponent's droid present. Both players draw destiny. If your destiny +1 > opponent's destiny, target lost.

Lore: Commander from Ralltiir. Fled from his homeworld after its occupation by the Empire. Was instrumental in the establishment of the new Rebel base on Hoth.
Gametext: While McQuarrie is on Hoth, your Hoth Sentry is not unique (*), is doubled, deploys free, applies all three of its modifiers and is immune to Alter. Power -1 when not on Hoth.
IsPulled: Balanced Attack\par Rebel Leadership (V)\par Strike Planning
Combo: General McQuarrie + Hoth Sentry

Lore: \b Scout\b0. \b Leader\b0  of the Rebel strike team on Endor. Needed the cleverness of a Corellian to destroy the Endor control bunker. Discovered the truth about Luke and Leia.
Gametext: Deploys -2 on \ul Falcon\ul0, \ul Tydirium\ul0  or Endor. Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When in battle with Chewie (or another of your scouts at an exterior site), may use 2 Force to cancel one opponent's battle destiny just drawn. Immune to attrition < 3.

Lore: Oversees defense operations of Death Star. Outstanding tactician. No-nonsense \b leader\b0. Member of House of Tagge, a powerful noble family and corporate conglomerate.
Gametext: Tagge's forfeit +1 for each Imperial trooper, of any kind, present with him at a site.
IsPulled: Blizzard 4\par Imperial Command\par The Empire's Back
Combo: General Tagge + Lone Warrior\par Add two battle destinies if General Tagge is defending a battle alone at a site.\par -----\par General Tagge + Commander Igar\par When Commander Igar is in battle with Tagge, may use 2 Force to cancel and redraw one just-drawn battle destiny.

Lore: General Maximillian Veers is the model of Imperial Army officer. Cunning, loyal and ruthlessly efficient \b leader\b0. In charge of the ground assault troops in Vader's forces.
Gametext: Power +1 when at same site as Admiral Ozzel. Adds 1 to power of each Imperial at same Hoth site. Adds 3 to power of any combat vehicle he pilots. On Blizzard 1, also adds 1 to armor and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
Information: Veers personas are:\par \par General Veers\par General Veers (V)\par Veers
IsPulled: Blizzard 4\par Imperial Command

Lore: General Maximillian Veers is the model of Imperial Army officer. Cunning, loyal and ruthlessly efficient \b leader\b0. In charge of the ground assault troops in Vader's forces.
Gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots, While piloting an AT-AT, draws two battle destiny if unable to otherwise. While piloting a combat vehicle, its immunity to attrition is +2.
Information: Veers personas are:\par \par General Veers\par General Veers (V)\par Veers\par
IsPulled: Blizzard 4\par Imperial Command
Combo: General Veers (V) + Commander Igar\par When in battle with Veers or Tagge, Commander Igar may use 2 Force to cancel and redraw one just-drawn battle destiny.

Lore: Engineer who worked with Jan Dodonna to design the A-wing starfighter. Given honorary rank due to his service to the Rebellion.
Gametext: Deploys -2 aboard your Star Cruiser or to same location as your Admiral. Adds 1 to power of anything he pilots. Adds 1 to power and forfeit of each of your A-wings at same and related locations.
IsPulled: Balanced Attack\par Rebel Leadership (V)\par Strike Planning
Combo: General Walex Blissex + A-wing
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-7)\par If deploying to a Home One site when Home One is not on table, Blissex does not deploy at -2 because you cannot establish that this site is aboard a "star cruiser". See starship sites.

Lore: Versatility is key to the Rebellion. The Rebel's ability to adapt to any situation is well-known.
Gametext: Target two non-creature vehicles with maneuver (one yours, one opponent's) present at same site. Both players draw destiny, add your vehicle's maneuver to your total. Lowest total loses vehicle. OR Your speeder bike piloted by Luke or a scout adds one battle destiny.

Lore: The Queen's plan called for the remnants of Bravo Flight to eliminate the Droid Control Ship. Not an easy task.
Gametext: Deploy on table. Once during your deploy phase, may reveal an unpiloted starfighter from hand to take its matching pilot character from Reserve Deck (or vice versa) and deploy both simultaneously; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Heading For The Medical Frigate.\par -----\par Same game text as Squadron Assignements (DSII).
Pulls: An unpiloted starfighter and matching pilot (or vice versa).
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once

Lore: Part of Jabba's Gamorrean security force. Negotiating with the B'omarr monks regarding his possible defection.
Gametext: Your Force generation at same site is +X, where X equals the number of opponent's aliens at same and adjacent sites. May lose 1 Force to cancel a Force drain at an adjacent site.
Cancels: A Force drain at an adjacent site.

Lore: \b Dejarik\b0  of creature from Clak'dor VII. Ghhhk rise with the dawn, screeching their mating calls across the jungle. Locals use their skin oils as a healing salve.
Gametext: During the damage segment of a battle you lost, if you have no cards left that can be forfeited, cancel all remaining battle damage. (Immune to Sense.) OR Cancel Nightfall.
Information: Mind Tricks Don't Work On Me has similar text and is an Effect.\par -----\par This card can be a real life saver.\par -----\par Combo Card: Ghhhk & Those Rebels Won't Escape Us
IsPulled: Masterful Move\par Masterful Move & Endor Occupation
Combo: Ghhhk + Imperial Holotable + Mosep\par Mosep should be one of the prime force drain members, as the loss will come straight from the Light Side Reserve Deck.\par -----\par Ghhhk + Sunsdown + Defel\par Defel under "night time conditions" fits the theme of this deck perfectly, as he can avoid combat, thus saving the use of the Ghhhk, and still be there for the counter attack.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-7)\par (Errata) You may use the damage canceling ability of this card if you have no cards left capable of being forfeited. Thus, cards that are not participating in the battle or that do not have a forfeit value (e.g., a Vaporator) are ignored.\par
Cancels: All remaining battle damage if you just forfeited all cards that participated in a battle you lost.\par Nightfall

CardName: Ghhhk & Those Rebels Won't Escape Us

Cancels: One react.\par Nabrun Leids\par Hyper Escape\par Closer?!\par Landing Claw

Lore: Wol Cabbasshite. Immobile. Species evolved from parasites. Mistakenly left in Jabba's palace. No one suspects his intelligence. Often tries to lick passersby.
Gametext: Deploys only at interior sites. Cannot move. During a battle at same site, may target one character present. Draw destiny. If destiny +3 > ability, target may not use ability toward drawing battle destiny this turn.

Cancels: Target's ability toward drawing destiny

Lore: Military repulsorlift armed with three light repeating blasters. With a top speed of 160 kilometers per hour, they have the ability to out-flank an opponent in battle.
Gametext: May add 1 driver and 3 passengers. May move as a 'react' to Naboo sites. Your battle destiny draws at same site are +1 for each of your Royal Naboo Security present. (Limit +3.)
Information: Royal Naboo Security are:\par \par Corporal Rushing\par Jerus Jannick\par Lieutenant Chamberlyn\par Officer Perosei\par Panaka, Protector Of The Queen\par Royal Naboo Security Officer

Lore: Luke relied on Obi-Wan's knowledge and advice to learn the ways of the Force. Obi-Wan continued to counsel Luke long after the old Jedi's apparent 'death.'

Lore: "Traveling through hyperspace ain't like dustin' crops, boy!" Gravititational phenomena cast shadows in hyperspace, posing a serious threat to lightspeed navigation.
Gametext: If opponent's starship has just begun to move through hyperspace, draw destiny. If destiny > pilot's ability, starship must return to original location and may not move this turn. If destiny = pilot's ability, starship is lost.
Information: Almost always a surprise to your opponent.\par You move or deploy a huge fleet to a system your opponent occupies and wait for his move phase when he tries to move all his ships away.\par Unless your opponent is really savvy and moves them one at a time, you can choose which will be the target of Gravity Shadow. And even if he does move one at a time, grab one of the last ones. It's now your huge fleet vs. his one ship for a beatdown, made even better with Lateral Damage. This card can also be used to manipulate a Light Side deck whose ships are running around on you.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-7)\par Gravity Shadow may target a starship whenever it attempts to move through hyperspace, even during a battle (for example, using a card such as Hit And Run or Hyper Escape). This Interrupt targets a starship and its highest-ability pilot (whether a permanent pilot or a character acting as a pilot). See Starships - Permanent Pilots, Ch. 9.

Lore: Experienced pilots keep a well equipped toolkit. Horizontal boosters, alluvial dampers and hydrospanners aid in performing high-tech repairs aboard starships.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on one of you characters, vehicles or starships (free on \ul Falcon\ul0  or Han). While aboard a vehicle or starship, you may use 1 Force to cancel any Interrupt or Effect of any kind which targets that vehicle or starship.

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, F-1)\par Han's Toolkit cannot be used in an "all cards" situation. For instance, when Overwhelmed is played, it targets all starships present, so Han's Toolkit cannot cancel it.
Cancels: Any Interrupt or Effect of any kind which targets this vehicle or starship.
IsCanceledBy: Turn It Off! Turn It Off!

Lore: Ishi Tib accountant. Experienced administrator. Freelance consultant. Worked for many planetary governors. Knows how to get the most out of any taxation scheme.
Gametext: Power +1 at a swamp. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While at a battleground site, whenever you must lose Force from a Force drain at an adjacent site, may reduce the loss by X by using X Force.

Lore: Ishi Tib accountant. Experienced administrator. Freelance consultant. Worked for many planetary governors. Knows how to get the most out of any taxation scheme.
