Lore: "Wha-? Chuba da noya!"
Gametext: USED: During battle, place top card of opponent's Lost Pile on top of their Reserve Deck. LOST: Use 1 Force to 'repair' your Podracer. OR Target a Podracer. Draw destiny. If destiny > Podracer's destiny number, target is 'damaged.'
Information: You've always had the chance to stack your own destiny draws, but now you have the chance to stack your opponent's as well. If there's going to be a crucial destiny draw in a battle (and what battle doesn't?), you can stack a low destiny on top of your opponent's deck. You are retrieving a Force for your opponent, but he won't be thanking you when Admiral Ozzel is flipped for battle destiny.\par \par The lost portion can also be useful in a podracing deck. You can repair your Podracer so you don't need to lose Force to keep the race going, or you can take a shot at damaging your opponent's Podracer to make him pay the price to stay in the race.
IsPulled: We Wish To Board At Once

Lore: Congratulations on purchasing the TIE/ln starfighter by Sienar. Equipped with a jettison device and distress beacon, it should provide you with years of worry-free subjugation.
Gametext: If a pilot was just lost from a system or sector, deploy on that location and stack pilot here. Pilot may be rescued or captured by any capital starship present here during any move phase, and may be targeted by wespons (except during battle) as if present (treat as a starfighter with defense value = 0). Lost if no pilot here.
IsPulled: Fanfare\par Fanfare - Defensive Shield\par Fanfare (V) - Defensive Shield\par Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: Survival training becomes essential when an Imperial scout trooper is separated from his speeder bike.
Gametext: Cancel a Force drain at an exterior planet site where opponent has no vehicles or starships. Draw destiny. If destiny > number of opponent's characters at that site, choose one of those characters to be missing.
Cancels: A Force drain at an exterior planet site where opponent has no starships or vehicles.

Lore: Asteroid fields require starfighters to act as comm relays, forwarding orders to the squadron via subspace AE-35 Transceivers. If ships are lost, communications break down.
Gametext: Target one opponent's starfighter present with your starship at an asteroid sector, before asteroid destiny is drawn this turn. If target lost this turn due to asteroid destiny, opponent also loses Force equal to target's forfeit value.

Lore: Primary Neimoidian \b senator\b0  who represents the Trade Federation in the Galactic Senate. Thwarted attempts by Amidala to end the blockade of Naboo.
Gametext: \b Agendas\b0 : ambition, blockade, trade. While in a senate majority, once during your control phase, may search your Force Pile and take any one card there into hand; reshuffle. While at Galactic Senate, your other Neimoidians are forfeit +2.
Information: Lott Dod works his magic in a variety of places. With his ambition agenda, he gets an extra bonus when drawn for destiny if you have flipped My Lord, Is That Legal? Since he has a trade agenda, if he's on This is Outrageous!, you can use him to 'trade' unneeded cards in hand for a shot at a needed card from your Lost Pile. His blockade agenda is also useful, even if he's not at the Senate. When on Our Blockade is Perfectly Legal, he helps you 'blockade' your opponent by hindering your opponent's out of phase movement.\par \par But he also helps you when he's on the table, imagine that! With his blockade agenda, he lets you flip My Lord, Is That Legal? with one less senator. But perhaps more importantly, if you have political control of the Galactic Senate, he gives you access to an incredibly powerful ability. Letting you look through your Force Pile allows you to take a key card into hand; it could be a critical character you need to battle, a matching weapon for your Darth Maul, or any other card, it can all be yours, if you have a Senate majority. And in a pinch he helps his fellow Neimoidians out by adding to their forfeit.
Pulls: Any card from Force Pile
IsPulled: Lord Sidious\par Squabbling Delegates\par The Phantom Menace
Combo: Lott Dod + Our Blockade Is Perfectly Legal\par -----\par Lott Dod + This Is Outrageous!\par -----\par Lott Dod + I Will Make It Legal! + senate majority

Lore: Made on Dantooine. Luke used the many pockets in his gundark-skin backpack to carry supplies while on patrol.
Gametext: Deploy on your character. May carry and use any number of devices. May also carry Yoda, Kabe or any one Jawa or Ewok (as if riding a creature vehicle). Adds 1 to training destiny when carrying the mentor.
IsPulled: Corporal Beezer\par Hero Of A Thousand Devices\par Portable Scanner
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-11)\par Luke's Backpack permits a character to carry another character around. This means that whenever the character wearing the backpack moves, the character in the backpack automatically moves with him or her per the carry cards rules (see Movement - Carrying Cards, Ch. 7). The character in the backpack is not enclosed within it and will still occupy capacity slots on vehicles and starships. Whenever either character is targeted by an action that will make them inactive (e.g., being captured, missing) the other will also suffer the same fate. When that happens, the character in the backpack automatically disembarks.

Lore: Merr-Sonn Model 57. Part of an arms lot purchased for the Alliance from a black market dealer on Ord Mantell. Carried by Luke as backup for his father's lightsaber.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on Luke, 3 on your other warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 2 Force. (If targeted by Luke, target loses any immunity to attrition for remainder of turn.) Draw destiny. Add 1 if targeting a character or creature. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
Information: This weapon works well in a deck that relies on personal weapons to give bonuses. While Luke carries this weapon, Princess Leia is free to use Anakin's Lightsaber. The advantage of this card is that it does not even need to hit a character to have some nice bonuses, just target them.\par \par The deploy cost can be a little high when compared with the personal sabers, but the advantage is that Luke's pistol will work a little more consistently in having its most powerful effect then the sabers will when facing high ability characters. Additionally, with a number of four destiny cards in the deck, pretty much everyone is vulnerable to this except Vader, Fett and IG-88.
IsPulled: Portable Scanner

Rebels and Aliens mix and match all the time in a Light deck (look at Han and Chewbacca! ), thus by playing this recyclable five destiny card to have a good chance of reducing attrition against you in a battle to zero sounds pretty good to me! And if Han shows up, you have even a better chance of avoiding battle damage in that battle!
Cancels: Frozen Assets

Lore: Contains wrist lasers, rocket dart launchers, a flame projector, a projectable grappling hook, a concussion grenade launcher, four kinds of sensors and a broad band antenna.
Gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on any alien or Imperial (except Vader or Boba Fett). Character is power +2, has armor = 5 and is immune to attrition < 3.
Information: It's a dangerous universe, and your characters need all the protection they can get. Blasters, Bowcasters even Lightsabers are constant hazards. What's the best way to protect them? Put them in a set of Armor. That's where Mandalorian Armor comes in.\par In a word, Wow! This one device gives your valuable character the characteristics of everyone's favorite bounty hunter. Give your opponent something else to target with that armor of 5. Immunity to attrition is always a bonus, not to mention the power +2. Imagine Grand Moff Tarkin protected by armor 5, canceling battle destiny with his buddy Vader. Tarkin will no longer be Lightsaber bait! How about everyone's favorite Jawa, Dathcha, running around at power 4 with immunity to attrition of less than 3. Or, if you're into raw power, how about throwing Kitik Keed'kak into Mandalorian Armor. Power 10, immunity to attrition of less than 3 and armor to protect that ability of 1!
IsPulled: Any Methods Necessary (V)

Lore: Most space-faring adventurers meet their fate with a calm, quiet dignity.
Gametext: If Boba Fett is defending a battle, draw one destiny. Subtract that amount from opponent's attrition and total power (cannot fall below zero). OR Cancel, for remainder of turn, the game text of Jet Pack or any weapon that may fire repeatedly.
Information: This a rather bland card that may find a use against the many bounty hunter decks running around. If people continue to play with their favorite character, Boba Fett, we may see a use for the first part of this destiny 5, Used Interrupt. It allows you to draw destiny and to subtract that number from the opponents power and attrition total if Fett is defending in the battle. The second function simply cancels Jet Pack's game text or any weapon that fires repeatedly. Neither of these are used very often and despite the high destiny on the card, it will probably be too specific to see much time in the field.
Cancels: Game text of Jet Pack.\par Game text of any weapon that may fire repeatedly.\par Game text of Antipersonnel Laser Cannon.\par Game text of AT-ST Dual Cannon.\par Game text of Boba Fett's Blaster Rifle.\par Game text of Dr. Evazan's Sawed-off Blaster.\par Game text of Light Repeating Blaster Rifle.

Lore: \b Dejarik\b0  game uses holograms of mythological and real creatures from across the galaxy. The hulking Mantellian savrip is a nasty predator from Ord Mantell.
Gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on your side of table (free if C-3PO on table). After losing any battle: characters, starships and vehicles may be forfeited directly from your hand (for forfeit value) to reduce attrition or battle damage.
Information: There is no dark counterpart, but Sacrifice has similar text.\par -----\par One of the most useful Effects in the game for the Light Side. With Mantellian Savrip on table, you need not lose characters from the site/system, but satisfy that damage by losing a character or starship from hand.\par One major problem is that most Dark Side players run a copy of Masterful Move in their decks.\par -----\par Hindsight deployed on C-3PO makes Mantellian Savrip immune to Alter.
IsPulled: Escape Pod (V)\par Holoprojector\par The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once
Combo: Mantellian Savrip + BG-J38\par Adds 2 to the destiny of each of your holograms and dejariks drawn for battle destiny or weapon destiny.\par -----\par Mantellian Savrip + Brainiac\par Brainiac's forfeit is equal to the total number of cards in your opponent's hand, so he often may be sacrificed to the Mantellian Savrip to cover all battle damage and attrtion against you.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-11)\par This Effect allows you to forfeit cards that have a forfeit value directly from your hand during the damage segment of a battle you have lost. This is treated the same as normal forfeiture, satisfying battle damage and/or attrition (simultaneously if both need to be satisfied). Cards forfeited from hand with Mantellian Savrip must be placed in the Lost Pile regardless of any other game text. For example, a character may not be forfeited from hand to the Bacta Tank, and the Star Cruiser Liberty may not be forfeited from hand to the Used Pile.
IsCanceledBy: Masterful Move\par Masterful Move & Endor Occupation\par Suspended by Cold Feet (V) for remainder of turn.

Lore: Jedi Master currently not on the Council. Although he serves the Council well, there have been times when he has defied their wishes to pursue a path he believes is right.
Gametext: Deploys -2 on Coruscant. If opponent's Dark Jedi on table, during your move phase may use 4 Force to return Qui-Gon (and all cards on him) to owner's hand. Immune to attrition and You Are Beaten.
Information: Qui-Gon Jinn personas are:\par \par Master Qui-Gon\par Master Qui-Gon (V)\par Qui-Gon Jinn\par Qui-Gon Jinn With Lightsaber\par Qui-Gon Jinn, Jedi Master\par -----\par Qui-Gon has the usual high stats you would expect from a Jedi Master who still actively serves the Old Republic. He's able to "teleport" by returning to your hand and then be available to be deployed elsewhere the next turn (or even deploy a different version of him instead). Using 4 Force is expensive but it can not be canceled by Sense or blocked by anything else normally.\par \par The other good part about Qui-Gon is that he is immune to You Are Beaten, ensuring that he can not be excluded from a battle that way. You can count on him to be there to protect other characters with him, just like the true guardian he is.
IsPulled: Padme Naberrie\par Tatooine: City Outskirts
MatchingWeapon: Qui-Gon Jinn's Lightsaber\par Qui-Gon's Lightsaber

Lore: Shields protect destroyer droids from incoming or deflected blaster fire. Starfighter cannons, on the other hand, can cause some problems.
Gametext: USED: Target a character at same site as two of your destroyer droids. For remainder of turn, target may not fire weapons and is power -2. LOST: Lose 1 Force to take up to three non-unique destroyer droids into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
Information: If we could name the LOST functions separately, this one may have been "I Want Droidekas Up Here!". It's a fast way to get three non-unique fighting droids out. Basically 1 Force lost and 9 Foce used to get nine power, a destiny draw and three permanent weapons on table! Once you have them in play, use the destiny 5 USED text to activate your shields and spring a little surprise on the over-confident Jedi with saber!
Pulls: Three non-unique destroyer droids\par Destroyer Droid

Lore: A skillful hologamer nullifies the advantage of even the most powerful game piece with clever maneuvering.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to take one hologram, dejarik or Imperial Holotable into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Cancel Mantellian Savrip. OR Cancel opponent's Force drain at a holosite.
Information: Combo Card: Masterful Move & Endor Occupation\par -----\par This is a unique Dark Side Used Interrupt with a sweet destiny of 6 that belongs in just about every deck.\par It can set up the holotable rather quickly, but what's best is that it allows you to grab important cards such as Visage Of The Emperor, Monnok, Ghhhk, HoloNet Transmission, etc. when you need them. After doing this, the destiny 6 interrupt goes back into your deck!\par The most important use of this card is that it cancels Mantellian Savrip, an Effect which severely hampers the Dark Side's ability to inflict battle damage effectively.
Pulls: Ghhhk\par HoloNet Transmission\par Image Of The Dark Lord\par Image Of The Dark Lord (V)\par Imperial Holotable\par Kintan Strider\par Molator\par Monnok\par Ng'ok\par The Phantom Menace\par Revenge Of The Sith (V)\par Visage Of The Emperor
Cancels: Mantellian Savrip\par Opponent's Force drain at a holosite.

Pulls: Ghhhk\par HoloNet Transmission\par Image Of The Dark Lord\par Image Of The Dark Lord (V)\par Imperial Holotable\par Kintan Strider\par Molator\par Monnok\par Ng'ok\par The Phantom Menace\par Revenge Of The Sith (V)\par Visage Of The Emperor

Lore: A Sith needs no introduction.
Gametext: If Maul in battle with a Jedi, add one battle destiny (two if Jedi is Qui-Gon). OR Use 1 Force to take any lightsaber into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR Target a Jedi present with Maul; they duel: Both players draw 2 destiny. Loser (lowest total) is lost.
Information: The biggest complaint about Darth Maul from Tatooine was that his support cards were a bit weak when compared to Darth Vader or Ben Kenobi. Some things just take time, and Maul can happily take a big step up the main character chain with Maul Strikes.\par \par The three uses this card has are all extremely powerful. When you draw this card, one of its uses will almost certainly be needed immediately. Light Side players have been able to pull Lightsabers out of their decks for years with Gift Of The Mentor, and now Maul Strikes allows the Dark Side to finally have their turn at this great ability.\par \par Another minor weakness of the Tatooine persona of Darth Maul was that his ability to duel was a bit restricted, since he had to essentially survive an entire turn before he had the chance to duel anybody. With Maul Strikes, however, the Sith Lord can bypass that restriction, and duel at any time by simply playing this interrupt.\par \par And finally, if you're looking for just some good old beatdown, Maul can add battle destiny with this card too. Instead of just dueling Qui-Gon and making him lost, why not battle him, cut him, and draw three battle destiny as well? The answer is simple.
Pulls: Dark Jedi Lightsaber\par Darth Vader's Lightsaber\par Darth Vader's Lightsaber (V)\par Dooku's Lightsaber\par Kylo Ren's Lightsaber\par Mara Jade's Lightsaber\par Maul's Double-Bladed Lightsaber\par Maul's Lightsaber\par Vader's Lightsaber
IsCanceledBy: Mindful Of The Future (V)\par Strike Blocked

Information: Maul's lightsaber 'personas' are:\par \par Maul's Double-Bladed Lightsaber\par Maul's Lightsaber\par Darth Maul With Lightsaber\par Lord Maul With Lightsaber

MatchingWeapon: Darth Maul\par Darth Maul With Lightsaber\par Darth Maul, Lone Hunter\par Darth Maul, Young Apprentice\par Lord Maul\par Lord Maul With Lightsaber

Lore: Advanced optics used by Darth Maul to help track Queen Amidala. Image enhancement features allow for better sensor readings.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on Maul. At any time you may use 1 Force to peek at the top card of your Force Pile. You may move that card to the top of your Reserve Deck.
Information: They only deploy on Maul, but he should be in your deck anyway, right? And while the actual mechanic of fixing destiny is a bit different when compared to the Light Side, the raw power of it is still there.\par While Maul's Electrobinoculars will eat up your Force Pile fast, the Dark Side also has an infinite number of situations where fixing up a destiny would be desirable, i.e., before a duel, or before drawing race/battle/weapon destiny.\par You can also get to that one crucial card in your Force Pile without junking up your hand. Pay a Force to look, if it's not the card you need put it back, and continue the process until you get to the card you need!
Combo: Maul's Electrobinoculars + any card that initiates a duel\par Guarantee yourself a solid start on any duel you initiate. A great deal, considering winning a duel is a rather large step toward victory in any game!

Lore: Trained in the Sith arts, Maul's ferocity in combat is matched by no other. When armed with a lightsaber, his opponent's only option is usually that of escape.
Gametext: Deploy on Maul. While on Maul, may not be stolen. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
Information: Maul's lightsaber 'personas' are:\par \par Maul's Double-Bladed Lightsaber\par Maul's Lightsaber\par Darth Maul With Lightsaber\par Lord Maul With Lightsaber\par  -----\par When Maul is using this weapon, it cannot be stolen. This simple bit of gametext protects Maul's Lightsaber from annoying interrupts like Weapon Levitation, that can result in the Dark Side suddenly finding itself weaponless in a battle.\par \par In addition, Maul can make excellent use of his weapon. Darth Maul (Tatooine Expansion) can effectively ignore the presence of Light Side characters of ability less than 4. This means he can Force drain while at their site, using Maul's Lightsaber to add 1 to the Force drain. He can also use cards like Sniper to take pot-shots at those poor, low-ability characters, gradually reducing their numbers at his site. Light Side alien swarm decks will want to avoid this armed Dark Jedi as much as possible.\par \par Finally, like other lightsabers, Maul's Lightsaber gets two weapons destiny draws, making it easier to hit even high-ability characters like Obi-Wan and Qui-Gon. Maul also has the advantage of using Maul's Electrobinoculars to rig a high destiny draw, practically guaranteeing a hit against even a Jedi Master if you take the time!
IsPulled: I Will Finish What You Started\par Maul Strikes
MatchingWeapon: Darth Maul\par Darth Maul With Lightsaber\par Darth Maul, Lone Hunter\par Darth Maul, Young Apprentice\par Lord Maul\par Lord Maul With Lightsaber

Gametext: May add 2 pilots. Maul deploys -3 aboard. While Maul piloting, immune to attrition and during your move phase, may lose 2 Force to 'cloak' (does not participate in battles) until end of next turn.

Combo: Maul's Sith Infiltrator + Darth Maul on Tatooine system\par Deploy for 6 (!)
Matching: Darth Maul\par Darth Maul With Lightsaber\par Darth Maul, Lone Hunter\par Darth Maul, Young Apprentice\par Lord Maul\par Lord Maul With Lightsaber

Lore: Ortolan \b musician\b0  and \b gambler\b0. Head of The Max Rebo Band. Signed a lifetime contract to Jabba in exchange for unlimited food.
Gametext: Power +2 on Hoth. If at same site as another of your musicians, you may play Bith Shuffle to cancel a Force drain at an adjacent site. While at Audience Chamber, all your other musicians are deploy -1 and forfeit +3.
Information: Oddly enough, people may begin to play with Bith Shuffle because of this card alone. Max's ability to cancel a Force drain at a neighboring site can do wonders for saving Force, especially if Max is sitting at a location that your opponent doesn't particularly want to go. Thus, Max usually requires a bodyguard of some kind.
Combo: Max Rebo vs. Walker Garrison - If played correctly, Max can be the centerpiece of a deck which has to play against AT-AT's a lot. With his Power bonus, he becomes a reasonably potent character, and with his Force drain cancelling game text, he can stop at least one of the massive drains pumped out by Walker Garrison.\par \par Max Rebo + Audience Chamber in a Jess-based deck - The musician deck is ready to rock as Max's deploy bonus decreases the already low deploy cost of the musicians, and Jess's text is made more useful.

Lore: The massive war machines of the Empire require tremendous effort to maintain combat readiness.
Gametext: Deploy on an exterior site. Target an opponent's combat vehicle at a related site. Target's power and forfeit = 0. When target reaches Utinni Effect, target draws one destiny. Utinni Effect canceled if destiny > 2. Otherwise, draw again next move phase, etc.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Yotts Orren

Lore: To prepare for the inevitable conflict with Jabba's minions, Luke entered a calm state of mental preparation.
Gametext: Deploy on your character of ability > 3 (Effect lost if that character battles this turn). On a subsequent turn, if in a battle at a site, character's total weapon destiny is +3 and character adds one battle destiny. Effect lost at end of that battle.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Wokling (V)

Lore: Modern Corellian design. Length 100 meters. Features engine system similar to that of a Corellian corvette. Dorsal hatch reveals hangar bay.
Gametext: Deploys and moves like a starfighter. May add 2 pilots, 6 passengers and 1 vehicle. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Has ship-docking capability. Quad Laser Cannon may deploy aboard.
IsPulled: Local Defense

Lore: Merr-Sonn Mark II repeating blaster. Accepts power cells from a very wide variety of sources, a benefit for Rebels accustomed to scavenging for supplies.
Gametext: Deploy on a site. May be moved by two warriors for 1 additional Force. Your warrior present may target up to two characters or creatures at same or adjacent site using 2 Force. Draw two destiny. Target(s) hit if total destiny > total defense value.
Information: Captain Yutani may move Medium Repeating Blaster Cannon alone for free.
IsPulled: Captain Yutani\par Portable Scanner
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-11)\par (Errata) This card permits you to move two warriors using only their landspeed as a single movement action (this weapon must move with them). If performed as a normal move, then both warriors are performing a regular move (see movement - regular - using landspeed) and you must use 1 Force for each (plus 1 additional Force for the weapon).

Lore: Passenger and cargo transport built by Gallofree Yards. Enormous cargo bays can be outfitted to safely accommodate large numbers of troops, munitions or supplies.
Gametext: Deploys and moves like a starfighter. May add 1 pilot, 4 passengers and 1 vehicle. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1.
Information: If you put this ship into a situation where it is unlikely to be battled (i.e. - the Clouds on Dagobah) it begins to shine. The most common way that the Dark Side has to overrun the Clouds on Dagobah, is to move a Star Destroyer loaded with TIE's over to the Dagobah system, have the TIE's move into the clouds, and start Tallon Rolli-ng all the starfighters that they can get their sights on. Because the Medium Transport is a capital starship that moves and deploys like a starfighter, it is immune to this silly tactic. It's power works out to be the same as a Y-wing (0), it suffers no penalties to it's Maneuver (it doesn't have one), it has a permanent pilot, and it's forfeit is one better! If you're opponent is using Bounty Hunter ships (like Slave 1), then deploy the Medium Transport to Kessel, put any pilot main character (except Chewbacca) aboard, and you have a destiny draw as well! Granted, it's not as powerful as Boba Fett in Slave 1, but with Yoda on the Dagobah: Yoda's Hut you'll be able to reduce the Attrition by 2, and your opponents power will be -2 for being in the Clouds.\par \par Because the Medium Transport can deploy and move like a starfighter, it can deploy to a Docking Bay, and land at exterior Sites. This has come in handy for me several times, when an emergency evacuation is called for on Tatooine, or when I want to deposit some characters on Dagobah, and have no Encampments or Great Warrior's handy. Finally, for a really big power boost, deploy a Cloud Car into the belly of the Medium Transport at Kessel, and move it to Dagobah, and then into the Clouds. Drop off a few Cloud Cars this way, and guaranteed your opponent wont be aching to initiate a battle there.
Combo: Medium Transport + Cloud Car (repeatedly) \par -----\par Medium Transport + R5-M2 + BoShek\par Power 5, Armor 3, immune to attrition < 3, immune to Tallon Roll, and a Battle Destiny draw\par -----\par Medium Transport + Evacuation Control\par Makes the Transport hyperspeed +2, immune to attrition < 3 and it may move for free.

Information: Play this card on the Hoth: Wampa Cave, targeting a major Rebel who is not at the Hoth: Echo Command Center (Obi-Wan Kenobi or Commander Luke Skywalker work best as they cannot use their lightsabers to Force drain - see below), then play Responsibility Of Command on the same character.\par Your opponent will be unable to initiate battles or Force drains at the same location as a powerful character, and the only way to cancel this Effect is to take a long trek over the Hoth: North Ridge through Imperial territory ... and then walk back.\par Throw in Nightfall, Exhaustion, Exposure and Too Cold For Speeders for extra laughs.

Lore: \b Dejarik\b0 of a Ng'ok war beast. Foul temper gives rise to bad feelings. Has razor-sharp retractable claws. Used in many systems to frighten off potential attackers.
Gametext: Deploy on table. If your character in battle is about to be lost before the damage segment, it is instead lost at end of battle (if forfeited, forfeit for 0). [Immune to Alter]
Information: Startable with Prepared Defenses.\par -----\par Article at DeckTech, September 19th, 2005\par Top 5 Battle-Aiding V-Cards (Light Side) by Armaedes and Shewski\par \par One of my pet peeves, briefly touched upon under #1, is character removal. The Dark Side is rife with popular ways to get rid of your heroes such as Dr. Evazan, Dark Strike, and Choke Vader. K'lor Slug (and Molator for the DS) helps you avoid painful beatdowns due to sudden losses of power and destiny draws. While this is more like IMI in that it helps your battles hold their effectiveness, the second part of the text goes very well with immunity mains. Your mains can get out at their normal cost, which greatly speeds up the time it takes to get them into play by a turn or more.\par \par ARMAEDES' TAKE:\par Again, I find this less of an offensive aid than a defensive aid, and more of a battle-hindering card than anything else. The dark side's character removal is a big way dark wins battles, so in my opinion taking this away makes effective battling more challenging. I really like this card - I think it is a necessary component of the game - but I'm not sure I would classify it as a battling aid.
IsPulled: Masterful Move\par Masterful Move & Endor Occupation\par Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans\par Surface Defense (V)

Gametext: Deploys only at Mon Calamari or any Rebel Base. May add 5 pilots, 6 passengers, 1 vehicle and 3 starfighters. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2.

Lore: Native of Chandrila. \b Leader\b0  of the Alliance. A former member of the Imperial Senate where she was a formidable opponent of then-Senator Palpatine. Friend of Bail Organa.
Gametext: While at your war room, subtracts 1 from each opponent's battle destiny at all system locations and adds 2 to forfeit of all non-unique Rebels. Once during each of your deploy phase, may deploy one non-unique Rebel from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

Lore: \b Dejarik\b0  creature. Savage predator from remote deserts of Soccorro. Respected and honored by Soccorran hunters; considered "good luck" by superstitious smugglers.
Gametext: USED: If opponent has 13 or more cards in hand, place all but 8 (random selection) in Used Pile. LOST: Use 4 Force to reveal opponent's hand. All cards opponent has two or more of in hand are lost.
Information: Combo Card: Evader & Monnok\par -----\par This little Dark Side dejarik Interrupt can ruin your opponent's day. In addition to being of use on a Hologame Board as a dejarik creature with a destiny, power, ability, forfeit of 2, this card has two card stripping functions (one used and one lost) that can really disrupt a Light Side strategy.\par \par The lost function: This can be a devastating hit if the light side is holding a lot of cards even in a carefully constructed deck. The four Force cost to play this lost function makes this a costly Interrupt to attempt but it can pay off in spades if you combine it with a Scanning Crew! Pay one Force for the Scanning Crew to take a look at his hand and if you see some doubles you'll know whether you want to play the Monnok or not.\par \par Played at the right time this card can deliver a lot of damage in lost cards but the more painful loss to your opponent will be the limiting of his options in accordance with his intended strategy. Usually the cards that are multiples in a deck are the cards that the player is wanting to have access to quickly or often. If this option is removed along with the units of force you are well on the way to victory for the Empire.
IsPulled: Masterful Move\par Masterful Move & Endor Occupation
Combo: Monnok + Trinto Duaba\par -----\par Monnok + Scanning Crew
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-11)\par (Errata) See Grimtaash.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-8)\par Grimtaash\par (Errata) When this Interrupt targets your opponent's hand containing 13 or more cards, this is a condition of initiation (see actions). Thus, if you initiate Grimtaash, your opponent plays one or more cards as responses and those card plays reduce opponent's hand size below 13, your Grimtaash still has its result.

Lore: BlasTech DL-18. Carried by Jabba's guards. Typically used for covering fire, to protect a comrade or pin an enemy down. Nicknamed "Mos Eisley Special."
Gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your alien warrior (free if on Tatooine). May target a character for free. Draw destiny. Target is forfeit -2 for remainder of turn if destiny +2 > defense value.
IsPulled: Jabba's Through With You\par Mara Jade, The Emperor's Hand

Lore: Easily obtained by the Rebellion. Many are copies of the BlasTech DL-18 design. Plentiful on Tatooine. Used for suppressive fire.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your alien warrior (free if on Tatooine). May target a character for free. Draw destiny. Target is forfeit -2 for remainder of turn if destiny +2 > defense value.
Information: The Mos Eisley Blaster enhances the Light Side's biggest advantage over the Dark Side in Star Wars, their forfeit values.\par The Dark Side, especially the aliens in Jabba's Palace, has surprisingly low forfeit values, and a savvy Light Side player can quickly exploit that. The Mos Eisley Blaster helps that out tremendously, knocking off two forfeit in one destiny draw. Against powerhouses like Vader and Boba Fett, this is hardly a scratch, but the Dark Side aliens will struggle to have any forfeit at all after being hit with one of these.
IsPulled: Portable Scanner
Combo: Mos Eisley Blaster + A Gift\par Use these two cards together to gain a big advantage in the attrition race. The Dark Side loses two off of its destiny draws, reducing the attrition that you take. Add in the Mos Eisley Blaster, and your opponent takes the same amount of attrition, but that attrition tends to go a little bit farther, by reducing a key character (such as Ortugg or J'Quille) to attrition fodder.

Lore: Jabba's Nimbanel accountant. Inside contacts allow him to disrupt the cash flow of the Hutt's enemies. He knows a mistake could make him the next write-off.
Gametext: When opponent is losing Force from Force drains at the same or an adjacent site, lost Force must come from Reserve Deck if possible.
Information: Game text is canceled by Freon Drevan.\par -----\par Game text is suspended by Loje Nella.\par -----\par Graak is a similar counterpart, but limited to \par drains at Endor sites.\par -----\par Deneb Both is a similar counterpart. Lost Force must come from Force Pile.
Combo: Mosep + Gailid

Lore: One lesson learned in Jedi training is that when you have been injured, don't panic.
Gametext: If your character with a lightsaber just won a battle, deploy on an opponent's character present. Character is Disarmed (power -1 and may no longer carry weapons). Opponent loses 1 Force at the end of each of opponent's turns. (Immune to Control.)

Rules: (Appendix B)\par The battle destiny substitution portion of this card counts as 'canceling' the original destiny for the purposes of cards that prevent such cancellations. If your battle destinies are prevented from being canceled by other rules or cards, you may not initiate this text.

Lore: Military version of a 'remote.' Programmed to stalk specific targets or secondary targets. Heat and light sensors track with fatal accuracy. Can stow away on starships.
Gametext: Deploys for 1 Force to an unoccupied site. Deploys and moves like an undercover spy. When present with Motti (or pilot) of ability < 3, choose one to be immediately lost (treat as an "all cards" situation). Seeker is also lost.

Lore: Royal Guard \b leader\b0. Remembers nothing of his past other than serving his Emperor. Early instructor of Kir Kanos and Carnor Jax.
Gametext: Deploys only on Coruscant or to Emperor's site (or related site). When armed with a Force pike, adds one battle destiny. Your troopers and Royal Guards may 'react' to here for free. Adds 1 to defense value of other Royal Guards at same and related sites.

Lore: Silicon-based spaceborne lifeform. Frequently called a "power sucker." Feeds on energy such as stellar radiation and electrical discharges. Absorbs minerals from starship hulks.
Gametext: Habitat: unlimited. Parasite: Starfighter. Host's power and hyperspeed are \b cumulatively\b0  -2; while both < 1, Mynocks randomly detach one at a time (cannot attach for remainder of turn). Moves like a starfighter.

Lore: Starship parasite. Flourishes in vacuum of space. Consumes radiation and other forms of energy. Chews on power cables. Adults have one-meter wingspan. Reproduces by macromiosis.
Gametext: Habitat: unlimited. Parasite: Starfighter. Host's power and hyperspeed are \b cumulatively\b0  -2; while both < 1, Mynocks randomly detach one at a time (cannot attach for remainder of turn). Moves like a starfighter.

Lore: A regenerating, primitive, violent, desert dwelling, fearless, mercenary-joining Lirin Car'n-befriending, cyclopian Abyssin from Byss. Calling him 'monoc' will start a fight.
Gametext: Power +1 if present with Lirin Car'n or any bounty hunter. If lost or forfeited as a result of a battle, Myo 'regenerates' (place on top of your Used Pile).
Information: One of the prime drawbacks of the bounty hunting "Scum And Villany" is their lack of adequate forefeit value.\par \par So Myo is a natural with bounty hunters, but be aware of a few drawbacks. His ability 1 makes him a prime target for weapons fire (especially sabers which may drop his forefeit to 0). Obi Wan (and those with his cape) loves messing with Myo's mind and can easily send him away from the battle where he was needed. Finally, his deploy cost of 4 makes him difficult to get out of your hand.
Combo: Myo + Bounty Hunters = Protect your low forefeit bounty hunters by throwing Myo in the way. \par -----\par Myo + Lone Warrior + Moment of Triumph = You only lose the destiny adders.

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, F-1, Appendix A)\par -----\par Errata to: Naboo: Battle Plains (LS and DS)\par \par http://www.swccgpc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?t=16546\par \par The use of the word "tank" on the light and dark side version of the card Naboo: Battle Plains has led to some confusion.\par \par This was in all likelihood due to an internal communication problem during the development of Coruscant and Theed Palace at Decipher, with the former set assuming they would be called "tanks" and the latter calling them "AATs." This problem was compounded by the fact that the "AAT" cards did not have "tank" listed on them, even though it has always been assumed that was what the site was referring to. For this reason, the site will have its game text errata'd so that the correct term, "AAT" is used.\par \par Naboo: Battle Plains (DS) DS text will read:\par Unless Gungan Energy Shield on table, your AATs are each power +2 here.\par \par Naboo: Battle Plains (LS) DS text will read:\par Your AATs deploy +1 here.\par \par There has been some discussion recently about how applying the picture to the ways of identifying would solve this problem. In actuality, it will create more problems than it solves. A single exception was created for gender, since this was leading to problems that couldn't be resolved short of issuing a list of gender clarifications. Greg Anderson felt that players should be able to use the existing information on the card to identify a gender characteristic, a position that Chuck Sonnenburg continued to support when he took over. But it was agreed that this would be the only exception ever - that coming up with a list of what would and would not apply to the picture would only add another layer of complexity to the rules.\par \par An effort was made to instead shore up the issues by cleaning up the characteristics list, which can be noted by a comparison between the AR and previous rules documents; things like DH-17 and fusion generator have been added, and ones that did not fit in have been removed.\par \par In an ideal world we would reissue every single card with all the characteristics on the card and do away with these rules altogether - but at this time this is simply not feasible. We have, we believe, the best possible alternative in place.

This problem was compounded by the fact that the "AAT" cards did not have "tank" listed on them, even though it has always been assumed that was what the site was referring to. For this reason, the site will have its game text errata'd so that the correct term, "AAT" is used.\par \par Naboo: Battle Plains (DS) DS text will read:\par Unless Gungan Energy Shield on table, your AATs are each power +2 here.\par \par Naboo: Battle Plains (LS) DS text will read:\par Your AATs deploy +1 here.\par \par There has been some discussion recently about how applying the picture to the ways of identifying would solve this problem. But it was agreed that this would be the only exception ever - that coming up with a list of what would and would not apply to the picture would only add another layer of complexity to the rules.\par \par An effort was made to instead shore up the issues by cleaning up the characteristics list, which can be noted by a comparison between the AR and previous rules documents; things like DH-17 and fusion generator have been added, and ones that did not fit in have been removed.\par \par In an ideal world we would reissue every single card with all the characteristics on the card and do away with these rules altogether - but at this time this is simply not feasible. Lore: Four-armed smuggler and pilot for hire. A Morseerian male. Breathes methane. Former fighter pilot. He can take you anywhere for the right price.

Lore: Strong-armed H'nemthe thugs working for the Hutts. Work alongside Rodians and other unscrupulous aliens.
Gametext: While at a Nal Hutta site: adds 1 to your Force drains there, is power +1 (or +2 if your gangster or Rodian is on Nal Hutta) and, once during each of your control phases, may deploy one site to Nal Hutta from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
Pulls: One site to Nal Hutta
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, D-2)\par Operatives are identified by their title, X Operative, with X being a system. The operative is considered a 'matching operative' for system X (e.g., Kiffex Operative is a matching operative for Kiffex). \par Operatives are restricted by special rules as follows: \par - You may not voluntarily deploy or move your operative to (or through) a location on its matching planet where you already have an operative (even if inactive) of the same card title. \par - If, at any time, two of your Operatives (even if inactive) of the same card title are at the same location on their matching planet, you must choose one to be lost (you may choose an inactive operative to be lost). \par - Your operative character on its matching planet may not apply its ability toward drawing battle destiny. Your operative may not control a location on its matching planet for any reason unless you have other cards there capable of controlling the location (e.g., an ability-1 character or a battle droid). Your operatives still occupy that location (and may battle or be battled), but may not Force drain or flip an objective alone.

Lore: Male Bith \b musician\b0. Though he enjoys playing his Bandfill in Figrin D'an's band, he misses the bubbling pink swamps of his homeworld, Clak'dor VII.
Gametext: After using Bith Shuffle, peek at top X cards of pile or deck just shuffled, where X = number of other musicians at same site. May reshuffle without peeking.

Gametext: If opponent just initiated battle at a site where you have a Rebel of ability > 2 present, move all of your cards with ability there away (using their landspeed).
Combo: Narrow Escape + All My Urchins\par A good way to make your opponent lose 2 Force for nothing. (l000needles)

Lore: Navy troopers are assigned to defend key installations. Trained to protect against alien speciees and other insurgents.
Gametext: Deploy -1 to a mobile site (except on Cloud City). When defending a battle, power +1 (or +2 if also at an interior site). When in battle against an operative, prevents opponent from drawing more than one battle destiny.

Lore: Rendili native skilled at close-quarters combat. Worked with Trooper Vesden to monitor enemy activity on Endor.
Gametext: Subtracts 3 from Force opponent retrieves for On The Edge and Off The Edge. When at Bunker, adds 2 to deploy cost of each opponent's character (except Ewoks, spies and scouts) to Endor sites (except Rebel Landing Site).
IsPulled: Blizzard 4

Lore: Many Imperial Navy troopers receive technical as well as combat training, which they use to maintain the Empire's military facilities.
Gametext: Forfeit +2 while with Hewex. When at Bunker (or aboard a Star Destroyer at Endor), \b cumulatively\b0  adds 1 to deploy cost of each opponent's starship and non-Ewok vehicle deploying to Endor (or to your mobile site orbiting Endor).

Lore: Counterintelligence agent assigned by ISB. Operates sensors designed to protect the control bunker from infiltration.
Gametext: If present with a Scomp link when Never Tell Me The Odds just reached the top of your Reserve Deck, may 'shield' (add 3 to destiny number of) one of your characters at each location for remainder of turn.
IsPulled: Blizzard 4

Lore: Disciple of Davrilat, a complicated religion based on the sanctity of harmonics. Originally from the desert planet Tocoya. Strong protective instincts.
Gametext: Power +3 when present with your musician. When a battle was just initiated where present, may choose one opponent's character of ability < X to move away for free (or that character is lost), where X = number of your musicians present.

Lore: Jawa \b leader\b0  responsible for organizing raids on rival Jawa factions. Detested warrior. Hates being "frocked."
Gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. When in a battle with at least two of your other Jawas, adds one battle destiny. When your total battle destiny at Nebit's site is greater than opponent's total battle destiny, Nebit reduces attrition against you by 3.

Lore: Product of Imperial Kuat Drive Yards. Several captured by Alliance. Imperial crews promptly defected. Can be outfitted for a variety of missions requiring mid-size capital starships.
Gametext: May add 4 pilots, 4 passengers, and 2 starfighters. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Turbolaser batteries and laser cannons may deploy aboard for free.
Information: Weapons that deploy for free:\par \par Heavy Turbolaser Battery\par Quad Laser Cannon

Gametext: If difference between opponent's and your highest race totals < 4, lose 1 Force. Opponent draws no race destiny next control phase. OR If both players have < 10 Life Force remaining, both players retrieve 4 Force.

Lore: Immense Ranat scavenger from Aralia. Slyly spies for anyone willing to pay his price. Outcast. Works as a laborer for Hrchek, the Saurin droid trader.
Gametext: If both players have a spy at same site, draw destiny. Add 2 if opponent's spy is Undercover. Opponent's spy is lost if destiny > 2.

Lore: "You said you wanted to be around when I made a mistake, well, this could be it, sweetheart."

Lore: The political process in the Republic is one whereby even the most powerful positions are fraught with peril.
Gametext: If you have a senate majority, activate 1 Force. OR If your opponent has a senate majority, place your character with politics at Galactic Senate in Used Pile to place an opponent's character present (your choice) in opponent's Used Pile. (Immune to Sense.)

Lore: \b Dejarik\b0  of a Ng'ok war beast. Foul temper gives rise to bad feelings. Has razor-sharp retractable claws. Used in many systems to frighten off potential attackers.
Gametext: If opponent just deployed four or more characters to same location this turn, prevent all of those characters from battling this turn. OR If opponent just 'reacted' to a battle, cancel the battle.
IsPulled: Masterful Move\par Masterful Move & Endor Occupation

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-11)\par (Errata) See I Have A Very Bad Feeling About This.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-8)\par I Have A Very Bad Feeling About This\par This Interrupt's first function may be played just after your opponent deploys a fourth character, a fifth character etc. (See actions - 'just.') When the second function of this Interrupt cancels a battle, it does not cancel any 'reacts' to that battle, even though it is a response to such a 'react.'
Cancels: A battle opponent has just reacted to.

Lore: "Your buddy here was about to be turned into orange goo. He picked a fight with a Dug. An especially dangerous Dug called Sebulba."
Gametext: Deploy on table. Once per turn may use 1 Force to look through opponent's Lost Pile and place all docking bays you find there out of play. Once per game may deploy Sebulba from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Prepared Defenses.
Pulls: Sebulba
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: Mercenary from Vodran. Niado's culture controls its environment through terraforming facilities. Enhanced adrenal glands allow for short bursts of incredible strength.
Gametext: May not carry or use devices or weapons. Once per turn, may use X Force, where X = 1, 2, or 3, to add twice X to his power for remainder of turn.

CardName: Nice Of You Guys To Drop By
Lore: "Echo Base, this is Rogue 2. I've found them. Repeat, I've found them."
Gametext: Send one of your missing characters at same site as one of your piloted or driven vehicles to your Used Pile. OR Cancel any attempt by one character to 'hide' from a battle.
Cancels: Any attempt by one character to 'hide' from battle.

Lore: Luke barely escaped being crushed by the AT-AT's massive footpad during the Battle of Hoth.
Gametext: Deploy on your side of table. During a battle, you may place out of play from hand a copy of any unique (*) card participating in that battle to reduce attrition against you by that card's forfeit value. (Immune to Alter while you occupy a battleground.)
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once

Lore: Brilliant navigator. Former SoroSuub employee. Turned to pirating when that corporation backed the Empire. Tall for a Sullustan.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When he is at a mobile sector, once per turn you may peek at top card of your Reserve Deck; you may place that card on top of Used Pile. When with General Calrissian, adds one battle destiny.

Lore: Tatoo I and Tatoo II, twin suns of Tatooine, create a harsh desert environment, but provide spectacular sunsets. At night, many dangers emerge from the shadows.
Gametext: Deploy on any planet system to cause "nighttime conditions" at related sites. During battles there, both sides add one destiny to power only. Spies deploy free to sites under "nighttime conditions."
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Wokling (V)\par Yavin 4 (V)

Lore: Several different types if Nikto were sold to Jabba by slavers. Compete with Weequay to prove themselves the stronger species.
Gametext: Deploys only to a Jabba's Palace site. Power and forfeit +2 when defending a battle at a Jabba's Palace site.

Lore: Guard from Corulag. Former bouncer at the Mos Eisley cantina. Assigned by Jabba to guard celebrities visiting Jabba's palace. Friend of Wuher. Loves juri juice.
Gametext: Power +3 when present with your musician. When present at start of a battle, may cause one opponent's character of ability < X to move away for free (or that character is immediately lost) where X = the number of your musicians present.

Lore: "Zeet tu seet. Jabba no tuzindy honkabee."
Gametext: Deploy on your side of table. While no Imperials are at any Jabba's Palace sites, at all such sites: Rebels are deploy +2, Revolution is canceled and your non-unique aliens are each forfeit +1. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Prepared Defenses.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: It's not rare to see a senator using the system to forward his own personal agenda. Much goes on behind closed doors that the Senate never sees.
Gametext: USED: During your move phase, take one of your characters with politics at Galactic Senate into hand. LOST: If you have a Republic character with politics in battle at a site, add one battle destiny; that character is power and politics = 0 until end of turn.

Lore: "There will be a substantial reward for the one who finds the \ul Millennium Falcon\ul0. You are free to use any methods necessary, but I want them alive."
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your side of table. If a Rebel of ability > 2 is lost (not captured) during a battle involving an opponent's bounty hunter, opponent loses 3 Force. If Vader on table, one bounty hunter involved in that battle (your choice) is also lost.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-12)\par The Force loss from this Effect is triggered once per battle, not once per Rebel.

Lore: Jabba's influence is not easily ignored. Neither are his voracious and vile appetites. Even Jedi soon learn this lesson.
Gametext: Deploy on table. You may immediately take top card of Lost Pile into hand. Effects, Epic Events, and Objectives are immune to Honor Of The Jedi. At each opponent's <> site, your characters and vehicles are each deploy -3 and your Force generation is +1. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Prepared Defenses.
Pulls: Top card of Lost Pile into hand.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-12)\par If this Effect is deployed at the start of the game, it will not allow you to take your starting interrupt into hand because that interrupt will still be resolving, and thus not yet in the Lost Pile when this Effect is deployed.

Lore: Jabba's influence is not easily ignored. Neither are his voracious and vile appetites. Even Jedi soon learn this lesson.
Gametext: Plays on table. At opponent's <> site where opponent's creature present, you may deploy without presence or Force icons, and your Force generation there is +1.

CardName: No Giben Up, General Jar Jar!
Lore: "Mesa think of sumting!"
Gametext: If you just lost a Gungan from table, place him in your hand. OR If Jar Jar and Tarpals are in a battle together, add two battle destiny.

Lore: Lightsaber duels are so fast and furious that Jedi don't plan their offensive strategy, but instead rely on instinct and their ability to sense an opponent's next strike.
Gametext: If Maul armed with a lightsaber in battle, use 2 Force to draw two destiny. Opponent draws two destiny. If any of your destinies equal any of opponent's destinies, opponent's Jedi is power = 0 for remainder of battle.

CardName: No Money, No Parts, No Deal!/You're A Slave?
ObjectiveFront: \ul Deploy Watto's Junkyard and Mos Espa.\ul0 \par \b For\b0  remainder of game, Watto's Junkyard is immune to Revolution. If Watto at Watto's Junkyard, opponent may use 8 Force to place Watto in Used Pile and you may retrieve up to 4 Force. \par \b While\b0  this side up, Qui-Gon is power +3. Opponent loses no more than 1 Force from your Force drains at Tatooine sites. \par \b Flip\b0  this card if Watto present at Watto's Junkyard and you occupy Mos Espa.
ObjectiveBack: \b While\b0  this side up, once during each of your deploy phases, may place a card from hand face down on your side of the table and opponent must choose to lose 2 Force (you place card in Used Pile) or use 2 Force (you deploy that card for free). If opponent uses 2 Force and you cannot deploy card, lose 2 Force and card is lost. Opponent's non-unique aliens are each deploy +3. \par \b Flip\b0  this card if Watto not present at Watto's Junkyard or you do not occupy Mos Espa.
ObjectiveFrontName: No Money, No Parts, No Deal!
Gametext: [Front Side]: \ul Deploy Watto's Junkyard and Mos Espa.\ul0 \par \b For\b0  remainder of game, Watto's Junkyard is immune to Revolution. If Watto at Watto's Junkyard, opponent may use 8 Force to place Watto in Used Pile and you may retrieve up to 4 Force. \par \b While\b0  this side up, Qui-Gon is power +3. Opponent loses no more than 1 Force from your Force drains at Tatooine sites. \par \b Flip\b0  this card if Watto present at Watto's Junkyard and you occupy Mos Espa.\\par[Back Side]: \b While\b0  this side up, once during each of your deploy phases, may place a card from hand face down on your side of the table and opponent must choose to lose 2 Force (you place card in Used Pile) or use 2 Force (you deploy that card for free). If opponent uses 2 Force and you cannot deploy card, lose 2 Force and card is lost. Opponent's non-unique aliens are each deploy +3. \par \b Flip\b0  this card if Watto not present at Watto's Junkyard or you do not occupy Mos Espa.
Information: LS counters against the Watto Objective are:\par \par Goldenrod

Gametext: Force generation at sectors a player occupies is +1 for that player. Any [Independent] starship with an alien pilot character aboard is immune to attrition < 4 (or adds 2 to immunity). During your control phase, one of your smugglers at a site related to a system occupied by your freighter or [Independent] starship may either fire a blaster or make a regular move using personal landspeed.
IsPulled: Admiral Ackbar

Lore: "You can't win Darth. If you strike me down I shall become more powerful than you can possibly imagine." Obi-Wan's sacrifice gave the Rebels time to escape.
Gametext: If opponent just deployed a character, sacrifice (out of play) from table one of your characters with the same power (even a captured character). You may retrieve Force from Lost Pile equal to your sacrificed character's forfeit value.
Information: Dark side counter card:\par Sergeant Tarl subtracts 3 from Force retrieved with Noble Sacrifice.\par
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-12)\par Even if this Interrupt is canceled, the sacrificed character is still placed out of play as the sacrifice is part of the initiation.

Lore: Jabba's Gamorrean guards keep a watchful eye for unwelcome guests.
Gametext: If opponent just deployed a Rebel to a Jabba's Palace site (and you have no Imperials at any Jabba's Palace site), return Rebel to opponent's hand. Any Force used to deploy that Rebel remains used, and Rebel may not be deployed for the remainder of turn.
Information: Ounee Ta makes None Shall Pass a unique (*) Lost Interrupt.

Lore: Sometimes, the truth isn't very pretty.
Gametext: USED: If you just answered 'no' to a Hypo question, opponent loses 3 Force. LOST: Cancel Why Didn't You Tell Me? or I Am Your Father. OR If Luke is about to cross to the Dark Side, he is lost instead.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-12)\par When you use this Interrupt during an Epic Duel to lose Luke instead of crossing him to the Dark Side, you must still lose X Force (but not triple X) as specified on Epic Duel.
Cancels: I Am Your Father\par Why Didn't You Tell Me?

CardName: Nothing Can Get Through Our Shield
Gametext: Non-pilot characters aboard starships are forfeit -4. Whenever a player's starship is 'hit', that player loses 1 Force (2 if starship was hit by Droid Starfighter Laser Cannons). At systems where you have only [Trade Federation] starships, all of those starships are immune to attrition < 4. At sites related to a system you occupy, your battle destinies may not be canceled by opponent.
IsPulled: Admiral Piett

Lore: Tree-nesting reptile. Favors moist caves and marshes. Extremely docile, despite fearsome appearance. Responsive to Force energy.
Gametext: * Ferocity = destiny - 4. Habitat: planet sites (except Hoth and Tatooine) and Dark Waters. \b Cumulatively\b0  absorbs (temporarily cancels) one (Dark Side Force icon) icon present. Parasite: None.
IsPulled: Swamp

Lore: Commanding Viceroy of the Trade Federation forces assigned to the blockade of Naboo. Takes responsibility for his own actions. Neimoidian \b leader\b0.
Gametext: Your destroyer droids and battle droids are each forfeit +1 at same and related sites. While aboard Blockade Flagship, opponent's Jedi may not move or deploy to Bridge, and your destroyer droids are destiny +3 if drawn for battle destiny.
Information: Nute Gunray personas are:\par Nute Gunray\par Nute Gunray, Neimoidian Viceroy\par Nute Gunray (V)
IsPulled: Lord Sidious\par The Phantom Menace

Lore: Neimoidian \b leader\b0. Viceroy to the Trade Federation, but primarily under the influence of Darth Sidious. Ordered to take control of Naboo and force the Queen to sign a treaty.
Gametext: Your [Presence] droids and AATs are destiny +1 if drawn for battle or weapon destiny. Once per turn, may take Take Them Away into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < X, where X = twice the number of [Presence] droids present.
Information: Nute Gunray personas are:\par Nute Gunray\par Nute Gunray, Neimoidian Viceroy\par Nute Gunray (V)
Pulls: Take Them Away
IsPulled: Lord Sidious\par The Phantom Menace

Lore: Kajain'sa'Nikto. Fiercely loyal to Jabba. Stands guard over the sail barge during the Hutt's many trips to Mos Eisley.
Gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. May deploy as a 'react' to a Jabba's Palace site or aboard a vehicle at a Tatooine site. Power +3 when defending a battle at a Jabba's Palace site.

Lore: Jedi Knight. Trained by Yoda. Friend of Bail Organa. General Kenobi became a hero of the Old Republic during the Clone Wars. Mentor of Anakin and Luke Skywalker.
Gametext: When a battle was just initiated where present, may use 1 Force to choose one opponent's character of ability = 1 present to move away (for free), or that character is lost. Immune to attrition < 5.
Information: Obi-Wan Kenobi personas are:\par \par Ben Kenobi\par Obi-Wan in Radiant VII (V)\par Obi-Wan Kenobi\par Obi-Wan Kenobi (V)\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Jedi Knight\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner (V)\par Obi-Wan With Lightsaber
IsPulled: Balanced Attack\par Padme Naberrie\par Rebel Leadership (V)\par Return Of A Jedi\par Tatooine: City Outskirts
Combo: Obi-Wan Kenobi + Krayt Dragon Howl
MatchingWeapon: Obi-Wan's Lightsaber

Lore: Jedi Knight. Trained by Yoda. Friend of Bail Organa. General Kenobi became a hero of the Old Republic during the Clone Wars. Mentor of Anakin and Luke Skywalker.
Gametext: Obi-Wan's deploy cost may not be increased. Power +1 for each Dark Jedi here. Once per game, may exchange two cards in hand with any one card in Lost Pile.  Immune to attrition < 5.
Information: Obi-Wan Kenobi personas are:\par \par Ben Kenobi\par Obi-Wan in Radiant VII (V)\par Obi-Wan Kenobi\par Obi-Wan Kenobi (V)\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Jedi Knight\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner (V)\par Obi-Wan With Lightsaber
IsPulled: Balanced Attack\par Padme Naberrie\par Rebel Leadership (V)\par Return Of A Jedi\par Tatooine: City Outskirts
Combo: Obi-Wan Kenobi (V) + Krayt Dragon Howl
MatchingWeapon: Obi-Wan's Lightsaber

Lore: Padawan learner promoted to Jedi Knight after his encounter with Darth Maul. Has sworn to train Anakin Skywalker, even if the Jedi Council forbids it.
Gametext: Deploys -2 to Naboo. Power +2 if Maul present. If Qui-Gon is participating in lightsaber combat and Obi-Wan is present, Qui-Gon may use Obi-Wan's combat cards. Immune to Sniper and attrition < 5.
Information: Obi-Wan Kenobi personas are:\par \par Ben Kenobi\par Obi-Wan in Radiant VII (V)\par Obi-Wan Kenobi\par Obi-Wan Kenobi (V)\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Jedi Knight\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner (V)\par Obi-Wan With Lightsaber
IsPulled: Fall Of A Jedi\par Padme Naberrie\par Return Of A Jedi\par Tatooine: City Outskirts
Combo: Obi-Wan Kenobi, Jedi Knight + Are You Brain Dead?!\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Jedi Knight + Krayt Dragon Howl
MatchingWeapon: Obi-Wan's Lightsaber\par Obi-Wan's Lightsaber (EP1)\par Qui-Gon's Lightsaber

Lore: Qui-Gon Jinn's Padawan. Stayed behind to protect Queen Amidala when Qui-Gon left to explore Mos Espa, but was in constant communication should he be needed.
Gametext: Deploys -2 to Tatooine. If opponent just initiated a battle at a related Tatooine site, may use 2 Force to relocate Obi-Wan to that site. Immune to attrition < 4.
Information: Obi-Wan Kenobi personas are:\par \par Ben Kenobi\par Obi-Wan in Radiant VII\par Obi-Wan Kenobi\par Obi-Wan Kenobi (V)\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Jedi Knight\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner (V)\par Obi-Wan With Lightsaber
IsPulled: Fall Of A Jedi\par Padme Naberrie\par Return Of A Jedi
Combo: Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner + Krayt Dragon Howl
MatchingWeapon: Obi-Wan's Lightsaber\par Obi-Wan's Lightsaber (EP1)

Lore: "The Force will be with you...always."
Gametext: Permanent weapon is (*]Obi-Wan's Lightsaber (may target a character or creature for free; draw two destiny; target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value).
Information: Obi-Wan Kenobi personas are:\par \par Ben Kenobi\par Obi-Wan in Radiant VII\par Obi-Wan Kenobi\par Obi-Wan Kenobi (V)\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Jedi Knight\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner (V)\par Obi-Wan With Lightsaber\par -----\par Obi-Wan's lightsaber 'personas' are:\par \par Obi-Wan's Lightsaber\par Obi-Wan's Lightsaber (EP1)\par Obi-Wan With Lighsaber
IsPulled: Padme Naberrie\par Return Of A Jedi\par Tatooine: City Outskirts
Combo: Obi-Wan With Lightsaber + Obi-Wan's Cape\par Makes Obi-Wan immune to attrition < 5.\par -----\par Obi-Wan With Lightsaber + A Jedi's Resilience\par -----\par Obi-Wan With Lightsaber + Krayt Dragon Howl
MatchingWeapon: Obi-Wan's Lightsaber

Lore: "Luminous beings are we, not this crude matter." The inner consciousness of a Jedi can transcend even death.
Gametext: Use 4 Force to deploy at any site if opponent is generating at least 3 Force more than you. At that site, adjacent sites and same sites as Obi-Wan, players activate Force only if they have presence.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once

Lore: A symbol of the noble Jedi and his mysterious powers.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your Rebel or alien. Character is immune to attrition < 5. Also, when a battle was just initiated where present, may use 1 Force to choose one opponent's character of ability = 1 present to move away (for free), or that character is lost.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once

Lore: Written by Obi-Wan Kenobi. Used by Luke to construct his lightsaber. Contained instructions on building required tools as well. Keyed to self-destruct if not opened by Luke.
Gametext: Deploy on Luke or Obi-Wan. Your characters present armed with a unique (*) lightsaber weapon card may not be Disarmed, once per battle may cancel a weapon destiny just drawn, and that lightsaber's Force drain modifiers may not be canceled. Lost if about to be stolen.
IsPulled: Corporal Beezer\par Portable Scanner
Cancels: A weapon destiny just drawn.

Lore: "An elegant weapon for a more civilized time." Miniaturized power cell. Uses rare crystals to focus the lightblade. This lightsaber was personally built by Obi-Wan.
Gametext: Deploy on Obi-Wan. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
Information: Obi-Wan's lightsaber 'personas' are:\par \par Obi-Wan's Lightsaber\par Obi-Wan's Lightsaber (EP1)\par Obi-Wan With Lighsaber
IsPulled: Gift Of The Mentor
MatchingWeapon: Ben Kenobi\par Obi-Wan Kenobi\par Obi-wan Kenobi (V)\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Jedi Knight\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner

Lore: Constructed by Obi-Wan himself, this Padawan's lightsaber was responsible for tearing an ancient Sith weapon in half.
Gametext: Deploy on [Episode 1] Obi-Wan. May add 1 to Force drain if present at a Naboo battleground. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Add 1 if targeting a Dark Jedi. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
Information: Obi-Wan's lightsaber 'personas' are:\par \par Obi-Wan's Lightsaber\par Obi-Wan's Lightsaber (EP1)\par Obi-Wan With Lighsaber
IsPulled: Gift Of The Mentor
MatchingWeapon: Obi-Wan Kenobi, Jedi Knight\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner

Lore: Remote surveillance viewers with droid controllers supplement security. Can activate alarms and automated weapons when needed, bringing help to endangered locations.
Gametext: Deploy on a site. Adds 1 to the total weapon destiny of each of your automated weapons at same or adjacent sites. During battle, may add the power of one of your characters at an adjacent site you control to your total.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-12)\par A character at an adjacent site using this device to add power to a battle does not otherwise participate in the battle, and is not eligible to be forfeited. Thus, if the character is Imperial Trooper Guard it would not be defending in the battle and would add zero to power.

Lore: Recalled to defend second Death Star during construction. Stationed aboard \ul Thunderflare\ul0.
Gametext: May deploy with a pilot as a 'react' to any asteroid sector or cloud sector. May add one pilot. OS-72-10 deploys -2 aboard.
Information: TIE/lns are forfeit +2 at same location as Vengeance.
IsPulled: Commander Brandei\par Short Range Fighters & Watch Your Back!

Lore: TIE fighter modified for upper atmosphere maneuvers. Pilot nicknamed "Winged Gundark" due to the number of kills earned in high-altitude battles.
Gametext: Deploy -1 and power +3 at any cloud sector. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 2.
Information: TIE/lns are forfeit +2 at same location as Vengeance.
IsPulled: Commander Brandei

Lore: Modified TIE fighter. Used most often to pursue raiders attempting to take refuge in the upper atmosphere of nearby planets. Pilot previously stationed aboard \ul Devastator\ul0.
Gametext: Deploy -1 and power +3 at any cloud sector. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.
Information: TIE/lns are forfeit +2 at same location as Vengeance.
IsPulled: Commander Brandei

Lore: Modified TIE fighter. Specifically adapted for atmospheric engagement. Some are fitted with high-output solar panels to support improved weaponry.
Gametext: Deploy -1 at any cloud sector. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2 and adds 2 to power. Power +2 at non-unique cloud sectors. Boosted TIE Cannon may deploy aboard and fires free aboard.
Information: TIE/lns are forfeit +2 at same location as Vengeance.
IsPulled: All Power To Weapons\par Commander Brandei\par Short Range Fighters

Lore: Odin's family mysteriously disappeared during a hyperspace jump. He scours the galaxy for information on them, and his best lead has brought him to Tatooine.
Gametext: During your move phase, target any or all of your characters at one exterior site to 'transport' (relocate) to another exterior site. Draw destiny. Use that much Force to 'transport', or place Interrupt in Lost Pile.
Information: Nabrun Leids has same function, it is not limited to players move phase and relocates from any site to any site.\par Advantage of Odin Neslor is that there are no counters to it.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-12)\par Refer to rulings on Elis Helrot.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-6)\par Elis Helrot\par (Errata) The following actions are part of the initiation of this Interrupt:\par - targeting the characters to be moved;\par - targeting the site to move them to;\par - drawing destiny; and\par - paying the cost (using the Force required to transport the targeted characters).

Lore: Despite the brutal attacks of the Dark Lord, dying on Cloud City was not Luke's destiny.
Gametext: Target one of your characters at a Cloud City site. Draw destiny. If destiny > character's destiny number, retrieve Force equal to the difference. If destiny < character's destiny number, lose difference. If destiny = character's destiny number, character is lost.
Combo: Off The Edge + Cloud City: Incinerator + EG-4 (Eegee-Four)

Lore: Growing up in a small town outside of Theed, Porro became adept at speeder control and thrust. His decision to volunteer for Bravo Flight made Ric Olie a very happy man.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting Bravo 2, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise, and opponent's battle destiny draws are -2 at same system.

Lore: Computer systems troubleshooter whose sour past is not discussed by her squad mates. Years of experience enabled her to predict and adjust to droid starfighter tactics.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots. While piloting Bravo 5 and at same system as a droid starfighter, adds one destiny to attrition only.

Lore: This Imperial Intelligence \b leader\b0  has a proven track record for predicting Rebel fleet movements. His coordination of starship maneuvers has saved many vulnerable bases.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When at a Death Star site, Imperial starships may move to the Death Star system as a 'react.'

Lore: Royal Naboo security guard who can disassemble and reassemble a Naboo blaster in less than sixty seconds. During the occupation, was a prisoner at Camp Four.
Gametext: Once during your deploy phase, may use 1 Force to relocate Perosei to an adjacent Naboo site. While with a Republic character during battle, may place Perosei out of play to add 5 to your total power this battle.

Lore: Mindless philosophy for an overweight glob of grease.
Gametext: Cancel an attempt by opponent to target your droid to be stolen, 'hit' or lost. Droid is protected from all such attempts for remainder of turn. OR Switch OFF any binary droid for remainder of turn.
Cancels: An attempt by opponent to target your droid to be stolen, 'hit' or lost.

Lore: "That old man's just a crazy wizard." Obi-Wan lived in Tatooine's deserts for years...ready for the right moment to act.
Gametext: Use 1 Force if any of your characters (except Obi-Wan) was just forfeited from a Tatooine site. Mysterious "crazy wizard" steps in and revives (returns from Lost Pile) that character back to same site.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-12)\par (Errata) Old Ben allows you to return the exact same card only, not another copy of that card or persona.
IsCanceledBy: Why Didn't You Tell Me?\par Your Powers Are Weak, Old Man

Lore: "How you doing, you old pirate? So good to see you!"
Gametext: If a battle was just initiated involving Han and any Lando, the eventual loser of the battle may not lose cards from Life Force to satisfy battle damage while that player has any cards in hand. OR Cancel Double-Crossing, No-Good Swindler.
Combo: Old Pirates + Han + Lando + Chewie + Luke + Rug Hug + Millenium Falcon\par Four destiny draws and immunity to attrition < 5.
Cancels: Double-Crossing, No-Good Swindler

Lore: "I'll be right up there with you! And, have I got stories to tell you..."
Gametext: If Luke and Biggs are defending a battle together (or are in any battle together at Tatooine), add one battle destiny. OR If Luke and Biggs are making an Attack Run, add one destiny to your Attack Run total.

Lore: Rumors of a new 'technological terror' filled the galaxy with dread.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on Endor system if opponent controls no Endor sites. Your Force drains are +2 at up to X other battleground systems, where X = number of Endor sites you occupy. Effect canceled if opponent controls three Endor sites. (Immune to Alter.)
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Combo: Ominous Rumors + Security Precautions\par -----\par Ominous Rumors + Colonel Dyer\par -----\par Ominous Rumors + Endor: Bunker + Perimeter Patrol

Lore: Difficult-to-play instrument which enhances music. Tech Mo'r plays one for Figrin D'an and the Modal Nodes in the Mos Eisley Cantina.
Gametext: Shuffle any player's Reserve Deck or Lost Pile or Used Pile.
Information: Combo Card: Ommni Box & It's Worse

Gametext: USED: Shuffle any player's Reserve Deck or Lost Pile. LOST: If It Could Be Worse was just played, it is canceled and you may use X Force to raise damage against opponent by X amount. OR If opponent just lost Force from a battle, play to increase loss by 1 Force.
Cancels: It Could Be Worse

Lore: Some Imperial starfighters are equipped with sensors, informing the pilot when an enemy craft has targeted him. The pilot's evasive maneuvers cost him time, but save his life.
Gametext: If you have a piloted capital starship armed with a starship weapon, use 2 Force to target an opponent's starship present. Until end of your next turn, target cannot move and its pilots may not apply ability toward drawing battle destiny.
Counterpart: They've Shut Down The Main Reactor

Lore: Luke and Leia nearly fell over the retracted bridge across the Death Star's central core while trying to elude stormtroopers. They were soon trapped on the precipice.
Gametext: Use 1 Force and target one Rebel (on table) of ability > 2. Choose a number from 1 to 6. You may retrieve that amount from your Lost Pile if you now draw destiny > chosen number. If you fail, Rebel is lost.

CardName: On The Payroll Of The Trade Federation
Lore: A political agenda is no use without supporters. And in the world of politics, left and right often meet in the middle.
Gametext: Target an opponent's character at Galactic Senate if you have a senator there with a matching agenda. For remainder of turn: your senator's politics is increased by target's current politics, and target's politics is then reduced to zero.

Lore: "Cable out. Let 'er go!"
Gametext: If you are about to draw power harpoon weapon destiny, add ability of one pilot aboard same vehicle.
IsPulled: Commander Wedge Antilles\par Commander Wedge Antilles (V)

Lore: When a wampa is wounded, the other members of its pack band together to repel the threat.
Gametext: Habitat: Hoth sites. Deploys only to Wampa Cave. For remainder of game, all wampas are selective creatures.
Information: Deploys free at Hoth: Wampa Cave.
Combo: Bog-wing\par Bog-wing\par Mynock\par Mynock\par Nudj\par One-Arm\par Scurrier\par Sleen\par Vine Snake\par Vine Snake\par

Lore: An elegant weapon for a more civilized age.

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, D-2)\par Operatives are identified by their title, X Operative, with X being a system. The operative is considered a 'matching operative' for system X (e.g., Kiffex Operative is a matching operative for Kiffex). \par Operatives are restricted by special rules as follows: \par - You may not voluntarily deploy or move your operative to (or through) a location on its matching planet where you already have an operative (even if inactive) of the same card title. \par - If, at any time, two of your Operatives (even if inactive) of the same card title are at the same location on their matching planet, you must choose one to be lost (you may choose an inactive operative to be lost). \par - Your operative character on its matching planet may not apply its ability toward drawing battle destiny. Your operative may not control a location on its matching planet for any reason unless you have other cards there capable of controlling the location (e.g., an ability-1 character or a battle droid). Your operatives still occupy that location (and may battle or be battled), but may not Force drain or flip an objective alone.
