Rules: Intruder Missile may not deploy on Outrider:\par \par http://www.swccgpc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?t=16525\par \par Changes to "Characteristics" re: "(LS) Intruder Missile"\par \par Intruder Missile may not deploy on Outrider:\par \par http://www.swccgpc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?t=16525\par \par Changes to "Characteristics" and application to "(LS) Intruder Missile":\par \par In an ideal world we'd have no characteristics rules and lists and instead just list all aspects of a card, on the card. Since that would require a revision to thousands of cards, that's simply not practical. Every effort has been made to identify and discern what are and are not characteristics. Some may be missing from the list, while others are deliberately absent. Discerning which is which requires a bit of research and judgment.\par \par After investigating, we're adding skiff and sandcrawler to the list of characteristics which apply to vehicles.\par \par This brings us to the matter of (LS) Intruder Missile. This weapon and its possible interaction with Outrider has been a matter the PC has been considering for some time. By the rules, the one could not deploy on the other, but we were not ignorant of the possibility that this was an error of omission. Having looked through the evidence, we're now confident that Intruder Missile was not intended to work with Outrider.\par \par We do not make these decisions lightly, and attempt to be thorough in our research of the original intent of the card interactions. We searched the records of play testing that we have from the development of Shadows of the Empire (the set that was incorporated into Reflections 2). In an original version of the Outrider, it was created to work with Intruder Missile, both via game text and the inclusion of the "YT-2400" in the subtype box. However, the game text was stricken over the course of play testing, and the "YT-2400" text moved out of the subtype box into the lore. This move was significant - the characteristic rules were well in place at this time, and Decipher had ensured that references to starships were almost entirely to icons or the contents of the subtype box. The only exceptions to this were defined characteristics (all ships are enclosed and all TIE/sa and B-wings are bombers) or squadron designations (which could be found in title, lore, or game text). Decipher, in fact, released only one card which was referenced by its lore instead of subtype: Blockade Flagship, because "Droid Control Ship" would not fit in that box - and Decipher then made a note to declare Droid Control Ship a characteristic.\par \par Neither of these cases applied to Outrider - our tests using the original templates showed that "YT-2400" would fit with room to spare, and we know that Decipher made no such announcement. In addition, the text on Intruder Missile states that it also may deploy on the Falcon. It was not until two years after Intruder Missile came out that a Falcon was created that didn't state "YT-1300" in lore (both the original and Lando in Millennium Falcon did). If Decipher intended to reference it in lore, this specific mention wouldn't have been necessary.\par \par Given the state of the characteristic rules at the time by Decipher, the striking of the game text, and the deliberate choice to remove a referenced card aspect from the subtype box, we feel this is sufficient evidence to support the existing ruling: Intruder Missile may not deploy on Outrider.\par \par Because this matter has confused many players over the years, we are going to issue the following errata to Intruder Missile (LS) in the hopes of minimizing further confusion:\par \par LS Intruder Missile:\par Deploy on your B-wing, Z-95, YT-1300 Transport, or Falcon. May target a capital starship for free. Draw destiny. Add 3 if that capital starship was targeted by another weapon this turn. Target hit if total destiny > defense value. After firing, place Missile in Used Pile.

Lore: Weapons like lightsabers, turbolasers and blasters run on powerful energy cells or generators. Occasionally, these cells overheat causing the weapon to unexpectedly explode.
Gametext: Target any weapon (except a Gaderffii Stick or any Ewok weapon). Draw destiny. Weapon lost if destiny < weapon's destiny number. If destiny = 0, the character or starship carrying weapon is also lost.
Information: Good tracking will make the Light Side lightsaber wielding Jedi lost.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-12)\par This Interrupt may destroy artillery weapons. However, only the artillery weapon itself is lost, because there is no character or starship "carrying" it. This interrupt may also target a character with a permanent weapon icon; however, it only has an effect if the destiny draw = 0 (character with weapon is lost).

However, inactive cards do not count towards either player's power total because they are not on table for such purposes. This card can be played at a location where opponent has 0 power, but not one where he has no power.

Information: While aboard Blockade Flagship, Nute Gunray adds 3 to destiny of destroyer droids if drawn for battle destiny.
Combo: P-59 + Daultay Dofine

Lore: Trade Federation droideka led by unit commander P-59. Assisted in the attempt to keep the Jedi ambassadors from breaching the battleship's command center.
Gametext: Permanent weapon is Twin Cannons (may target a character or vehicle for free; draw destiny; if destiny +2 > defense value, target hit and opponent loses 1 Force). While with a destroyer droid at a site, adds one battle destiny.
Information: While aboard Blockade Flagship, Nute Gunray adds 3 to destiny of destroyer droids if drawn for battle destiny.
Combo: P-60 + Daultay Dofine

Lore: Queen Amidala posed as one of her own handmaidens for added safety as well as to keep an eye on her Jedi protectors. Was to be protected by the Jedi at all times.
Gametext: Twice per game may deploy Qui-Gon or Obi-Wan here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While present with your Jedi at a site, opponent may not target Amidala with weapons.
Information: Amidala personas are:\par \par Padme Naberrie\par Padme Naberrie (V)\par Queen Amidala\par Queen Amidala, Ruler Of Naboo\par -----\par Power 3, Ability 3, destiny 3 and Forfeit 5 - all for 2 deploy! Statistics alone are a very solid reason to consider the disguised Queen for your deck! But there's more!\par \par For one thing, this version of the Amidala persona is a Republic character, thus unaffected by anything that targets Rebels. For example, Charming To The Last, Put All Sections On Alert and the popular Scum deck helper, None Shall Pass, all fall flat when faced with this Republican.\par \par Of course, her real kicker is in her game text. Besides the fact that her Jedi protectors keep her safe from weapon fire, she can even 'download' them! Twice per game, deploy Qui-Gon or Obi-Wan to Padme's site. That's a very fast way to get out any version of two of your biggest characters. And of course, you could just use it to get Qui-Gon twice to stall an opponent's Hunt Down, or perhaps Ben Kenobi twice to push your Profit deck along.\par \par So what are her disdvantages? Only one, but it is red, black and nasty - Darth Maul is looking for her. But even then, Padme benefits - if Dark Side is playing a 'Hunt The Queen' strategy (I Will Find Them Quickly Master and the Epic Event, If The Trace Was Correct) then she can deploy straight from your Reserve Deck.
Pulls: Ben Kenobi\par  Obi-Wan Kenobi\par Obi-Wan Kenobi (V)\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Jedi Knight\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner\par Obi-Wan Kenobi, Padawan Learner (V)\par Obi-Wan With Lightsaber\par Master Qui-Gon\par Master Qui-Gon (V)\par Qui-Gon Jinn\par Qui-Gon Jinn With Lightsaber\par Qui-Gon Jinn, Jedi Master
IsPulled: Sabe
Combo: Padme Naberrie + Jerus Jannick
MatchingWeapon: Amidala's Blaster

Lore: \b Smugglers\b0  from many worlds are hunted by the Empire for providing arms and supplies to the Alliance. The Outer Rim is their refuge.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (or 3 to power of anything he drives). When driving a transport vehicle, it moves for free and he adds one battle destiny.
IsPulled: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)\par Arleil Schous\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

Lore: Corellian spice trader. Makes a large profit by selling spice in Jabba's court. Secretly uses part of the profit to help fund the Rebellion.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While at Audience Chamber, all your Corellians are power and forfeit +1 (+2 if non-unique) and your Force generation at the Corellia system is +2.
Information: Palejo Reshad follows the representative theory that is the basis for many aliens in Jabba's Palace. He makes your Corellians a little bit better, even Wedge and Han. Granted, they don't get quite the bonus that a non-unique Corellian would, they do receive the bonus. So what can you do with this extra power?Well, besides increasing your battle damage, enhanced power increases your resistance to Counter Assault, and makes using weapons like the Bowcaster a lot easier.
Combo: Palejo Reshad + Corellia

Lore: \b Leader\b0  of the Royal Naboo Security Forces. Fought alongside Amidala in order to capture Viceroy Nute Gunray.
Gametext: Deploys for free to a Naboo site. While with Amidala at a Naboo site, opponent may not target Amidala with weapons. While on Naboo, immune to attrition < 5.
Information: Panaka has one task in life - protect the Queen. He does this well, shielding her from weapon fire during and outside of battle. Of course, your opponent is going to aim his first weapon shot at Panaka, so make sure Amdiala is there to up his defense value to 5. He also has excellent immunity for an ability 3 character, and a deploy cost that makes you cheer for joy. Also, remember he has a blaster he likes, from the Coruscant expansion.
Combo: Panaka, Protector Of The Queen + Queen Amidala + We Don't Have Time For This\par If Amidala and Panaka are in a battle together, add two battle destiny.
MatchingWeapon: Panaka's Blaster

Lore: Naboo blaster personally modified by Captain Panaka. Boosted by extra power packs that allow it to maintain sustained fire in tense situations.
Gametext: Deploy on Panaka. May target a character, creature, or vehicle for free. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +2 > defense value. When this blaster hits a character or vehicle in battle, your total power here is +3 for remainder of battle.
Information: Traditionally, non-lightsaber weapon cards haven't fared too well in SWCCG decks. For one thing, it is difficult to get both the character and his matching weapon into play together without packing extra copies of both cards. And once the weapon is in play, it tends to have a lower chance of hitting a high defense value target than those lightsabers that get two weapon destinies. Finally, most weapons don't have the extra damage that lightsabers can cause through Force drains. Panaka's Blaster looks to be the weapon that bucks the binder fodder trend.\par \par Panaka's Blaster can easily get on the table, since Captain Panaka's game text allows you to deploy a blaster from your Reserve deck. That solves the problem of getting the weapon out where it will do some good. It also has a very respectable chance of hitting a target, requiring a weapon destiny +2 greater than the target's defense value. Of course, the weapon destiny draw can be boosted with cards like Blaster Proficiency.\par \par Beyond these basic characteristics, Panaka's Blaster has two more things going for it. First, if the blaster hits a target in a battle, the Light Side's total power in that battle is +3. The final bonus comes from game text on Captain Panaka: if Panaka hits a character with a blaster, your opponent has to lose 2 Force. This text is an interesting bit of direct damage that encourages the Light Side to battle early and often.\par \par And for those players who really miss the Force drain bonus of lightsabers, there's always the used interrupt Rebel Artillery, which causes a 1 Force loss at a site you control where a non-lightsaber weapon is present. In battle, this interrupt can also cause an additional Force loss when Panaka hits a character. Overall, Panaka's Blaster is one of the most attractive weapons without a glowing blade this game has seen.
IsPulled: Captain Panaka\par Portable Scanner
Combo: Panaka's Blaster + Captain Panaka + Crack Shot + Rebel Artillery\par If Panaka hits a character, the Dark Side will have to lose three Force and the character.
MatchingWeapon: Captain Panaka\par Panaka, Protector Of The Queen

Lore: Cornered by Imperial troops, Han's gambler reflexes led him to do what comes naturally - attack! Surprise assaults work...sometimes.
Gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle where opponent has more than double your power, reveal up to 3 cards from your Reserve Deck. Of those 3, deploy anywhere (for free) any characters, starships, vehicles, devices, or weapons. Any others are lost.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-12)\par See Emergency Deployment.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-6)\par Emergency Deployment\par Although this card allows you to deploy 'anywhere,' it does not give you permission to ignore deployment restrictions. For example, the Hoth energy shield will still prevent Dark Side deployment to most Hoth sites.

Lore: Ewok \b scout\b0. Son of Warok. Brave, adventurous \b thief\b0. Stole an Imperial speeder bike to create a diversion. "Not bad for a little furball."
Gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each (Light Side Force icon) at same Endor site. May pilot only speeder bikes. Once during each of your control phases, may take one Free Ride into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
Pulls: Free Ride\par Free Ride & Endor Celebration
IsPulled: General Crix Madine\par Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control).

Lore: A \b senator\b0  known for his ability to deflect blame. It is rumored that Argente receives kickbacks from a few corporations to thwart other companies' developments.
Gametext: \b Agendas\b0 : ambition, taxation. While in a senate majority, opponent's non-unique starships and non-unique vehicles are each deploy +2 and power -1. Argente is politics +X, where X = number of opponent's senators at same site.
IsPulled: Squabbling Delegates

Lore: Yoda didn't say anything bad about taking the "quick and easy corridor."
Gametext: Cancel Rite Of Passage. OR Relocate one of your characters at an interior mobile site to a related interior mobile site.
Information: Combo Card: Path Of Least Resistance & Revealed
Cancels: Rite Of Passage

Gametext: Place one opponent's Undercover spy in opponent's Used Pile. OR If opponent just deployed a spy to a site where opponent has no presence or Force icons, return spy to hand. Any Force used to deploy spy remains used and that card may not deploy this turn. OR Relocate one of your characters at an interior mobile site to a related interior mobile site.

Lore: Small, \b enclosed\b0  patrol fighter used on many worlds to help maintain order. A cheaper alternative to the Bespin Motors cloud car.
Gametext: Power +1 at Coruscant or Bespin. May add 1 driver and 1 passenger. May deploy or move as a 'react.' At cloud sectors, may move and be targeted by weapons like a starfighter.

Lore: Small, lightly armed, \b enclosed\b0  vehicle widely used throughout the galaxy. Sometimes used as a pleasure craft by wealthy eccentrics.
Gametext: Power +1 at Coruscant or Bespin. May add 1 driver and 1 passenger. May deploy or move as a 'react.' At cloud sectors, may move and be targeted by weapons like a starfighter.

Lore: Heavy Imperial patrols on Endor forced the Rebels to deploy covertly. The required stealth measures created many complications.
Gametext: Deploy on Bunker. While you control Bunker, each time opponent deploys a vehicle, starship or Rebel to an Endor site (except Rebel Landing Site), that card cannot move or battle for remainder of turn and opponent must lose 1 Force. (Immune to Alter.)
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans\par You Cannot Hide Forever\par You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points
Combo: Perimeter Patrol + Closed Door\par -----\par Perimeter Patrol + Closed Door + Bad Feeling Have I + Navy Trooper Fensom
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-12)\par The Light Side must lose 1 Force when deploying to an Endor: Bunker controlled by Dark Side.

Lore: "It's a good bet the Empire knows we're here."
Gametext: Use 1 Force to peek at any one card which is face-down at a location. OR Use 1 Force to peek at opponent's hand. You may move each droid spy and Infantry Mine you find there to opponent's Used Pile. OR Cancel Probe Telemetry.
Combo: Perimeter Scan + Wyron Serper\par Add 2 to the destiny of this card.
Cancels: Probe Telemetry

Lore: Good-natured former pilot whose family owns a galactic transportation company. Years of travel has enabled her to learn many loopholes in spaceport protocol.
Gametext: Deploys for free at a docking bay. Adds 2 to the power of anything she pilots. While at opponent's docking bay, adds 2 to your Force drains there, and your other characters there are defense value +1 and immune to attrition < 4.
Information: Ahhh.... the delectable Phylo Gandish. This seemingly-unassuming lady has actually spent more time travelling the highways and byways of the galaxy than you've had Juri Juices! She may look beguilingly gentle, and most the time she is, but behind that enigmatic smile lies a woman you want on your side when you lead your forces into opposition territory!\par \par Ability 4 is a great start. Add the fact that she is an experienced and effective +2 pilot, and it's now definitely worth paying 4 to deploy her. She's even immune to M'iiyoom! Do you believe though that you can deploy her for free to any docking bay!? Usually not hard to find one of those in today's environment! The ability to deploy free is huge, and almost single-handedly justifies her inclusion in most Light Side decks. For example, stock a docking bay and Insurrection (who doesn't? Especially with a combo version imminent!) and she can now be added to even your world-beating Watch Your Step deck.\par \par All this, and we haven't even got to the kicker. Get her to your opponent's docking bay, preferably with a little backup (cause she attracts a lot of attention!), and suddenly the opponent may be left regretting that he ever started with Imperial Arrest Order. Your characters there receive a boosted defense value, and even some immunity. This all represents the fact that this lady of the hyperspace lane knows her way around spaceports as if she was born there.\par \par If your Phylo-led expeditionary force takes the docking bay for their own, your drains there are now +2. Thats a drain of 3 at every one of a dozen of your opponent's docking bays. If you are protecting her with an appropriately armed Qui-Gon (who is now defense value 8!), then that saber will be adding to the Force drain insult.\par \par With that sort of damage, suddenly your opponent is being forcibly diverted from more important tasks (like flipping his objective) as he is comitted to throwing resources to defend what was only going to be a site for a little force-generation. That may well tilt the game your way.\par \par So with this wonder woman on your side, what do you have to fear? Weapon fire and attrition are the biggest threats, as Gandish may very well be the only one of your characters at that location who is not immune. As for weapons, sabers will paint her with a big target sign, and 4-LOM may very well find her to be a firm favorite in his targeting reticle. If you want to play sneaky, put her inside a vehicle for a little weapon and choke protection, perhaps even aboard a Rogue Squadron snowspeeder for some immunity as well (if you can get the appropriate pilot aboard). Remember, she will still be working her magic, and also adding 2 power - more than she would if left exposed on the ground.\par \par Keep an eye out for this great gal! You're going to be seeing a lot of her. And remember, beware the double-edged sword that is the unattended docking bay!

Lore: Darth Vader often used physical means of 'persuasion' to get information. Captain Antilles of \ul Tantive IV\ul0  chose to die rather than reveal the location of the stolen Death Star plans.
Gametext: Cause one Rebel Trooper to be immediately lost. OR If a Dark Jedi is present at a battle you have just won, use 1 Force to attempt to choke any opposing character present. Draw destiny. If destiny > target's ability, target is lost.

Lore: Heavy blaster fire hampered Han's attempts to open the Back Door to the Endor control bunker.
Gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Opponent may not 'react' away from a battle where you have a blaster present. Also, if you have a blaster present when opponent cancels a battle, draw destiny, opponent loses Force equal to destiny draw. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Prepared Defenses.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans\par You Cannot Hide Forever\par You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points

Lore: Pit droids are used by Podracer pilots to assist in the maintenance of their racer. While a high standard is usually maintained, sometimes things can get out of hand.
Gametext: Use 3 Force to reveal opponent's hand. All cards opponent has 3 or more of in hand are lost. OR Use 1 Force to 'repair' your Podracer. OR Target a Podracer. Draw destiny. If destiny > Podracer's destiny number, target Podracer is 'damaged.'
Information: Pit Crews provides a versatile card for your podracing deck. It can be used offensively to make the opponent think twice about drawing race destiny, or it can be used to ensure that your own Podracer is in peak racing performance by quickly repairing any damage that you might encounter during the podrace.\par \par Or, if you draw this card after the podrace has already been decided, you can play it very effectively against swarm decks who might think their duplicates are protected by Yarna d'al' Gargan. But even if not playing against a swarm deck, this can give you a quick look at their hand to plan your next turn more effectively.
IsPulled: We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: Manufactured by Serv-O-Droid on Cyrillia. Collapses into a compact form when hit on the nose.
Gametext: While at Podracer Bay, once during each of your control phases may lose 1 Force to target your Podracer. Place target's top race destiny in Lost Pile, and draw one race destiny. During any control phase may use 1 Force to 'repair' your Podracer.
Information: This little droid can definitely give you the edge in any podrace. He all but guarantees you will never have to keep any low destiny and ensures your Podracer stays in the lead. If you draw low, you can redraw it right away, and if it's still low, you can try again in your next control phase before you would draw for that turn. He also makes sure your Podracer is never damaged, ensuring that you'll never have to lose force to draw destiny, except for when you're redrawing yours with his other ability.

Lore: The Emperor's defense of the forest moon of Endor appeared to work with devastating effectiveness.
Gametext: If your scout is battling opponent's scout, spy or operative, add one battle destiny. OR If you have a spy or scout at Bunker or any prison, place out of play one captured spy of ability < 3 or captured operative there. Retrieve Force equal to double that captive's forfeit.
Information: Prisons are:\par \par Cloud City: Security Tower\par Death Star: Detention Block Corridor\par Jabba's Palace: Dungeon

Lore: KDY v-150 surface-to-space heavy ion cannon. The most powerful ground-based weapon in the Rebel arsenal. Reserved for strategic installations due to limited supply.
Gametext: Deploy on an exterior Rebel Base site. During a battle at related system, may target a capital starship there using 2 Force. Draw destiny. If destiny +3 > armor, all starship weapons aboard target are lost, power = 0 and hyperspeed = 0.
IsPulled: Captain Yutani\par Portable Scanner

Lore: Key installations are protected from bombardment by a complex network of early warning sensors, emergency shields and fast response fighters.
Gametext: Plays on any interior site. This location may not be targeted by Proton Bombs.

Lore: The Empire crushes resistance with massive orbital bombardment. The coordinated attack of a TIE bomber wing reduces a planet's surface to rubble.
Gametext: Deploy on table. You may add up to 5 to destiny of each TIE Bomber drawn for weapon or battle destiny. You may add 1 to Proton Bomb weapon destiny draws. Asteroid Sanctuary is canceled unless present with opponent's starship. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Prepared Defenses.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Cancels: Asteroid Sanctuary unless present with opponent's starship.

Lore: Luke and Han took the armor suits from fallen stormtroopers and used them as both protection and disguise to penetrate the detention cell block aboard the Death Star.
Gametext: Deploy on a Death Star site where a Stormtrooper was just lost. Target one of your characters not on Death Star. When target reaches Utinni Effect, relocate to target. Target is now 'disguised:' gains \b spy\b0  skill, power and forfeit +2, and armor = 5.
Information: Elom allows Plastoid Armor to deploy on any Rebel or alien at same mobile site (as if 'stolen').
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, F-2)\par Errata.

Lore: Amidala did not hold much hope in the options she had. Regardless of how limited the choices, she had to choose one path to try and avert disaster befalling Naboo.
Gametext: Deploy on table. If no senator here, you may place a senator here from hand to cancel an opponent's Force drain. If a \b justice agenda\b0  here, during a battle where opponent has a weapon and you do not, may cancel a just drawn weapon destiny to cause a re-draw.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Sanity And Compassion
Cancels: An opponent's Force Drain.\par A just drawn weapon destiny to cause a redraw.

Lore: Kel Dor \b Jedi Council member\b0  descended from a long line of Jedi. Known for exceptional sensory skills, Plo Koon's control of the Force is unmatched by most.
Gametext: Deploys only to Jedi Council Chamber. While at Jedi Council Chamber, immune to attrition and, once per turn if a weapon or battle destiny was just drawn, may cancel and cause a re-draw.
Information: Like just about all the Jedi in The Phantom Menace, Plo Koon spends all of his time in the Jedi Council Chamber.\par As a result, he can only deploy there, and his game text only takes effect while at that location. But that's okay, since his game text is global, he'll work just fine in the comfort of the Council Chamber. While there, this powerful character will be immune to attrition, making it difficult for the Dark Side to eliminate him from play.\par And your opponent will want to eliminate him from play, since once per turn he has the ability to cancel and cause a redraw for any battle or weapon destiny draw. This text can be used offensively or defensively. If you just drew a system or a main character for battle destiny, cancel it and redraw, likely causing more damage to your opponent in the process. On the other hand, if Darth Maul just got lucky and hit Obi-Wan with his lightsaber, cause a redraw in the hopes that the second draw might not be as good.\par This text can really come in handy in the endgame, when your opponent might have just enough cards in his Reserve Deck for that lightsaber swing and a battle destiny. If you cancel and cause a redraw, he'll likely not have enough cards left for battle destiny.
IsPulled: Speak With The Jedi Council\par Tatooine: City Outskirts
Combo: Plo Koon + Depa Billaba + Jedi Council Chamber\par -----\par Plo Koon + Are You Brain Dead?!
MatchingWeapon: \par
Cancels: A weapon or battle destiny draw to cause a redraw.

Lore: Podracing demands constant attention to many variables as well as all opponents. Failure to do so can often result in reduced performance.
Gametext: USED: If you just verified opponent's Reserve Deck, search that Reserve Deck and place one Interrupt found there out of play. LOST: Lose 1 Force to remove a race destiny (random selection) from any Podracer and place it in owner's hand.
Information: The Used portion of this Interrupt is same as in Changing The Odds from the Light Side.\par -----\par This card has two very useful functions. A lot of popular Light decks use recycling interrupts like Fall of a Legend or Throw Me Another Charge which look through their decks to recycle high destiny interrupts. This card lets you punish your opponent for using cards just to look through their reserve deck or playing interrupts which don't really do anything. The Used portion of this card lets you look through their Reserve Deck and place any interrupt you find there out of play. If you're packing a couple of this interrupt, you can make your opponent think twice before looking for a Weather Vane.\par \par The Lost portion is also useful. If your Dark deck is podracing, you will definitely want to run multiples of this card. This interrupt will set Anakin's racer back, giving you more time to finish the race; even better, the card that goes back to the Light player's hand might be just enough to create a tie, which all but guarantees a Sebulba win.
IsPulled: We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: In a military situation, on a regional or galactic scale, commands sometimes get misinterpreted. A local commander giving orders is far more reliable.
Gametext: Cancel Demotion, Restricted Deployment, Commence Recharging, Logistical Delay, They're On Dantooine, Asteroid Sanctuary, Scramble, Order To Engage, No Disintegrations, Asteroids Do Not Concern Me, Report To Lord Vader or What Is Thy Bidding, My Master?
Information: This card is a more specific counter than the general purpose Alter. With the addition to the play environment of cards like Control and Do Or Do Not/There Is No Try, specific counters are likely to start gaining in popularity.\par \par For a Dark Side primarily ground deck (such as a bounty hunting deck or a Walker Garrison deck), the specific counters might be a very good direction to head in. Point Man can cancel some of the cards that can really give these decks headaches, especially Asteroid Sanctuary. It can also be advantageous to cancel Scramble. Order To Engage, and No Disintegrations in a deck of this type.\par \par Point Man can be combined with Boring Conversation Anyway in a deck designed to hamper a Sense/Alter strategy with the Tentacle/Control tactic. This will allow a measure of counter card advantage.
Combo: Point Man + Boring Conversation Anyway + Tentacle
Cancels: Asteroid Sanctuary\par Asteroids Do Not Concern Me\par Commence Recharging\par Demotion\par Logistical Delay\par No Disintegrations!\par Order To Engage\par Report To Lord Vader\par Restricted Deployment\par Scramble\par They're On Dantooine\par What Is Thy Bidding, My Master?

Lore: Using lateral thrusters, an X-wing can suddenly change direction, rotating around to fire at a pursuing ship.
Gametext: If your piloted starship armed with a starship weapon is in a battle, lose 1 Force to reduce the power of one opponent's starship in that battle to zero. OR Place one opponent's starship just 'hit' in Lost Pile.

Lore: "Only Imperial stormtroopers are so precise."
Gametext: During a battle, target opponent's character or vehicle present with two (or more) of your weapons. Add all weapon destiny draws together. Apply that total separately for each weapon in an order of your choosing.
Information: Sergeant Narthax makes Precise Attack targeting at same or related site a Used Interrupt.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-12)\par See Combined Attack.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-4)\par Combined Attack\par (Errata) This Interrupt combines the firing of two or more weapons into a single action. You may choose to fire any or all of your applicable weapons, at normal use of the Force.

Lore: "Luke, trust me."
Gametext: USED: During a battle at a system or sector, instead of firing one of your starship weapons at a target, reduce that target's power by 4 until end of turn. LOST: During a battle at a system or sector, use 3 Force to cancel one battle destiny just drawn.
Cancels: One battle destiny in a battle at a system or sector.

Lore: "Sir, we just lost the main rear deflector shield. One more direct hit on the back quarter and we're done for!"
Gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on table. Any card which is 'hit' may not be used to satisfy attrition. (Immune to Alter.)
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: Ruthless and well-equipped for both air and ground assault, Vader's feared Death Squadron came to the icy Rebel Base with total domination in mind.
Gametext: Deploy on table. Your Force drains at Hoth sites may not be canceled. Once per turn, if you just deployed an AT-AT to a Hoth site, you may deploy (at -2) a Star Destroyer to the Hoth system (or vice versa) from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Prepared Defenses.
Pulls: A Star Destroyer to the Hoth system if an AT-AT was just deployed to a Hoth site (or vice versa).
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par Veers (V)\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: Coolant emitted by the TCF32 Carbonite Encasement Apparatus is rumored to have a mildly euphoric effect on Ugnaughts. Individuals on TCF32 duty are regarded with envy.
Gametext: USED: Add 2 to Carbon Freezing destiny. LOST: If one of your Ugnaughts is defending in a battle, add one battle destiny.
Information: This card has a couple of uses, which complement each other nicely. If you're building a Carbon Freezing deck, this is a quick and convenient way to get a +2 on your destiny draw. A few other modifiers, and you'll be freezing everything that walks into the Carbonite Chamber.\par \par Even if you're not playing a Carbon Freezing deck, this card can obviously benefit from the presence of Ugnaughts. Unlike most "defending" cards, this does not require your Ugnaught to be alone, so if you have an Ugnaught and 3 other ability present, you can get two destiny draws. Plus, their ability to get weapons and devices from your Lost Pile to your *hand* makes Ugnaughts useful even in a non-Carbon Freezing deck. And, if you are playing Carbon Freezing, you'll want plenty of Ugnaughts anyway. You might find yourself using both versions of Prepare the Chamber in the same game.
IsPulled: Carbonite Chamber Console
Combo: Prepare the Chamber + Carbonite Chamber Console + 3 Ugnaughts + Carbon Freezing

Lore: Since the debacle at Yavin, the Emperor places a premium on the security of his costly war machine.
Gametext: USED: Add 1 to your battle destiny just drawn. STARTING: Deploy up to three Effects if each of them deploys for free, is always immune to Alter and has "deploy on table" (or "deploy on your side of table") in its game text. Place Interrupt in Lost Pile.
Information: Please check Sonn's list here:\par http://www.swccgpc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?t=6433\par \par Startable Effects are:\par \par A Day Long Remembered (V)\par A Million Voices Crying Out\par Ability, Ability, Ability (V)\par Abyss\par All Wrapped Up\par Allegations Of Corruption\par An Entire Legion Of My Best Troops\par Aratech Corporation (V)\par Battle Order\par Battle Order & First Strike\par Begin Landing Your Troops\par  Biker Scout Gear\par Blaster Rack (V)\par Colo Claw Fish\par Combat Response\par Conduct Your Search\par Crossfire\par Crush The Rebellion\par Despair (V)\par Do They Have A Code Clearance?\par Endor Shield (V)\par Empire's New Order\par Establish Control (V)\par Fanfare\par Fighters Straight Ahead\par First Strike\par His Name Is Anakin\par I Will Find Them Quickly, Master\par I'm Sorry\par Imperial Arrest Order\par Imperial Arrest Order & Secret Plans\par Imperial Decree\par Imperial Decree (V)\par Imperial Domination (V)\par Imperial Justice (V)\par Inconsequential Losses\par Kuat Drive Yards (V)\par Mobilization Points\par Naboo Occupation\par Ni Chuba Na??\par No Bargain\par No Escape\par Opee Sea Killer\par Oppressive Enforcement\par Pinned Down\par Planetary Subjugation\par Power Of The Hutt\par Prepare For A Surface Attack\par Resistance\par Sando Aqua Monster\par Secret Plans\par Something Special Planned For Them\par Something Special Planned For Them (V)\par The Hutts Are Gangsters\par The Phantom Menace\par There Is No Try\par There Is No Try & Oppressive Enforcement\par They Will Be No Match For You\par Watto's Box\par We Shall Double Our Efforts\par Weather Vane\par Wipe Them Out, All Of Them\par You Cannot Hide Forever\par You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points\par You May Start Your Landing
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-12)\par Effects that are "always immune to Alter" means any Effect which is unconditionally immune to Alter according to it's own game text, as these conditions must be met before such an Effect is on table. Therefore cards that are immune to Alter based on a condition in their game text (such as Come Here You Big Coward) cannot be deployed with this starting interrupt. Cards which are immune to Alter in their game text but can have that immunity canceled by other cards may be deployed using this Interrupt. For example, Prepared Defenses could still be used to deploy Mobilization Points even if Don't Do That Again was on table. When deploying Effects using this Starting Interrupt, each Effect deploys separately, and all automatic actions resolve normally. Thus if this starting interrupt is used to deploy Naboo Occupation, No Escape, and Imperial Arrest Order, Naboo Occupation may be deployed first (and will be immediately lost), followed by No Escape (which allows the dark side player to take the top card of the lost pile into hand) followed by Imperial Arrest Order.

Lore: "A location is affected by the history of the events which occur there. The Force "...binds the galaxy together" and has an ebb and flow."
Gametext: Deploy on any location to add one (Dark Side Force icon) icon and one (Light Side Force icon) icon.
Information: By adding one Force icon this card is no 'force drain bonus' so the +1 can not be canceled.\par It creates battlegrounds out of non-battlegrounds.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Combo: Presence Of The Force + Endor Shield (V) + Endor\par Three Force icons for you, none for the Light Side. Opportunity to drain for three.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-12)\par This Effect is not cumulative; if you play two at the same location, the second one has no result (see cumulative).

Lore: Imperial starships that perform with distinction are highly publicized in an attempt to make the pilots look like heroes to the citizens of the Empire.
Gametext: If opponent just lost a starship in a battle you won, deploy on your participating starfighter. Once during each of opponent's move phases, opponent loses 1 Force (2 if starfighter is a TIE/ln). Also, that starfighter is power +2. (Immune to Control.)

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, A-13)\par This Immediate Effect is now unique (*) and should read as "*Pride Of The Empire".

Lore: Falleen \b gangster\b0  and \b leader\b0. Black Sun agent. Dark Prince of the Black Sun crime syndicate. Fortifies his personal defenses with information gathered by his agents.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When in battle at a site, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise and total ability of 6 or more required for opponent to draw battle destiny here. Immune to attrition < 5 while Vader not here.

Lore: Prominent \b leader\b0  in the struggling Alliance. Former member of the Imperial Senate. Beginning to discover her true heritage. Likes scoundrels.
Gametext: Deploys only on Hoth or Cloud City. Adds 1 to power of anything she pilots. May deploy (on Hoth or Cloud City) or move as a 'react' to same site as Han or Luke. Immune to attrition < 3.
Information: Leia Organa personas are:\par \par Boushh\par Daughter Of Skywalker\par Daughter Of Skywalker (V)\par General Leia Organa\par Leia\par Leia (V)\par Leia Organa\par Leia Organa (V)\par Leia With Blaster Rifle\par Leia, Rebel Princess\par Princess Leia\par Princess Leia (V)\par Princess Leia Organa\par Princess Organa\par Prisoner 2187\par -----\par With Cloud City, we finally get a new version of everyone's favorite princess, Leia Organa. And this version certainly packs a punch!\par \par Gone is the spy skill, but that's OK, she has other priorities now. She can pilot starships and vehicles adding 1 to power. She does have a deployment restriction, but it is a pretty good variety. She may also deploy as a "react" to Hoth or Cloud City if Han or Luke are there. She may also move as a react to their site.\par \par Probably the biggest change in Princess Leia is the ability 4. Yes, that's right, Leia can now use Anakin's Lightsaber. Another bonus, Leia can step in for Son Of Skywalker and Jedi train. With her Reflection, Leia tests as if she were ability 5. This leaves your Son Of Skywalker free to right the wrongs of the universe and face Darth Vader on Cloud City!

Lore: Captured by Jabba. Princess Leia provided a distraction for his henchbeings. Waiting for the first chance to escape. Really made Jabba's tail wiggle.
Gametext: * Deploys free as an escorted captive of Jabba, or a bounty hunter (you may not initiate battle there on same turn). While a captive, opponent's unique (*) aliens at same site are forfeit -2. If released, retrieve 5 Force. Immune to attrition < 3.
Information: Leia Organa personas are:\par \par Boushh\par Daughter Of Skywalker\par Daughter Of Skywalker (V)\par General Leia Organa\par Leia\par Leia (V)\par Leia Organa\par Leia Organa (V)\par Leia With Blaster Rifle\par Leia, Rebel Princess\par Princess Leia\par Princess Leia (V)\par Princess Leia Organa\par Princess Organa\par Prisoner 2187\par -----\par One of the hallmarks of the set, the new Princess Leia is a terrific character, with one extreme drawback, in that you must deploy her as a captive. This is simplified if your opponent helps you out by deploying a bounty hunter or Jabba to a site alone, or near alone. Simply deploy her one turn, hold on to your attack force, and assault the lone hunter another turn. If your opponent is more built up, or playing a Bounty/All Wrapped Up based deck, you'll have to be more crafty, with weapons and destiny-adding interrupts.\par \par Another strategy is to simply leave her as a captive. The reduction in your opponent's forfeit values can be near-devastating, since the Dark Side's aliens are already low in forfeit. Add in some high destinies during battle, and you can wipe out an entire site with surprisingly little effort.
IsPulled: Leia's Back\par Seeking An Audience\par Seeking An Audience (V)
Combo: Princess Leia Organa replacing another Leia\par -----\par Princess Leia Organa (captive) + Luke Skywalker + Anakin's Lightsaber\par -----\par Princess Leia Organa + Jerus Jannick
MatchingWeapon: Anakin's Lightsaber\par Anakin's Lightsaber (V)\par Leia's Blaster Rifle\par Leia's Sporting Blaster
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-13)\par This version of the Leia persona enters play either by deploying as a captive or, on rare occasion, by replacing a different Leia using the persona replacement rule (only if that other Leia is a captive of Jabba or a bounty hunter). Leia must still obey all normal deployment rules (e.g., she cannot deploy without presence or Force icons or to an opponent's starship or vehicle). All of this character card's game text should be applied whenever appropriate, even when she's a captive (this is a specific exception to the rules).

Lore: A probe droid encodes and scrambles messages before using its telescoping antennae to transmit information through hyperspace.
Gametext: Deploy on your Probe Droid. Adds 2 to X for that droid. OR Use 1 Force to deploy on one of your other droids. When at a site you control, once during each of your control phases, you may peek at one card randomly selected from opponent's hand.
Information: Probe droids are:\par \par Probe Droid\par Sith Probe Droid\par Sith Probe Droid (V)

Lore: Arakyd Viper probe droid. Has sensors specifically designed to detect traces of Rebel activity. Equipped with an auto-destruct mechanism. A highly durable \b spy\b0  droid.
Gametext: Deploys only if a Star Destroyer on table. Once during each of your control phases, may peek at X cards randomly selected from opponent's hand, where X = number of (Light Side Force icon) icons at same site. May Force drain, initiate battle and be battled.
Information: You can't deploy to the same site as the Probe Droid (he has no ability), but you can Force Drain with them, and with a forfeit of 5 they can look after themselves too. You can spread them out and send them Undercover, spread them out to Force drain or use them to ambush a lone character.\par \par The Probe Droid is the first and currently only non-unique spy in the Star Wars Customizable Card Game. While this can be a terrific advantage, the Probe Droid's deployment restriction makes it rather difficult for it to deploy in any deck except for a strict Star Destroyer deck. However, in that deck, the Probe Droid has little to no equal for ground defense. Being non-unique has tremendous advantages in that you never have to worry if there is another Probe Droid on the table. Plus, with Undercover, you could potentially have an Undercover Probe Droid at every site, aiding in the deploy of such powerhouses as Darth Vader and Boba Fett to a hard to reach location. With Cane Adiss, these Droids can even go to Dagobah, which can significantly help against a Dagobah Force drain deck.
IsPulled: Captain Piett
Combo: Probe Droids + Nevar Yalnal

Lore: Although a probe droid's primary defense is stealth, many models can be equipped with a laser cannon to enhance the droid's combat and sabotage capabilities.
Gametext: Deploy on your probe droid. May target an artillery weapon (use 5 as defense value), character or creature for free. Draw destiny. Artillery weapon lost if destiny > defense value. Character or creature hit if destiny > defense value.
Information: Probe droids are:\par \par Probe Droid\par Sith Probe Droid\par Sith Probe Droid (V)

Lore: Probe droids use electromagnetic, seismic, acoustic, olfactory and optical sensors. They report their findings using an omnisignal unicode.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to choose X non-unique cards in any Lost Pile and place them out of play, where X = number of probe droids on table. OR If your only character on a planet is a probe droid, your cards deploy -1 to related sites for remainder of turn.
Information: Probe droids are:\par \par Probe Droid\par Sith Probe Droid\par Sith Probe Droid (V)

Lore: Imperial slicers imbed a secret command in a droid's primary performance banks. A predetermined trigger causes a power overload, destroying the droid and anything nearby.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on an opponent's droid (except R2-D2 and C-3PO), 1 on your droid. When either player draws a destiny matching the number of characters at same site, droid 'explodes' (all characters present with Effect are lost).
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Combo: Program Trap + U-3PO (Yoo-Threepio)
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-13)\par Although this Effect is triggered according to the number of characters at same site, only those characters present with it are lost when it explodes. For example, Program Trap is deployed on a droid with Lando aboard an enclosed vehicle at a site. Veers and Chewie are standing outside the vehicle; thus, there are four characters at that site. If either player draws a destiny of 4 (anywhere), the droid explodes, causing itself and Lando (the only other character present with it) to be lost. Although Program Trap may be deployed on a droid anywhere, it may explode only when that droid is at a site.

Lore: "Greetings, Exalted One. Allow me to introduce myself. I am Luke Skywalker, Jedi Knight and friend to Captain Solo." \b Hologram\b0.
Gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Your Force drains are +1 at holosites and opponent must lose an additional 1 Force to draw a card with Shot In The Dark. (Immune to Alter.) OR Deploy on any planet site. Opponent's Force drains are -1 here.
Information: BG-J38 adds 2 to the destiny of each of your holograms and dejariks drawn for battle destiny or weapon destiny.
IsPulled: Holoprojector\par The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Wokling (V)
Combo: Projection Of A Skywalker + a holosite

Lore: "Luke." "Father." "Son, come with me."
Gametext: Cancel Anger, Fear, Aggression when it is inserted or revealed. OR If your opponent just initiated a battle or Force drain, opponent must choose to use 2 Force, or cancel that battle or Force drain.
Cancels: Anger, Fear, Aggression

Lore: Renowned female psychic. Predictor of doom. Agent for Governor Aryon of Tatooine. Tailed Jabba and his thugs to Docking Bay 94 when they confronted Han Solo.
Gametext: If you initiate a battle where present, you must predict the winner before the battle starts. If correct, randomly retrieve one lost card. If incorrect, lose 1 Force. Immune to attrition < 3.

Lore: "Chewie, this won't help me. Hey! Save your strength. There'll be another time. The princess...you have to take care of her."
Gametext: If Leia and Chewie are in a battle together, you may add two battle destiny. OR If Leia is participating in a battle, you may lose Chewie from hand to satisfy all battle damage and attrition against you. OR Cancel I'd Just As Soon Kiss A Wookiee or Frustration.
Information: Protector, like Old Pirates, presents a new twist on the traditional "teamwork" cards, such as Don't Get Cocky and Gift Of The Mentor. Like the traditional cards, this may be played when you have Leia and Chewie together in a battle. Your benefit is 2 added battle destiny. This is an impressive twist, as all other of the destiny-adding teamwork cards involve Luke. In a Teamwork-based deck, this can surprise an opponent who expects these powerful interrupts only from combinations involving Luke. And no one can deny the power of an extra 2 destiny in a battle, especially in a high destiny deck, as a Teamwork deck tends to be.\par \par The extra text is quite useful. In fact, I'd venture to say that it is the most powerful yet. It allows you, if Leia is in a battle, to forfeit Chewie from your hand to satisfy all battle damage and attrition. This is quite nasty in conjunction with a few other cards. Obviously, you can use this to keep a squad of characters on the Death Star while your opponent is forced to lose some of his built up defense, but there are more subtle strategies.\par \par One is an odd twist on the familiar Ghhhk strategy. One would play a lone TIE Fighter at a system and drain. When the opponent deployed there, he would play a Lone Pilot and then Ghhhk to avoid the damage. You can do something similar with this, and, in fact, the effect is much more devastating. With Princess Leia on the table, if you play Warrior's Courage, you get 3 battle destiny when she's alone. Then, simply play Protector, and lose Chewie, and she stays on the table. Doubly effective if she's been trained, or if she's carrying a Lightsaber.\par \par The added cancelling ability can be useful as well, cancelling two very annoying interrupts. Frustration can be a pain in a deck designed for it, and cancelling I'd Just As Soon Kiss A Wookiee can be an added reassurance that your cards are going to get into play.
Combo: Leia + Han + Chewie + Obi-Wan + Luke + Skywalkers + Don't Get Cocky + Protector + Gift Of The Mentor + Rug Hug
Cancels: Frustration\par I'd Just As Soon Kiss A Wookiee

Lore: Proton-scattering energy warheads. Especially effective against ray- and energy-shielded targets. Ineffective against particle deflector.
Gametext: Deploy on a bomber. When you Force drain at same system, may target a related interior site. Draw destiny. Site 'collapsed' if destiny > 4. May fire in Bombing Run battle. Draw destiny. All characters, starships and vehicles with that destiny number at same site are lost.
IsPulled: I Can't Shake Him!\par Scimitar 2
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-13)\par Proton Bombs deploy on your bomber. They can be used repeatedly in one of two different "bombing modes" depending on the kind of site being targeted: \par - Interior sites - You may perform "orbital bombardment" in an attempt to 'collapse' a related interior site (as long as it is not protected by shields). This form of bombardment can only be performed from the system (or a cloud sector), and the bomber does not move from that location. The related site may be collapsed as a response to the initiation of the Force drain, but the Light player has first chance to respond. Therefore the Light player may cancel the drain (such as with Control) before the Dark Side gets a chance to collapse a site.\par - Non-interior sites - You may perform "carpet bombing" during a Bombing Run in an attempt to destroy characters, vehicles and starships at a related non-interior site. See Bombing Runs, Ap. C.

Lore: Powerful ballistic projectiles. Carries proton-scattering energy warheads. Short range. Pierces energy shields, but blocked by particle shields.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your X-wing, Y-wing or B-wing. May target a starship using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny > defense value.
Information: Proton Torpedoes deploy and fire free aboard Red 7, Red 10 and Red Squadron X-wing.\par
IsPulled: Lieutenant s'Too Vees (when at a docking bay)\par Portable Scanner\par Rapid Fire\par Take This!
Combo: Proton Torpedoes + Take This!

Lore: Mainstay weapon of Naboo Defense Fighters, Anakin Skywalker used them to surprising effect, as soon as he found the trigger.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your N-1 starfighter. May target a starship using 1 force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny > defense value. While on Bravo Fighter and you are attempting to 'blow away' Blockade Flagship, adds 2 to your total.
Information: Sure, you can shoot starships with them, but your best bet here is if you need help getting the destiny required to blow away the Blocakde Flagship. Get these into hand with Take This, then get them on your Bravo Fighter, get to the docking bay, survive the Dark side turn, and set up a destiny 5!\par -----\par N-1 starfighters are:\par \par Bravo 1\par Bravo 2\par Bravo 3\par Bravo 4\par Bravo 5\par Bravo Fighter\par Naboo Defense Fighter
IsPulled: Lieutenant s'Too Vees (when at a docking bay)\par Portable Scanner\par Rapid Fire\par Take This!
Combo: Proton Torpedoes (EP1) + Take This!

Lore: Former gas miner. One of the Rebellion's contacts on Cloud City before it was taken over by the Empire. Wishes to return to Bespin and retake the floating city.
Gametext: While on Cloud City, adds 1 to your Force drains at Cloud City sites and adds 4 to destiny of each of your miners drawn for battle destiny. During your deploy phase, may deploy one non-unique Rebel to same Cloud City site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
Information: Here is the guy that is basically Echo Base Operations in one character card. He bumps up all of your Force drains on Cloud City while he is there. Also, if you combine the site function with a Clouds deck based around Cloud City, the increased destiny of your miners in battles can be a really big surprise for your opponent.\par \par He can also provide the support you need by getting non-unique Rebels from your Reserve Deck. This allows you to clear all of those low destiny troopers out of your Reserve Deck, and get them on the table. You can quickly amass a pretty formidable fighting force to defend Cloud City. Include couple of Rebel Pilots to help you get a destiny draw, or Rebel Guards for a power boost on defense.
Pulls: One non-unique Rebel to same Cloud City site.\par Corellia Operative\par Dresselian Commando\par Endor Scout Trooper\par Gray Squadron Y-wing Pilot\par Green Squadron Pilot\par Incom Engineer\par Rebel Commander\par Rebel Guard\par Rebel Pilot\par Rebel Scout\par Rebel Squad Leader\par Rebel Tech\par Rebel Trooper\par Rebel Trooper (V)\par Rebel Trooper Recruit\par Rogue Gunner\par Tauntaun Handler\par Tibrin Operative\par Veteran Rogue (V)
IsPulled: Lando Calrissian (V)

Lore: Owned by legendary Terrik family of smugglers. Used to chase down the pirates who killed Wedge's parents. On Corellian Security's most wanted list. 37.5 meters long.
Gametext: May add 2 pilots and 6 passengers. May add ability of your (*) unique smuggler aboard to X on Kessel Run targeting that smuggler. When Booster, Mirax, or Wedge piloting, immune to attrition < 5.
IsPulled: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin\par Beldon's Eye (V)\par Local Defense
Combo: Pulsar Skate + Mirax Terrik + Moving To Attack Position
Matching: Booster Terrik (V)\par Commander Wedge Antilles\par Commander Wedge Antilles (V)\par Mirax Terrik\par Rayc Ryjerd (V)\par Wedge Antilles\par Wedge Antilles (V)\par Wedge Antilles, Red Squadron Leader

Lore: Ever since Lando's 'little' maneuver at the Battle of Taanab, his piloting skills had become legendary.
Gametext: If Han or your Lando is piloting a starfighter which is defending a battle at a system, add one battle destiny (add two if starfighter is \ul Falcon\ul0). Also, starfighter is immune to attrition for remainder of turn.
Information: People often want to re-enact Star Wars' fantastic epic space battles in the card game. The Light Side often struggles against the overwhelming power of the Imperial Armada's Star Destroyers. Cunning, daring maneuvers, and a little bit of luck saved the Rebellion in the movies. In the game, it takes all those things and intelligent management of interrupts.\par \par Punch It! is a vicious interrupt that you should use if the Dark Side isn't wary, particularly when you spring it on him as he is trying to clear away ships. Play Captain Han and Lando on the Falcon with some Corvettes, and wait for your opponent to become smug with Vader on the Executor. The two extra destiny from this, plus the extra destiny from Captain Han and a destiny for ability of 4, adds 4 destiny draws to an already formidable Force.\par \par The card has an extra ability that's dangerous, too. With Captain Han on the Falcon, you can get him to the Death Star and sit and drain. If your opponent tries to battle you, you can play this card for the extra 2 destiny and for immunity to attrition. The destiny draws will boost your power somewhat, reducing your battle damage (which you could play It Could Be Worse to reduce even more). The Falcon, since it is immune to attrition, remains at the Death Star for the next turn.
Combo: Captain Han Solo + Luke + Falcon + Punch It! + Out of Nowhere + Don't Get Cocky

Lore: Old Corellian Engineering Corporation starfighter. Has outdated Class Three hyperdrive, but high sublight speed capability. Easy to maintain. Owned by Dengar.
Gametext: May add 1 pilot (must be a smuggler or bounty hunter) and 1 passenger. Immune to attrition < 3 if Dengar piloting. Deploy -3 when deploying with Dengar. Boosted TIE Cannon may deploy aboard.
Information: Punishing One personas are:\par \par Dengar In Punishing One\par Punishing One\par Punishing One (V)\par
IsPulled: Short Range Fighters & Watch Your Back!
Matching: Dengar\par Dengar With Blaster Carbine\par Dengar With Blaster Carbine (V)

Lore: "We have an emergency alert in section AA-twenty-three."
Gametext: USED: Target one Rebel at a Death Star (or \ul Executor\ul0) site. For remainder of turn, target may not use its game text and may not apply ability toward drawing battle destiny. (Immune to Sense.) LOST: Retrieve into hand up to two cards with "Death Star" in title.

Lore: Lord Vader interceded between the trigger happy mercenary and his target.
Gametext: If one of your characters was just targeted by a weapon during battle, use 3 Force to cancel that targeting. OR Cancel Double Back or Res Luk Ra'auf.
Information: See Blaster Deflection for similar text.
Cancels: Targeting of a character by a weapon\par Double Back\par Res Luk Ra'auf

Lore: Starship blaster, often slung in turret mounts to take advantage of light weight and quick targeting motions. Installed on many starships including the \ul Millennium Falcon\ul0.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your Corellian Corvette or \ul Falcon\ul0. May target a starship using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Add 1 if targeting a starfighter. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
Information: May deploy on Medium Bulk Freighter and Nebulon-B Frigate.\par -----\par Corellian Corvettes are:\par \par Corellian Corvette\par Masanya\par Spiral\par Tantive IV\par Tantive IV (V)\par -----\par Quad Laser Cannon deploys and fire free aboard YT-1300 Transport.
IsPulled: Lieutenant s'Too Vees (when at a docking bay)\par Portable Scanner\par Rapid Fire

Lore: Nicknamed "squidheads." Quarren share their watery homeworld with the Mon Calamari. Betrayed their planet to the Empire. Dwell on the past. Rarely look to the future.
Gametext: If present at a non-shielded site, your Imperials may deploy there (regardless of location deployment restrictions). When at a planet site, Tactical Support, Imperial Reinforcements and Full Scale Alert are Used Interrupts.

Lore: \b Leader\b0. Amidala was only twelve when she was elected Princess of Theed. Now at age fourteen, she is Naboo's Queen, and the savior of her planet.
Gametext: Deploys -1 to Naboo. Amidala and your other Republic characters present are defense value +2, and immune to You Are Beaten, Sniper, and attrition < 3.
Information: Amidala personas are:\par \par Padme Naberrie\par Padme Naberrie (V)\par Queen Amidala\par Queen Amidala, Ruler Of Naboo
IsPulled: Sabe
Combo: Queen Amidala + Jerus Jannick\par -----\par Queen Amidala + Panaka, Protector Of The Queen\par While Panaka is with Amidala at a Naboo site, opponent may not target Amidala with weapons. Panaka deploys free to a Naboo site.\par -----\par Queen Amidala + Panaka, Protector Of The Queen + We Don't Have Time For This\par If Amidala and Panaka are in a battle together, add two battle destiny.
MatchingWeapon: Amidala's Blaster

Lore: Naboo \b leader\b0. Frustrated by the Trade Federation's control of her planet, Amidala came to the Senate to plead her case in person.
Gametext: \b Agendas\b0 : justice, peace. While in a senate majority, once during your control phase, may retrieve 1 Force for each Naboo site you control. May be placed on your Political Effect instead of a senator. Immune to attrition < 3.
Information: Amidala personas are:\par \par Padme Naberrie\par Padme Naberrie (V)\par Queen Amidala\par Queen Amidala, Ruler Of Naboo\par -----\par Queen Amidala is back in town, and the Senate will never be the same!\par \par Just like her Padme Naberrie persona, Amidala has very well-rounded stats, even for a Light Side character. A high destiny draw, excellent forfeit, decent power, a dash of Politics, and that all-important 4 ability put her over many Light Side characters in almost every desirable category. She's even immune to attrition < 3.\par \par However, unlike Padme, who is a key to Jedi battle strategies, the Queen works best in the Senate, pleading for the rights of her downtrodden people. She may not be a Senator, but she still contributes to a senate majority with her 2 Politics. She can even be placed on Political Effects like a Senator. And, like all good little Senators, Amidala gives you an excellent benefit for achieving a senate majority: you can retrieve 1 Force for each Naboo site you control.\par \par "What?!" you ask. "Naboo? But... but... this is the Coruscant set!"\par \par So it is, but you'll find quite a few Naboo sites lurking behind the scenes in Coruscant. Not only are there a few great drain sites in the bunch, but you can supplement them with generic sites from Special Edition to create a completely site-based "Celebration" deck that uses the immensely more secure Senate over a beatdown-prone system to achieve its retrieval. Smells like a deck type to me.\par \par Just watch out for Darth Maul...
IsPulled: Sabe
Combo: Queen Amidala, Ruler Of Naboo + I Will Not Defer\par -----\par Queen Amidala, Ruler Of Naboo + Supreme Chancellor Valorum\par -----\par Queen Amidala, Ruler Of Naboo + Jerus Jannick
MatchingWeapon: Amidala's Blaster
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-13)\par The game text that allows Queen Amidala to be treated as a senator applies only when placing her onto a Political Effect. That text does not give her the senator characteristic, and so when checking to see if Political Effect is occupied by a senator, Queen Amidala does not count as a senator.

Lore: Chromium-plated, sleek transport ship used by the royalty of the Naboo. Spaceframe was designed around a J-type configuration.
Gametext: May add 2 pilots and 5 passengers. Weapons may not deploy on this starship. While Ric piloting, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise, and immune to Lateral Damage and attrition < 4.
IsPulled: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
Matching: Ric Olie\par Ric Olie, Bravo Leader

Lore: It's high moon on Dagobah, his droid's reined in and Luke's got a fistful of credits.
Gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Once during each of your draw phases, you may use 2 Force to take any one blaster from your Lost pile and deploy it (for free).
Pulls: Any one blaster from Lost Pile.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once

Lore: Boba Fett's helmet has infrared capabilities, a motion tracking system, a macrobinocular viewer, an internal comlink and a broadband antenna. He doesn't miss a thing.
Gametext: Deploy on your side of table. During your draw phase, you may use 2 Force to search your Lost Pile. Take one Hidden Weapons into hand or take any one blaster and immediately deploy it (for free).
Pulls: Hidden Weapons from Lost Pile.\par Any one blaster from Lost Pile.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Opponent loses no more than 1 Force from each of your Force drains at Bespin locations. \par \b Flip\b0  this card if opponent controls no Bespin locations and you control Bespin: Cloud City and at least two Cloud City sites (one if Lando or Lobot on Cloud City). \par \b Place\b0  out of play if Bespin is "blown away."

At each Bespin location you control with an alien, your Force drains may not be modified or canceled by opponent. Your [Independent] starships are deploy -1. Once during each of your deploy phases, you may deploy one docking bay from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. \par \b Flip\b0  this card if opponent controls Bespin system (or three Cloud City sites and/or Bespin cloud sectors). \par \b Place\b0  out of play if Bespin is "blown away."

Opponent loses no more than 1 Force from each of your Force drains at Bespin locations. \par \b Flip\b0  this card if opponent controls no Bespin locations and you control Bespin: Cloud City and at least two Cloud City sites (one if Lando or Lobot on Cloud City). \par \b Place\b0  out of play if Bespin is "blown away."\\par[Back Side]: \b While\b0  this side up, your aliens, cloud cars and [Independent] starships are immune to attrition < 4. At each Bespin location you control with an alien, your Force drains may not be modified or canceled by opponent. Your [Independent] starships are deploy -1. Once during each of your deploy phases, you may deploy one docking bay from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. \par \b Flip\b0  this card if opponent controls Bespin system (or three Cloud City sites and/or Bespin cloud sectors). \par \b Place\b0  out of play if Bespin is "blown away."

Combo: Admiral Ackbar\par Beldon's Eye (V)\par Boss Nass\par Captain Tarpals\par Corporal Kensaric\par Goo Nee Tay\par Grugnak\par Harc Seff (V)\par Keeping The Empire Out Forever\par Lando Calrissian, Scoundrel\par Leia (V)\par Spaceport Docking Bay (not on CC)\par Wedge\par You Have A Lot Of Guts Coming Here

Lore: On her assignment to kill Sharad Hett, Aurra used her patience and cunning to help track down the Jedi Master.
Gametext: Deploy on Aurra Sing. While Aurra is alone at a site, your total ability here = 0. During your move phase, may lose Effect to target an opponent's lightsaber present. Draw destiny. If destiny > 3, Aurra may 'steal' that lightsaber.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Combo: Quietly Observing + Aurra Sing

Lore: Accepted Obi-Wan Kenobi as his Padawan learner. Was given orders to protect Queen Amidala at all costs.
Gametext: Deploys -2 to Tatooine. Power +1 at same site as Maul. Once during a duel Qui-Gon is in, may cancel a duel destiny just drawn and cause a re-draw. Opponent's aliens are power -1 at same site. Immune to attrition.
Information: Qui-Gon Jinn personas are:\par \par Master Qui-Gon\par Master Qui-Gon (V)\par Qui-Gon Jinn\par Qui-Gon Jinn With Lightsaber\par Qui-Gon Jinn, Jedi Master\par -----\par (Light side Icon)\par \par Qui-gon Jinn has the distinction of being the only Light Side character to participate in armed combat during the Tatooine-based scenes of The Phantom Menace. This combat was in the form of a brief duel with Darth Maul. It should come as no surprise that Qui-gon's gametext reflects this conflict with Maul. When at a site with Maul, Qui-gon gets a power bonus that brings him to the same level as his nemesis, allowing them to start a battle on even ground. In addition, if Maul is bold enough to start a duel against Qui-gon, the Jedi Master has the ability to cancel a destiny draw and cause a redraw. While this text doesn't give Qui-gon an advantage in the number of duel destinies drawn, it does give him the opportunity to potentially reduce a high Dark Side destiny or increase an unfortunate destiny draw of his own.\par \par Finally, Qui-gon Jinn is able to reduce the effectiveness of opponent's aliens at the same site by reducing their power by 1. This trick can be very useful when presented with a swarm of aliens, bringing their high power down to a more manageable level.
IsPulled: Padme Naberrie\par Tatooine: City Outskirts
Combo: Qui-Gon Jinn + A Jedi's Patience
MatchingWeapon: Qui-Gon Jinn's Lightsaber\par Qui-Gon's Lightsaber
Cancels: A duel destiny to cause a redraw.

Lore: Jedi Master assigned to reveal the mysteries of the Sith. His quest has led him to the planet Naboo.
Gametext: Adds one battle destiny if with Maul. Permanent weapon is (*]Qui-Gon Jinn's Lightsaber (may target a character or creature for free; draw two destiny; target 'hit', and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value).
Information: Qui-Gon Jinn personas are:\par \par Master Qui-Gon\par Master Qui-Gon (V)\par Qui-Gon Jinn\par Qui-Gon Jinn With Lightsaber\par Qui-Gon Jinn, Jedi Master\par -----\par Qui-Gon Jinn's lightsaber 'personas' are:\par \par Qui-Gon Jinn's Lightsaber\par Qui-Gon's Lightsaber\par Qui-Gon Jinn With Lighsaber
IsPulled: Padme Naberrie\par Tatooine: City Outskirts
Combo: Qui-Gon Jinn With Lightsaber + Are You Brain Dead?!\par -----\par Qui-Gon Jinn With Lightsaber + A Jedi's Resilience

Lore: Jedi Master ordered by the Jedi Council to return to Naboo to seek out the mysterious "dark warrior" that he had encountered on Tatooine.
Gametext: Deploys -2 to Naboo. Qui-Gon's game text may not be canceled. When Qui-Gon wins a lightsaber combat, adds 2 to opponent's Force loss. Once per game, may lose 2 Force to deploy a lightsaber on Qui-Gon from Lost Pile. Immune to attrition.
Information: Qui-Gon Jinn personas are:\par \par Master Qui-Gon\par Master Qui-Gon (V)\par Qui-Gon Jinn\par Qui-Gon Jinn With Lightsaber\par Qui-Gon Jinn, Jedi Master
Pulls: A lightsaber from Lost Pile to deploy on him.\par Jedi Lightsaber\par Qui-Gon Jinn's Lightsaber\par Qui-Gon's Lightsaber
IsPulled: Padme Naberrie\par Tatooine: City Outskirts
MatchingWeapon: Qui-Gon Jinn's Lightsaber\par Qui-Gon's Lightsaber

Lore: Qui-Gon was forced to defend himself when Darth Maul tracked them down on Tatooine. He was barely able to escape, in order to fight another day.
Gametext: Deploy on Qui-Gon. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
Information: Qui-Gon Jinn's lightsaber 'personas' are:\par \par Qui-Gon Jinn's Lightsaber\par Qui-Gon's Lightsaber\par Qui-Gon Jinn With Lighsaber\par -----\par 'Qui-Gon's Lightsaber' has (better) destiny of 5 but does not add to drain.\par \par Continuing in the great tradition of the most powerful weapons in the game, the Light side now has another powerful unique lightsaber to add to their arsenal.\par \par In addition to the always strong "ordinary" uses, like adding to a Force drain or cleaving targets like a ginsu knife, this elegant tool has a few additional benefits. Many of the new "Jedi helpers" (A Jedi's Concentration, A Jedi's Focus, and A Jedi's Patience) require your Knight or Master to be armed with a lightsaber, and thus Qui-Gon will be at his most efficient when he has his. You'll also find that Qui-Gon armed with his weapon is a tank, and when he holds it he joins Jedi Luke as one of the few Light side characters able to safely hold down a site all by himself.
IsPulled: Gift Of The Mentor\par Qui-Gon Jinn, Jedi Master when lightsaber is in Lost Pile
MatchingWeapon: Master Qui-Gon\par Master Qui-Gon (V)\par Qui-Gon Jinn\par Qui-Gon Jinn, Jedi Master

Lore: While Qui-Gon spent years maintaining peace, Maul was sharpening his combat skills. Those years of training came to fruition in one fateful moment.
Gametext: Deploy on a site where Maul just defeated Qui-Gon in lightsaber combat. Place Qui-Gon out of play. While Obi-Wan at this site, his lightsaber combat total is +2 and opponent loses 1 Force at the end of each of your turns. (Immune to Control.)
IsPulled: Corporal Vandolay (V)\par Fanfare\par Fanfare - Defensive Shield\par Fanfare (V) - Defensive Shield\par I'll Take Them Myself (V)\par Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: This lightsaber bore silent witness to the death of two great warriors in the same day. One a Jedi, one a Sith.
Gametext: Deploy on Qui-Gon or [Episode 1] Obi-Wan. Adds 1 to this character's lightsaber combat total. May target a character for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value (if hit target is a Dark Jedi, opponent also loses 1 Force).

Lore: Smugglers and other rogues frequent spaceports along trade routes. "Your friend is quite a mercenary. I wonder if he really cares about anything, or anybody."
Gametext: If Elis Helrot just completed a transport, use 2 Force. Elis and all characters transported are lost. (Immune to Sense.) OR Prevent a just-deployed smuggler from moving this turn.
Cancels: Makes all characters transported by Elis Helrot lost.

CardName: R'kik D'nec, Hero Of The Dune Sea
Lore: A tribe of Tusken Raiders, a herd of angry banthas, a raging Krayt Dragon and R'kik. Minutes later, the Jawa emerged from the Dune Sea, a bantha tusk over his shoulder.
Gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Jawa weapons deploy free on R'kik; when firing one, may add up to 3 to total weapon destiny just drawn. When he is playing Dune Sea Sabacc and wins, he wins double.
IsPulled: Aved Luun to deploy to same location.

Lore: Typical of the old model astromechs still used on capital starships and large freighters. Has armored Mark II reactor drone shell. R1-G4 was abandoned after owner was captured.
Gametext: When aboard a capital starship, adds 1 to power and hyperspeed, and that starship is immune to attrition < 3. Too large to go aboard a starfighter.

Lore: Popular R2 astromech accessory manufactured by Industrial Automation. Can monitor radiation levels and detect nearby lifeforms.
Gametext: Deploy on your R-unit droid. Your characters present may move as a 'react' from a creature attack. Also, adds 3 to search party destiny draws at same and adjacent sites.
IsPulled: Corporal Beezer\par Hero Of A Thousand Devices\par Portable Scanner

Lore: Combat communications astromech. Coordinates starfighter attack vectors. Broadcasts target acquisition data to gunnery systems.
Gametext: When in battle aboard your capital starship at a system or sector, adds 1 to total attrition against opponent for each of your piloted TIEs present in that battle.

Lore: Fiesty. Loyal. Heroic. Insecure. Rebel \b spy\b0. Excels at trouble. Incorrigible counterpart of a mindless philosopher. Has picked up a slight flutter. A bit eccentric.
Gametext: While aboard any starfighter, adds 2 to power, maneuver and hyperspeed (3 on Red 5). If at a Scomp link when opponent draws destiny of: 1-3, you may activate one Force; 4-6, you may draw top card from Reserve Deck.
