Rules: (AR 1.7.1, D-2)\par Characters, vehicles, and starships can be heroic (whether by their own game text or have it provided). Whenever a heroic card is targeted by a weapon, add 1 to the total weapon destiny. Also, in a battle where there's a heroic card, non-heroic cards cannot be targeted by weapons unless all heroic cards are hit, not participating in battle, or cannot be targeted by that weapon. \par For example, if light has a heroic character (Chewie) in a battle, then any dark side weapons that can target him can only be fired at him, but if they don't (such as targeting only a vehicle, or a non-Rebel character, or a Jedi, etc.) they wouldn't have to, if he was excluded from battle they wouldn't have to, if he left the table they wouldn't have to, if he was inside an enclosed vehicle (where he can't be targeted) they wouldn't have to, or if he was finally hit they wouldn't have to. Light would be able to target whomever they wanted because you can't target your own cards with weapons.
IsCanceledBy: Game text canceled by Commander Praji.\par

Lore: R2 units are known for expertise in computer uplinking. R2-Q2 spent several decades serving with an Imperial reconnaissance fleet in the Expansion Region.
Gametext: While aboard any starfighter, adds 1 to power, maneuver and hyperspeed. When at a Scomp link during your draw phase, may use 1 Force to peek at top three cards of your Reserve Deck.
Information: Helps learning to track your high destinies.

Lore: Typical starfighter pilot assistant. Contains ten coordinates for hyperspace jumps. Built-in tools and computer interfaces. R2-X2 was assigned to Red 10 at Yavin Base.
Gametext: While aboard any starfighter, adds 1 to power, maneuver and hyperspeed.

Lore: Special-purpose astromech capable of coordinating piloting coordinates and approach angles during combat.
Gametext: When in battle aboard your capital starship at a system or sector, adds 1 to total attrition against opponent for each of your piloted starfighters present in that battle.

Lore: Designed as a response to the threat of Imperial espionage droids. Joins a droid pool and uncovers spies. Has tattoo reading "Thank The Maker" on left posterior plating.
Gametext: Once during each of your control phases, for each opponent's spy present, opponent must lose 1 Force (2 if spy is a droid or is Undercover, 4 if both).
IsPulled: Were You Looking For Me?

Lore: Expanded memory capacity. Escaped from pirates based in Mos Eisley. Programmed with the ability to both enhance and sabotage hyperdrive systems.
Gametext: While aboard your capital starship, adds 1 to power and 2 to hyperspeed, and that starship is immune to attrition < 4. While at Central Core, Death Star requires +2 Force to move.

Lore: R3 units have larger memory and more advanced circuitry than their R1 predecessors, allowing for more efficient astrogation plots. R3-T6 served on the Death Star.
Gametext: While aboard a capital starship, adds 1 to power and 2 to hyperspeed, and that starship is immune to attrition < 4. While at Death Star: Central Core, hyperspeed of Death Star system = 2.
Information: The only problem with R3-T6 is that it is unique. However his big brother R1-G4 is not, and works very much the same.
Combo: R3-T6 (Arthree-Teesix) + Deflector Shield Generators ona Star Destroyer\par -----\par R3-T6 (Arthree-Teesix) + R1-G4\par -----\par R3-T6 (Arthree-Teesix) + Death Star + Death Star: Central Corridor\par The Death Star moves at a Hyperspeed of 2.

Lore: One of numerous vehicle computer operation droids, manufactured by Industrial Automation. This unit, R4-E1, is a companion of BoShek. Rambunctious. Fiercely independent.
Gametext: While aboard a non-creature vehicle, adds 1 to power, maneuver and landspeed. May drive transport vehicles.

Lore: Typical multiple-use droid. Controls and repairs vehicles and computers. R4-M9 was once used by the Empire to pull data from Tantive IV's computer banks.
Gametext: While aboard a non-creature vehicle, adds 1 to power, maneuver and landspeed. May drive transport vehicles.

Lore: Seldom used for navigation purposes, R5 units are known for their ability to perform hull maintenance and repair damage caused by ionization.
Gametext: While aboard any starship, adds 1 to power and maneuver. During your control phase, if aboard your starship damaged by an ion cannon, restores armor/maneuver and hyperspeed.

Lore: Cheap astromech droid commonly referred to as 'Red.' Purposely blew his motivator to prevent splitting up R2-D2 and C-3PO on Tatooine. Poor navigator but skilled mechanic.
Gametext: While aboard any starship, adds 1 to power and maneuver. During your control phase, if aboard your starship damaged by an ion cannon, restores armor/maneuver and hyperspeed.

Lore: Programmed to pilot sublight tactical courses. R5 units are in high demand for combat starships. R5-M2 helped plan evacuation routes from Echo Base. Owned by Shawn Valdez.
Gametext: When aboard a capital starship, adds 1 to power and hyperspeed and that starship is immune to attrition < 3.

Lore: The RA line of servant droids has fifth-degree primary programming. Low intelligence with capabilities for menial labor only. Common among nobles and high-ranking officials.
Gametext: May transfer character weapons (for free) to or from your other characters present. May carry up to four such weapons at one time.

Lore: Ewok. Tamer of beasts. \b Thief\b0. Loner. Hunter. Survivor.
Gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each (Light Side Force icon) icon at same Endor site. Where present, may substitute for a character just selected to be attacked by a creature. When attacking or being attacked, power +2 and may add one destiny.
IsPulled: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control).

Lore: Strange female Snivvian who frequents the cantina daily. Betrayed her loved ones, who then left her on Tatooine to die. Everything she's ever cared about is now gone or dead.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots. During a battle involving Rachalt, whenever opponent draws an Interrupt for destiny may use 2 Force to cause that Interrupt to be lost. While armed with a weapon at a site, Force drain +1 here.
Information: Although the 8th Snivvian in Star Wars CCG  Rachalt is the first pilot of her species to make it onto a card.\par \par Her lore tells a story almost as harsh as her features, but her game text provides an ability you may find useful! Sandwiched between a little drain-adding text and a pretty standard piloting bonus is a nice interrupt-removal text. Whenever your opponent draws an Interrupt card for any destiny during battle, use 2 Force and throw it out! The destiny draw still counts (it is not canceled!), but that pesky recycling 5 can be taken a little further away from a player who is a good destiny tracker.\par \par You may also think that devoting a weapon to Rachalt isn't really worth the effort for a Force drain +1 (even with Inconsequential Losses), but don't forget that if the opponent isn't running Menace Fades, Honor Of The Jedi, or Jedi Test #1, this is a handy way to turn a site with no Dark Side icons into a pesky "pinger." Of course, Rachalt ain't too great at avoiding weapon fire herself -- so keep her safe aboard something enclosed, and lo and behold, her +1 to drains still works! Maybe this Dark Side uncommon will find a place in a few of your decks after all?

Lore: Barada and Klaatu strip down and rebuild old skiffs to race on the Dune Sea. Jabba allows the practice to continue for now.
Gametext: May deploy with a driver (must be Barada, Klaatu, or a non-unique alien) as a 'react'. May add 1 driver and 3 passengers. May move as a 'react'. If lost, any characters aboard may "jump off" (disembark).
Information: Skiffs are:\par \par Racing Skiff\par Skiff

Lore: Repulsorlift skiffs are used by traders and merchants to safely cross the deserts of Tatooine. Young thrill seekers sometimes upgrade them with high-powered engines.
Gametext: May deploy with a non-unique alien driver as a 'react'. May add 1 driver and 3 passengers. May move as a 'react'. If lost, any characters aboard may "jump off" (disembark).
Information: Skiffs are:\par \par Racing Skiff\par Skiff

Lore: Sensor on Luke's landspeeder. Many possible settings. Can scan for life forms, movement or concentrations of metal. Used for traffic control on settled worlds.
Gametext: If you have at least one vehicle or starship on table, use 1 Force to glance at the cards in the opponent's hand for 10 seconds. You may move each Jawa (except Dathcha) and Tusken Raider you find there to opponent's Used Pile.
Information: Scanner Techs makes Radar Scanner immune to Sense.
Combo: Radar Scanner + Sensor Panel

Lore: Optimized for diplomatic missions with sensor-proof pods that have ejection capabilities. Easily identified by its red coloration.
Gametext: May add 3 pilots and 3 passengers. Has ship-docking capability. While Madakor or Williams piloting, immune to Lateral Damage and attrition < 5.
Information: Radiant VII personas are:\par \par Obi-Wan In Radiant VII\par Radiant VII\par -----\par This little ship brought Obi-Wan and Qui-Gon to Naboo, but it can do much more than that.\par For one thing, you never need to worry about drawing this ship into your hand, since the Used Interrupt We Wish To Board At Once will let you take the Radiant VII into your hand from the Reserve Deck. Once in your hand, you can use Squadron Assignments to deploy it with one of its matching pilots (Captain Madakor or Lieutenant Williams) with ease. Once Williams and Madakor are piloting the Radiant VII, it is bumped up to 9 power and immunity to attrition less than 5. Add a third pilot like Ric Olie to increase the ship's power to 12. In addition, if you have no other ships at the system, your opponent will be unable to draw more than one battle destiny here, and unless they have ability > 6, that destiny will be reduced by 3, making it difficult for the Dark Side to get this pesky little ship out of its sky.
IsPulled: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin\par We Wish To Board At Once
Combo: Radiant VII + Captain Madakor + Lieutenant Williams + I'll Take The Leader\par -----\par Radiant VII + Captain Madakor + Lieutenant Williams + We Can Still Outmaneuver Them

Lore: Opportunists work with corrupt governments and Raithal casino operators. Keep the Empire informed of local Alliance activity, for a price.
Gametext: While at a Raithal site: adds 1 to your Force drains there, is power +1 (or +2 if your gambler or tax collector is on Raithal) and, once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one site to Raithal from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
Pulls: One site to Raithal
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, D-2)\par Operatives are identified by their title, X Operative, with X being a system. The operative is considered a 'matching operative' for system X (e.g., Kiffex Operative is a matching operative for Kiffex). \par Operatives are restricted by special rules as follows: \par - You may not voluntarily deploy or move your operative to (or through) a location on its matching planet where you already have an operative (even if inactive) of the same card title. \par - If, at any time, two of your Operatives (even if inactive) of the same card title are at the same location on their matching planet, you must choose one to be lost (you may choose an inactive operative to be lost). \par - Your operative character on its matching planet may not apply its ability toward drawing battle destiny. Your operative may not control a location on its matching planet for any reason unless you have other cards there capable of controlling the location (e.g., an ability-1 character or a battle droid). Your operatives still occupy that location (and may battle or be battled), but may not Force drain or flip an objective alone.

Lore: During the Battle of Ralltiir, many Alliance soldiers participated in the defense of the planet from the Empire. Many of Ralltiir's population feel indebted to the Rebellion.
Gametext: While at a Ralltiir site: adds 1 to your Force drains there, is forfeit +1 (and power +1 if your trooper is on Ralltiir) and, once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one site to Ralltiir from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

The operative is considered a 'matching operative' for system X (e.g., Kiffex Operative is a matching operative for Kiffex). \par Operatives are restricted by special rules as follows: \par - You may not voluntarily deploy or move your operative to (or through) a location on its matching planet where you already have an operative (even if inactive) of the same card title. \par - If, at any time, two of your Operatives (even if inactive) of the same card title are at the same location on their matching planet, you must choose one to be lost (you may choose an inactive operative to be lost). \par - Your operative character on its matching planet may not apply its ability toward drawing battle destiny. Lore: Indigenous to Dathomir, but found on several dozen worlds throughout the galaxy. Vicious predator. Sometimes kept as pets by eccentrics and crime lords.
Gametext: * Ferocity = 8 + destiny. Habitat: Rancor Pit and exterior planet sites. Deploys only to the Rancor Pit or to where Malakili is the only character. Moves towards another Rancor whenever possible.
IsPulled: Swamp

Lore: General Solo's strike team was made up of the Alliance's finest ground troops.
Gametext: At the beginning of your deploy phase, if you occupy an Endor or Rebel Base site, deploy up to 5 troopers there from Reserve Deck (those troopers deploy -1) and reshuffle. You may not deploy any other characters or starships this turn.
Pulls: Up to 5 Troopers at deploy cost -1.

Lore: Rebel engineers at Echo Base quickly armed T-47 snowspeeders with harpoon guns in preparation for the impending attack.
Gametext: If a battle was just initiated, deploy (for free) a vehicle weapon or starship weapon from hand (or Reserve Deck; reshuffle) on your participating vehicle or starship.
Pulls: A vehicle weapon.\par A starship weapon.\par A-wing Cannon\par Concussion Missiles\par Enhanced Proton Torpedoes\par Heavy Turbolaser Battery\par Intruder Missile\par Proton Torpedoes\par Proton Torpedoes (EP1)\par Quad Laser Cannon\par Surface Defense Cannon\par SW-4 Ion Cannon\par X-wing Laser Cannon\par Booma\par Dual Laser Cannon\par Power Harpoon

Lore: Shawda Ubb \b musician\b0  from Manpha. Plays growdi. Real name Rapotwanalantonee. When cornered in a fight, he can spit a paralyzing poison.
Gametext: Where present, adds X to Force opponent must use to initiate battle, where X = number of musicians present. May target one non-droid character present in battle. Draw destiny. If destiny > defense value, target is power = 0 this battle.
IsPulled: Ak-rev

Lore: An 'honest' \b smuggler\b0. Working for Jabba to pay off debts for his ship. Rycar's son. Even more of an idiot.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (or 4 if trained by Rycar Ryjerd). Any starfighter Rayc pilots is immune to Tallon Roll and is not lost if an asteroid sector is drawn for asteroid destiny.
Information: Rayc, as a character, won't make it into many general use decks. He's a little expensive for a power 2, ability 2 character. However, in a space deck, he is near invaluable. Tallon Roll is one of the more effective means for the Dark Side to get rid of pesky starfighters (like the Falcon.) Rayc makes his starfighter immune to this tricky maneuver, protecting you from a world of hurt. Also, against an Asteroids deck, he can be extremely useful, avoiding the nasty Asteroid sector draw. Put him on a high maneuver ship, like an X-Wing on the Falcon, and he'll almost never be hit by a rock. Send him in to the Asteroids on Rycar's Run, which he performs better than any character in the game.
IsPulled: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control).
Combo: Rayc Ryjerd + Rycar Ryjerd

Lore: Coruscant taxi driver who barely makes enough money to get by. Will try any trick in the book to get an extra credit from his customer.
Gametext: Your characters may move from here using their landspeed for free. During your control phase, may place Vaca in Used Pile to take Lana Dobreed into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
Pulls: Lana Dobreed

Lore: The Death Star has many terminals coupled to the main reactor for power distribution throughout the immense space station.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your side of table. During your control phase, you may return any cards from your hand to the top of your Used Pile.
Information: Allowing you to return cards from your hand to the top of your Used Pile (during your Control Phase) just before a victory, you are able to improve your winning differential. \par \par This card is also useful to return multiple copies of one card back to protect yourself from cards such as Grimtaash, or allow you to return high destiny value cards back into circulation in the hopes they will come up later on.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: Entrenched Rebel troops defend their ground with surprising fierceness.
Gametext: If a battle was just initiated at a site, each of your troopers present is power +1 (+2 if at a Rebel Base site) and immune to attrition for remainder of turn.
IsPulled: Sergeant Hollis

Lore: The Rebel Alliance utilizes every piece of equipment, ammunition and personnel it can muster.
Gametext: During your control phase, if you have a weapon (except a lightsaber, or (permanent weapon)) at a battleground you control, opponent loses 1 Force. OR If you just used a weapon (except a lightsaber or (permanent weapon)) to hit a character or starship, opponent loses 1 Force. (Immune to Sense.)

Lore: While being chased through the Death Star, Luke and Leia disabled the blast doors behind them in order to slow down pursuing stormtroopers.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to prevent any character or starship just deployed by the opponent from battling or moving for the remainder of this turn.

Lore: To avoid unnecessary Imperial entanglements, the Rebel fleet is continuously on the move.
Gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Once per turn, you may cancel a Force drain by placing here from hand any non-unique starfighter. Starfighters may deploy from here as if from hand (if Effect canceled by opponent, any starfighters here may immediately deploy for free).

Lore: Pilot fatigues feature digital technology which can be customized for particular starfighters. Increases interface efficiency with a newly assigned craft.
Gametext: Deploy on your pilot character. While piloting any starfighter, combat vehicle or shuttle vehicle, that character is considered to be the "matching pilot" (pilot adds 2 to maneuver (limit +2) and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise).
Information: Sonn on PC Forums Tue Aug 01, 2006 3:37 am\par This card doesn't add to maneuver, the pilot adds to maneuver. So if it's on Elyhek Rue he adds 2, and if it's on Commander Wedge Antilles he also adds 2 (even though that's what he normally does). This does combo nicely with Hobbie and Red 4, because Red 4 gives itself +2 if Hobbie's on board, so this will allow Hobbie to add another 2, giving you a total of 8 (heck of a nice Darklighter Spin).
IsPulled: Corporal Beezer\par Portable Scanner
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-13)\par (Errata) See Matching Pairs, Ch. 9.

Lore: Galen Torg was selected for honor guard duty during ceremony following the Battle of Yavin. He is typical of the hard-working, unsung heros in the Rebel Alliance.

Lore: Nerf herder. Personally oversees the herding of Jabba's nerfs. Scruffy-looking appearance conceals his expertise in unusual combat techniques.
Gametext: Creatures at same site (except Sarlacc) do not attack and cannot be attacked. Up to three times per turn, may use 1 Force to cumulatively add 1 to his power for remainder of turn.
Information: Since the Hoth expansion came out, people have been wondering about Rennek: would it be a strange new alien, a Jawa or Han Solo's long lost brother? The answer came out with Jabba's Palace, when we learned that Rennek was the king of the sruffy-looking nerf herders. With Power and Ability of only one, the little Rennek seems pretty ordinary, but when you look at his game text, you realize he has the power to change the course of a game. First, he prevents all creatures from attacking at his site (except the almighty Sarlacc, who don't listen to anything but it's stomach), thus protecting you from such nasties as Bubo, the Wampas and especially the roaming Rancors. By keeping Rennek with your small power characters, you can use their game texts longer. The second part of his game text is also interesting: you can raise Rennek's Power three times per turn for only one Force each time! In the mid-game, when you have plenty of Force, Rennek is an argument that your opponent will have to consider. With Who's Scruffy-Looking?, you can double Rennek's Power, thus showing that unusual combat techniques are sometimes the best.
Combo: Rennek + Who's Scruffy-Looking?

During battle, opponent's unique (*) characters, vehicles and starships lost from table are placed out of play; Leia adds one battle destiny; attrition against opponent is +2; and Imperials, Dark Jedi and Imperial starships lose all immunity to attrition. \par \b Flip\b0  this card if Leia is captured. \par \b Place\b0  out of play if Leia is lost from table.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-13)\par The commands "Place out of play" and "you may not deploy Death Star Plans for remainder of game" are both linked to a single condition: "if Leia is lost from table". Thus, even though the objective is not placed out of play if you are using Prisoner 2187 and Leia is lost from table, Death Star Plans may still no longer be played.\par On the destiny 7 side of this Objective, only the opponent's just lost unique (*) characters, vehicles and starships are placed out of play.

Lore: Injuries kept Lord Vader's best TIE wingman out of the primary wave of starfighters. He remains on reserve duty, ready to replace lost pilots.
Gametext: Adds 1 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Black 2, Black 3 or Black 4, also adds 1 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

Lore: Oola had to choose between giving in to Jabba's constant advances or resisting him and inciting his wrath.
Gametext: Deploy on your side of table. While you occupy at least 3 battlegrounds or opponent occupies no battlegrounds, you lose no more than 2 Force from each Force drain or 'insert' card. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Prepared Defenses.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-13)\par See Ultimatum.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-16)\par Ultimatum\par The text of this card comes into effect as an automatic action when you lose your second Force (and meet all other requirements of the card). For example, if you are being drained for 5 Force and you satisfy the battleground requirements of Ultimatum as well as having It Could Be Worse in hand and 2 Force saved. If you choose to play It Could Be Worse to reduce the Force loss by 2, you have not lost any Force to the drain, and must still lose 2 Force before Ultimatum will take effect (and you then will not have to lose any more Force).

Each Laser Gate on the Death Star may be relocated between any two interior Death Star sites.

Lore: Corellian pilot. Defected from the Empire shortly after graduation from the Academy. Tech communications officer at Echo Base. Relays orders to nearby Rebel starships.
Gametext: Adds 1 to power and maneuver of anything he pilots. Opponent may not 'react' to or from same location.

Gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each (Light Side Force icon) at same Endor site. When on Endor, adds 1 to your Force generation at each Endor site with an Ewok present.
Information: Force generation is always key in Star Wars, and with Romba in an Ewok deck you'll get that much more Force every turn in order to help your Ewok deck out run your opponent. He's a scout, and an Ewok, so he works with the likes of Kazak and others.
IsPulled: General Crix Madine\par Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control).

Lore: Beast of burden often used by Jawas. Excellent sense of smell. Poor vision. Slow moving. Tough hide. Easily startled by fast-moving speeders.
Gametext: May add 2 'riders' (passengers). Ability = 1/4. When 'ridden' by a Jawa, moves for free and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

Lore: Creatures used as beasts of burden by Jawas. Tremendous strength makes them excellent pack animals. Very skittish around repulsorlift vehicles.
Gametext: May add 2 'riders' (passengers). Ability = 1/4. When 'ridden' by a Jawa, moves for free and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

Lore: When away from the Imperial Palace on Coruscant, the Emperor is protected by legions of troops. Typically this force includes soldiers trained to fight in the local environment.

Combo: Accelerate may be used in conjunction with this card.

Information: Royal Guards are:\par Kir Kanos\par Kir Kanos (V)\par Myn Kyneugh\par Myn Kyneugh (V)\par Royal Guard
IsPulled: Blizzard 4\par Kir Kanos (V)

Lore: The Royal Naboo Security Forces are used to protect Naboo's planetary rulers at all times. Commanded by Panaka, these volunteers have dedicated their lives to their homeland.
Gametext: Power -1 while not on Naboo. While you have at least three other non-unique Royal Naboo Security Officers at related Naboo sites, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.

Lore: Tusken Raider who tends to the banthas used by URoRRuR'R'R's tribe. Expert in wielding a gaffi stick. Attacked Luke Skywalker in the Jundland Wastes.
Gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Power +3 while armed with a Gaderffii Stick. Where present, each of your banthas is power and forfeit +2 unless a Weequay is at a related site. When 'riding' a bantha, adds one battle destiny.
IsPulled: Bantha Fodder

Lore: Wookiees are known to be creatures of great emotion and are very protective of family and friends. Chewbacca has come to treat Luke as a member of his own family.
Gametext: If Luke and Chewie are in a battle together, you may add two battle destiny. OR If you have a Rebel and an alien in a battle together, you may add 4 to power only.

Lore: After seeing Vader strike down Obi-Wan, Luke attacked recklessly until he heard the old Jedi Master's voice warn, "Run Luke, Run!"
Gametext: At any time, move Luke as a regular move (using landspeed for free) to a battle just initiated at an adjacent site. Luke is power +2 during that battle, unless Vader is present or adjacent to the battle site. OR You may cancel Vader's Obsession.
Information: Just look at that face! Want to have luke in three places at once? That is just what this card allows Luke to do. With all the versions of Luke currently available, this card is a favorite in my tournament decks. With a destiny of 6, this card becomes even better.\par \par Just think about this situation. Son Of Skywalker, carrying his trusty lightsaber, is standing at Cloud City: Incinerator with R2-D2 busy looking for C-3PO. He hears a clatter back at Cloud City: Guest Quarters where he left Princess Leia last turn. He hears a voice in the back of his mind saying "Run Luke, Run!" and dashes back to the Cloud City: Guest Quarters to find Boba Fett attacking the princess. This angers him and he becomes Power +2. Family pride, Skywalkers, increases the battle destiny to three draws. Boba better hightail it out of there or he's going to be toast.\par \par If this wasn't enough, you can also use this card to avoid Epic Duels.
Combo: Run Luke, Run! + Son Of Skywalker
Cancels: Vader's Obsession

Lore: Trade Federation settlement officer serving as legal council to Viceroy Gunray. Reputed to have one of the sharpest legal minds in all of the Republic. Neimoidian.
Gametext: While in battle, may choose one number. If next card opponent draws for destiny this battle has a printed destiny number matching this choice, that destiny is reduced to zero. If you just initiated a battle at same or adjacent site, retrieve 1 Force.
Information: Rune Haako personas are:\par \par Rune Haako\par Rune Haako, Legal Counsel\par -----\par While he may not seem as strong as Lott Dod, Nute Gunray, or that stunted slime Daultay Dofine, Rune Haako definitely has his uses.\par \par One of the first things you'll notice is that Rune has one of the highest forfeit values of any Dark Side character - a whopping 6 - making him ideal forfeit fodder. He also has 3 ability, 2 power, 2 destiny and remarkable game text that makes battle a snap.\par \par While Rune is in battle, you may choose one number. If the destiny on the next card your opponent draws for destiny matches the number you called, it's reduced to zero. It doesn't matter if your opponent was drawing for battle destiny, weapon destiny, Fallen Portal destiny: as long as the number on the drawn card matches Rune's ever-tingling "destiny sense," it's effectively canceled.\par \par Of course, it can be hard to call the right number at the right time. Fortunately for you, Rune has some other applications. For one thing, he's a miniature Scum And Villainy, enabling you to retrieve Force when you initiate battle at his site or an adjacent site. For another, Lott Dod can increase his forfeit value to an amazing 8. And then there's The Phantom Menace to contend with.
IsPulled: Lord Sidious\par The Phantom Menace
Combo: Rune Haako + Darth Vader + Grand Moff Tarkin\par -----\par Rune Haako + Sim Aloo\par -----\par Rune Haako + Macroscan + Sunsdown\par -----\par Rune Haako + Yeb Yeb Adem'thorn\par Destiny of zero for your opponent. (Lord Helmet)

Lore: The Trade Federation's only Neimoidian \b leader\b0  to have ever encountered a Jedi Knight. Assumed Daultay Dofine's responsibilities after Dofine questioned their Sith Lord's plans.
Gametext: While at Theed Palace Throne Room, your attrition against opponent in battles at same and related Naboo sites is +X, where X = number of battle droids present at that site. While with a battle droid, Haako is power and defense value +2.
Information: Rune Haako personas are:\par \par Rune Haako\par Rune Haako, Legal Counsel\par -----\par One of the corner-stones of the battle droid deck, especially Invasion objective decks, is this plotting lawyer. Get him to the Throne Room on Naboo, and with control you will flip your objective. While he is there, all your battle droids can swarm to their maximum potential, with attrition mounting as the droids do. Haako provides you with a way to overpower high immunity characters and kick them off your planet!
IsPulled: Lord Sidious\par The Phantom Menace

Lore: A Bimm trader and smuggler of starship weapons. Trusts no one. Does business with anyone. Teaches smuggler apprentices. Has mastered Jawa language.
Gametext: Deploy on your non-smuggler to give that character \b smuggler\b0  skill. OR Deploy on any smuggler. That character is power +1. (Immune to Alter.)
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Wokling (V)

Lore: The infamous smuggler Rycar Ryjerd does this all the time. He's an idiot.
Gametext: Deploy on a Big One. X = twice the number of asteroid sectors at that system. Target a starfighter at related planet system. When reached by target, relocate Utinni Effect to planet system. When target returns to system, lose Utinni Effect. Retrieve X Force.
Information: One of the many force retrieval methods for the Light Side, Rycar's Run stands above the rest. First of all, it is efficiant. Combined with an Asteroid Sancuary deck, you don't have to put in any useless cards to make Rycar's Run work. The only other things you need are Closers, and those have a destiny of 6, and they are used. Rycar's run also only takes 2 turns to pull off, if you use a Closer each turn. Also, you get 8 Force (assuming all asteroid sectors are present, which shouldn't be a problem in an Asteroid Sanctuary deck) for just losing 1 card and using others that you would be using regardless. No destiny draws, you know what you are getting, and it sets you up for another 'Run. You can't lose it by having your target/ship killed with an Interrupt like Gravity Shadow with Kessel Run, or Look Sir, Droids with Death Star Plans.\par \par The problem arises with that one turn where your ship gets stranded out at the Big One. This is easily conquered with Cap'n Han on the Falcon with R2-D2, Chewie, and maybe even some Special Mods. Or even R2-D2 and Luke on Red 5. This pretty much makes your ship tough to get with battles, and nearly impossible (watch out for DS asteroid decks) to kill with Asteroids, ensuring that the 'Run goes through. So, what Rycar's Run actually does for your Asteroid Sancuary Deck is to make you last longer against ground-drain decks without incorporating unreliable undercover spies. I would recommend putting about 4 of them in a Sancuary deck, along with 6 Closers.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-13)\par This Utinni Effect defines a value for X at the time the Utinni Effect is initiated, not when it is resolved.

Lore: Piloted Gold 3 at the Battle of Yavin. Recruited by Garven Dreis. Found hidden Imperial tracking device that forced the evacuation of Rebel base on Dantooine.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Gold 3 during battle, adds one destiny to total power only. When at Dantooine system, adds 1 to each of your Force drains there.

Lore: \b Musician\b0. Raised by Ortolans. Grew up on the streets of Coruscant. Rescued from the Black Sun crime cartel by Lando Calrissian.
Gametext: Power and forfeit +2 at a Coruscant site. May retrieve 1 Force each time you deploy a musician to same site. Once during each of your turns, may use 1 Force to 'charm' one male of ability < 3 present; male is forfeit = 0 for remainder of turn.
IsPulled: Ak-rev\par Coruscant: Imperial City (V)

Lore: Female chosen as a handmaiden by Panaka due to her resemblance to Amidala. Trained to play the role of the Queen whenever it is considered that Amidala may be at risk.
Gametext: While at same site as Amidala, Sabe is power +2 and Amidala is immune to attrition. When at a site, during your deploy phase may place Sabe out of play to deploy Amidala to that site (for free) from your Reserve Deck (reshuffle) or Lost Pile.
Information: Got Amidala in your deck? Then there is no reason not to play Sabe while you're at it as well.\par \par Sabe provides two different benefits, depending on whether you have Amidala out on the table or not:\par \par 1. Amidala not on the table? Sabe is actually the better character to pull before Amidala herself. Sabe deploys for only two Force and lets you deploy Amidala out of your Reserve Deck or Lost Pile for free, so in a sense you're actually saving Force by using Sabe over a second copy of Amidala!\par \par 2. Already have Amidala out? Sabe provides extra power in this situation and also makes the queen immune to attrition. Even if you forfeit Sabe before a battle has concluded, Amidala will keep her immunity for the remainder of that battle. (See immune to attrition in the Glossary.)\par \par Advantageous in either situation above, Sabe is great in any deck that revolves around the ruler of the Naboo.
Pulls: Padme Naberrie\par Padme Naberrie (V)\par Queen Amidala\par Queen Amidala, Ruler Of Naboo
IsPulled: My Loyal Bodyguard

Gametext: Deploy on a desert. Specify starting direction. All characters (except Jawas and Tusken Raiders) present at same non-interior site are missing. During your control phase, moves to next adjacent site (reversing directions as necessary), but lost if at an interior site.
Information: CubsFan in the PC Rules Questions Forum Mon Aug 21, 2006 9:56 pm\par \par Control may be played as a response to the deployment of Sandwhirl, before it has a chance to resolve. Therefore, you may cancel Sandwhirl before it makes the characters go lost.\par \par This only works, however, if Control is actually declared as a response. If Sandwhirl is successfully deployed, Controlling it later won't help your poor missing characters.\par -----\par Sonn in the PC Rules Questions Forum Tue Aug 22, 2006 12:02 am\par \par Any interrupt that cancels may be played during the optional response portion of the deploying action, and thus cancel it before it ever reaches play. This is why Surreptitious Glance can cancel Dark Deal against TDIGWATT, because the objective doesn't flip until Dark Deal hits the table.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Information: A good way to get rid of pesky rebel mains is to use a combination of Scanning Crew and Close Call. Play Scanning Crew and move a low-destiny rebel to your opponents used pile. Then play Close Call, causing them to reveal the top cards of their Force Pile, Reserve Deck, and Used Piles, and then to lose those cards of the lowest destiny greater than zero. If you are lucky, you might even knock off another card in addition to the one you removed from their hand.\par -----\par Hyperwave Scan makes Scanning Crew immune to Sense.

Lore: Hold-out blaster utilized by Imperial scouts. Small size limits range, but concealability is often an asset.
Gametext: Deploy on your biker scout, or use 2 Force to deploy on your other warrior. May deploy as a 'react'. May target a character or creature using 1 Force (for free if fired by your spy or scout). Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny > defense value.
Information: A deploy free, fire free blaster for Biker Scouts is one of the most sought-after cards in booster draft play. It has average hitting power, destiny > defense value, but it can take out any pesky Ewok (like Wicket or Chirpa) or Rebel (like Kensaric or Beezer) who is giving you trouble. A Dark side spy can also fire for free, making this a very good weapon to use with Sniper. The destiny 4 number on this blaster is decent, too. Deploying Biker Scout Gear will make the Scout Blaster a 6 when drawn as destiny.\par \par While the Scout Blaster is just like an everyday blaster to most characters, in an Endor deck it becomes quite the accessory. The ability to hold onto this weapon until after your opponent has initiated a battle brings the important advantage of surprise to your side of the table.\par -----\par Can be deployed from Reserve Deck on a trooper with Blast Points.
IsPulled: Jabba's Through With You\par Mara Jade, The Emperor's Hand

Lore: Bad tempered Dug from Pixelito. He was about to turn Jar Jar into orange goo, until Anakin intervened.
Gametext: Once per battle, may use 1 Force to target opponent's character of ability < 3 at same site; target is power -3 for remainder of turn. If present with Jar Jar, during your control phase may use 3 Force to place Jar Jar out of play.
Information: If Jar Jar is the problem, then Sebulba is the answer. Sebulba can permanently deal with Jar Jar if the Gungan is foolish enough to wander over to the same location as Sebulba. There won't be any more Brisky Morning Munchen once Sebulba is finished turning Jar Jar into orange goo!\par \par Sebulba is also a solid choice for any alien based decks. 4 power for 3 deploy is a good deal, but with his ability to reduce an opposing character's power, it's almost as if he had 7 power! And he can help his good buddy Snoova and his Vibro Ax capture large hairy Wookies from time to time, too, making Chewie an easy mark.
IsPulled: He Always Wins! (V)\par Ni Chuba Na??

Lore: Some hidden modifications mean Sebulba's Podracer doesn't conform to race specifications. The duplicitous Dug has equipped it with a flame emitter that can fry other Podracers.
Gametext: Deploy on Podrace Arena. Adds 3 to each of your race destinies here. If you and your opponent have the same race total, may use 2 Force. Opponent draws no race destiny for remainder of turn (may only be used once for any race total).
Information: If you're a Dark side player, and you want to win a podrace, then this is your best choice. He adds 3 to each of his race destinies, so depending on the destiny in your deck, he will usually finish the race for you in 4 turns.\par \par To make it even more likely he'll win, he also gets a head start. Since he can prevent the opponent from drawing racing destiny if he's tied, you will always get a head start at the beginning of the race when both racing totals are zero. If your opponent manages to catch up to you, there's no worries, because you can stop the opponent from drawing destiny every time you're tied. This podracer is full of dirty tricks!

Lore: "I think I got it."
Gametext: Deploy on a location. Your Force generation is +1 here. Also, if you 'probe' opponent's "Hidden Base" system, opponent loses X Force, where X = 15 - number of systems on table. You take no battle damage where you have a 'probe' card. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Counter card against the Light Side Objective Hidden Base.\par ----- Oh.... you've got a Hdden Base? Have no fear, we'll find it..... This is one of the large nails that Endor put in the old school Hidden Base deck. It allows you to compete in space without having to devote as much starship power as the Light Side Hidden Base player probably has devoted. It carries two side effects. One is to discourage the Hidden Base player form attempting an early flip. Once probing begins and he only has 5 systems in play, you can knock them short time. Nasty damage for Light Side is the result. It pays for the Hidden Base player to delay for a few more systems, forcing that awful decision of whether or not the should flip early to go for the drains or hold out until they can scare you away from space altogether. The Imperial Navy is not easy to scare.\par \par Additionally, your somewhat more meager fleet is protected form the perils of the outrageous one turn beat-down - a common complaint from old X-Wing S-Foil swarms which could devastate the Imperial Fleet as well as the Dark Side Reserve Deck in one blow! The other function just increases the utility of this card, adding a bit of Force generation - even providing a little extra help against Force Choke decks. But remember, you cannot begin probing until AFTER the opponent flips his Hidden Base Objective - be sure to time your moment well.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans\par You Cannot Hide Forever\par You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points
Combo: Hidden Base Objective + Twi'ilek Advisor + Security Precautions\par -----\par Security Precautions + Crossfire + Battle Order

Lore: "'Fraid there's not much left... I didn't hit it that hard. It musta had a self-destruct."
Gametext: Lose a droid to cancel all attrition against you at same site this turn. OR Retarget an opponent's weapon to one of your droids at same site as target. If droid is 'hit', use original target's forfeit number.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-14)\par (Errata) When this Interrupt retargets a weapon to a droid, that droid must be a valid target for the weapon (e.g., a Power Harpoon may not target droids). If 'hit' by the retargeted weapon, the droid inherits the target's forfeit value before any further weapon effects are applied (such as forfeit reduction text).

Gametext: May deploy -1 as a 'react' to any forest, jungle or exterior Endor site. Adds 3 to power of any speeder bike he pilots. When vehicle he drives or pilots is targeted by High-speed Tactics or Get Alongside That One, adds 2 to your destiny draw.

Gametext: When at Bunker, adds 1 to Deactivate The Shield Generator total for each Explosive Charge here. When Junkin uses a Concussion Grenade, all your characters are immune to that grenade and you may add or subtract 1 from weapon destiny draw.

Lore: \b Leader\b0  of most brutal snowtrooper platoon in the Battle of Hoth. Cunning planner. Coordinates attacks and manages troop movements.

Lore: Commander of a platoon of Death Star troopers. Maintains security around the detention block area. Often serves as Lt. Shann Childsen's attache.
Gametext: When in battle with another Death Star trooper, adds one battle destiny. Your Death Star troopers are deploy -1 to same Death Star site. Trooper Charge targeting at same or related site is a Used Interrupt. Power -1 when not on Death Star.
IsPulled: Admiral Piett\par Blizzard 4

Lore: Tyrannical squad commander on Cloud City. Treats his fellow Cloud City troopers with disdain. Enemy of Utris M'Toc.
Gametext: Deploys for free on Cloud City if your Lando is at a related location. Power +2 on Cloud City. When in battle at a Cloud City site, adds 1 to your total battle destiny for each of your other Cloud City troopers in that battle.
IsPulled: Admiral Piett

Lore: Commanded a squad of snowtroopers in the Battle of Hoth. Trains snowtroopers in extreme-weather survival tactics. Originally from Ukio.
Gametext: While on Hoth, makes all your snowtroopers immune to Ice Storm. When in battle on Hoth with another snowtrooper, adds one battle destiny. Precise Attack targeting at same or related site is a Used Interrupt. Power -1 when not on Hoth.
IsPulled: Blizzard 4

Lore: Took part in the capture of the Rebel Blockade Runner \ul Tantive IV\ul0. Stormtrooper trained on Corulag. Corellia native.
Gametext: While Tarl is the trooper targeted by Spice Mines of Kessel, that Utinni Effect is immune to Alter and Tarl adds 4 to Force retrieved when completed. Subtracts 3 from Force opponent retrieves with Noble Sacrifice.
Information: Well, this guy's stats seem pretty average for a unique trooper, however his gametext can be very worthwhile if Noble Sacrifice is popular in your area., But his other gametext can also be useful. His other gamtext is obvious when you build around it. If your Capturing Deck includes Spice Mines Of Kessel for a little retrieval, then he is a must.\par \par Ability 2 characters are important in booster draft, so try not to let him slip by there either!\par \par If you are capturing (e.g. Boba Fett and Hidden Weapons), combo Tarl with Imperial Arrest Order. This ups his forfeit value to 5, but the ability to get out a Docking Bay is a sneaky way to complete your Spice Mines. Deploy Kessel, get out the Spaceport Docking Bay and drop your Spice Mines Of Kessel Utinni Effect there. One more Docking Bay for the planet you are on and retrieval + 4 is well on it's way.
IsPulled: Blizzard 4

Characteristics: ISB agent, \b Death Star trooper\b0, \b trooper\b0
Lore: Senior watch trooper at Death Star's command center. Monitors external sensor data, scanning for Rebel activity. Vigilant in his duties.
Gametext: Deploys -2 on Death Star. When in battle, adds 1 to your total battle destiny for each of your other Death Star troopers present. While on Death Star, adds 1 to each of your Force drains at a battleground related to system Death Star orbits.
IsPulled: Blizzard 4

Lore: Stormtrooper assigned to Colonel Dyer's command. His unit was recommended to Commander Igar by Governor Yount of the Wakeelmui garrison.
Gametext: May deploy for free to a battle you just initiated at a battleground site.
IsPulled: Blizzard 4

Lore: "...bring me the passengers. I want them alive!" Imperial soldiers use blaster stun settings to intimidate or to capture prisoners for questioning and interrogation.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to target one opponent's character. Draw destiny. If destiny > character's ability, character immediately returns to opponent's hand. (Also, any cards deployed on character return to owners' hands.)
Information: Sometimes just getting rid of a character for even one turn can be a benefit. How many of you have lost a game by just a few cards? Pretty much everyone right? Those are the kind of games where you say, "Boy just one little change and I would have two points instead of zero." Well let's talk about some scenarios where getting rid of a character for a turn would make a difference. And keep in mind that when you send them back is just as important as who you send back. \par \par A good target for Set For Stun is where the opponent has just enough ability to get a destiny draw. They have Owen and Beru at the Moisture Farm. Beru has ability of one, send her back to the opponent's hand and they have gone from four power and nine forfeit, to 1 power and four forfeit. Now deploy some characters and battle away, free of the uncertainty of a destiny draw. \par \par How about getting rid of that Undercover Spy that's blocking your Force Drain of two or three. Play Set For Stun during your control phase and drain away. It's not as permanent as Sniper, but it only requires one card.
IsPulled: Lieutenant Cecius\par Sy Snootles (V)
Combo: Set for Stun + Scanning Crew\par Send a Rebel back into the hand then scan it right into the Used Pile. \par -----\par Set For Stun + M'iiyoom Onith

Lore: TIE cannon mass produced at Wakeelmui system. Compatible with multiple TIE models for ease of deployment throughout the fleet.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on any TIE (for free if a TIE/ln). May target a starship using 1 Force. Draw Destiny. Target hit if destiny > defense value.
Information: SFS L-s7.2 TIE Cannon deploy -2 on Saber 3.\par -----\par May deploy aboard TIE Defender Mark I.\par
IsPulled: Colonel Jendon In Onyx 1 (V)\par I Can't Shake Him!\par

Lore: Developed by Sienar Fleet Systems weapons division to provide added firepower against shielded Rebel fighters. Also provides added coverage to increase accuracy.
Gametext: Deploy on your TIE Avenger, TIE Interceptor or TIE Defender. May target a starfighter using X Force, where X = 0 to 3. Draw destiny. If destiny +X > defense value, target hit (lost instead if X = 3).
Information: When Saber 1 is firing SFS L-s9.3 Laser Cannons, may use 1 Force to make X = 3.\par -----\par SFS L-s9.3 Laser Cannons deploy -2 on Saber 3.\par -----\par May deploy aboard TIE Defender Mark I.

Lore: Ishi Tib accountant. One of Mosep's assistants. Formerly worked for SoroSuub Inc. Blackmailed into working for Jabba. Hates her job. Searching for a means of escape.
Gametext: Power +1 at any swamp. During opponent's control phase, may use 3 Force to examine the cards in opponent's Force Pile, reorder however you wish and replace. While at Audience Chamber, all your other Ishi Tibs are power and forfeit +2.
Information: Swamps are:\par \par Dagobah: Swamp (Light Side)\par Naboo: Swamp\par Swamp\par -----\par This is one expensive lady. For the 3 Force you are paying out, you are only getting an immediate power of 1 and ability of 1. Though she seems vulnerable to weapons fire (low ability number) actually, she does have armor of 3. Like the other Ishi Tibs, Shasa is power +1 at swamps. A rather useless game function currently considering the number of swamps that are played with. What she can do though, is mess with the order of your Force Pile. During your opponents control phase, you can pay 3 Force to sort throuh their Force Pile and rearrange the cards any way you choose. Quirky hun? It may take some time, but I wonder if anyone can find a cool way to use this game text? Finally, she is also a Representative for her race while she is in the Audience Chamber and will add +2 to the power and forfeit of all other Ishis.
Combo: Shasa Tiel + Frozen Assets

Lore: Using the power of the dark side, Vader caused Luke to lose his confidence and question his sense of direction.
Gametext: If a battle you won just ended at an interior site and you have a character of ability > 3 present there, relocate one opponent's character present to an adjacent site. (If on Cloud City, may relocate that character to Weather Vane instead.)

Lore: Experienced evacuation officer. Charismatic \b leader\b0  of Echo Base troopers. Trained to expedite the evacuation of Rebel installations with maximum efficiency. Poetic \b musician\b0.
Gametext: Whenever you just initiated a battle at same site as Shawn, your troopers at adjacent sites who have not already battled this turn may immediately move to same site (as a regular move).
IsPulled: Princess Organa\par Yavin 4: Massassi War Room (V)

Lore: Lak Sivrak is a typical Shistavanen male. Ferocious, but not aggressive. Often trained as \b scouts\b0  at Imperial academies, but they despise the ambitions of the New Order.
Gametext: May move to an adjacent site as a 'react'.
IsPulled: General Crix Madine\par Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)\par Arleil Schous\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

Lore: Mother of Anakin Skywalker. As Anakin grew, Shmi realized her son was special. Did her best to hide his abilities from Watto.
Gametext: Deploys for free to Slave Quarters. Once per game may take [Tatooine] Threepio into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While in a battle at a site, subtracts one from each of opponent's battle destiny draws.
Information: Everybody loves reducing opponent's battle destiny, and Shmi is no exception. If your opponent is drawing multiple battle destiny, Shmi can lessen the damage from each one. She can also sometimes prevent you from losing anything at all. Many times your opponent will draw a one for battle destiny, which normally would force you to lose something, but Shmi will reduce that one to a zero, saving all your characters.\par \par She also lets you get Threepio With His Parts Showing from your Reserve Deck once per game. While that might not sound like a great benefit, the two characters work great together in battle. Threepio lets you put a card from your hand into your Used Pile, and when with Shmi in battle he lets you put the top card from your Used Pile on to your Reserve Deck which can enable you to get a guaranteed weapon hit, or any other action which requires a high destiny.
Pulls: Threepio With His Parts Showing
IsPulled: Tatooine: Slave Quarters
Combo: Shmi + Threepio With His Parts Showing\par Destiny tracking never so easy.

Lore: "R2-D2, you know better than to trust a strange computer."
Gametext: Target a location. Scomp links there cannot be used for remainder of turn. OR If opponent is about to scan or otherwise look through your hand (unless using Monnok), opponent continues but must lose 4 Force plus the card allowing the scan.
Information: Scrambled Transmission makes Shocking Information immune to Sense.\par -----\par At the moment, a lot of people are using variants of Mike Riboulet's Dark Sided Manipulator. This involves the opponent scanning your hand in many ways - including Onith and Scanning Crew. By having an Information up your sleeve, you can't cancel the scan but you can lose the card which allowed the scan and the DS lose 4 Force as well! If the opponent doesn't have any scanning cards in his deck, this card is not wasted - it's destiny 5, and a Used Interrupt which can be recycled with its other function. There is a DS version of this card, Shocking Revelation, but it's of much less value.\par \par \par This card provides defense against some very strong Premiere strategies that have thrived on the tournament scene. Also, it provides an easy way to cycle itself back into the Life Force and prevent Monnok from causing the damaging loss of doubles. This card can be played on any location, regardless of whether there is a scomp link on the location card.\par \par The five destiny can be cycled very easily, which is excellent for monitoring high destiny draws. Before this card, players would often have to rely on playing A Few Maneuvers or Dark Maneuvers, which also required a starfighter to be in play. The drawback is that the destiny number is slightly lower.\par \par The most obvious use of this card is to protect against Scanning Crew and M'iiyoom Onith. The loss of four Force, plus the card causing the scan can suggest to the opponent that searching should only be done in the case of true necessity. This will help the Light Side player climb out from underneath a couple of extremely strong lock down strategies.
IsPulled: Hopping Mad\par Scrambled Transmission
Combo: Shocking Information + Destiny adders
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-14)\par This card may only be played if a scomp link is on table (and able to be targeted). This card may target (or affect) a Scomp link aboard a starship or vehicle at a location. The second function of this Interrupt affects cards that peek at one, some or all of the cards in your hand.
Cancels: Scomp links

Gametext: USED: Target a location. Scomp links there cannot be used for remainder of turn. OR If opponent is about to scan or otherwise look through your hand (unless using Monnok), opponent continues but must lose 4 Force plus card allowing the scan. OR If opponent has 13 or more cards in hand, place all but 8 (random selection) in Used Pile. LOST: Use 4 Force to reveal opponent's hand. All cards opponent has two or more of in hand are lost.
Information: Scrambled Transmission makes Shocking Information immune to Sense.
IsPulled: Hopping Mad\par Scrambled Transmission
Cancels: Scomp links

Lore: "Well, don't blame me. I'm an interpreter. I'm not supposed to know a power socket from a computer terminal."
Gametext: Target a location. Scomp links there cannot be used for remainder of turn. OR If opponent is about to scan or otherwise look through your hand (unless using Grimtaash), opponent continues but must lose 4 Force plus the card allowing the scan.

This card may target (or affect) a Scomp link aboard a starship or vehicle at a location. The second function of this Interrupt affects cards that peek at one, some or all of the cards in your hand.
Cancels: Scomp links

Lore: "Oh! Go away! Go away! Beastly thing!"
Gametext: If you have a droid on table: Cancel an attack just initiated by a creature. OR Move one opponent's creature (except an attached creature) to an adjacent location (habitat permitting).
Information: Bubo and the Rancor cause plenty of problems, but this Used Interrupt with a hefty destiny can help! If you have a droid on the table, you may either cancel and attack just initiated by a creature OR move one opponent's creature (except an attached creature) to an adjacent site, habitat permitting. Canceling the attack is very nice since you can then attack the creature with all your characters later, using any weapons you might have. Having Bubo chomp Han or Leia is very annoying, especially when playing Rescue The Princess or You May Either Profit By This... so that your objective gets messed up. Moving a creature over to where your opponent has the only characters is an excellent ulterior use of this card if that creature happens to be able to attack your opponent's characters. Something would most likely die, and the key thing is that it wouldn't be one of yours! All this and a destiny 6!
Cancels: An attack just initiated by a creature.
IsCanceledBy: Shut Him Up Or Shut Him Down

Lore: Imperial battlestations keep squadrons of TIE/lns on constant patrol.
Gametext: Once per game, target one non-unique starfighter on table. Draw destiny. If destiny < X, retrieve X Force, where X = number of copies of that card you have on table. (Immune to Sense.) OR Take one non-unique starfighter into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

Lore: To test his theory that he was not in a cave, Han blasted the floor. He was right.

IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

CardName: Shut Him Up Or Shut Him Down
Lore: Some droids are disliked due to their annoying personality. Several highly publicized berserk assassin droid incidents haven't helped their public image.

Lore: Gifted engineers. Sic-six believe their technology is superior. Have a poison stinger. Spin vast and intricate webs which create a hazard for landing starships. Avoided by pilots.
Gametext: Subtracts 2 from forfeit of each opponent's pilots at same site. Prevents characters from moving to or from same or adjacent site using Elis Helrot or Nabrun Leids.
Information: The Sic-Six embody the aliens in the Star Wars universe. Wierd-looking. However, despite this, the Sic-Six can provide an extremely useful service. Elis Helrot is one of the more effective ways to move characters as the Dark Side, and enough Sic-Six can bring that strategy to a grinding halt. Note, though, that you lose the ability to use Nabrun Leids. However, generally, you'll not be relying on Nabrun Leids, not as much as your opponent will rely on Elis Helrot.
IsPulled: Arleil Schous\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

Lore: Industry leader in fighter production, but produces several other products. Constantly working on advancements to the baseline TIE design.
Gametext: Deploy on Wakeelmui system. Retrieve 1 Force each time you deploy a TIE. Also, once per turn you may relocate a TIE just lost from table to Used Pile. (Immune to Alter while you occupy Wakeelmui).
Information: Lambda-Class Shuttle deploy -1 if Sienar Fleet Systems on table.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Combo: Sienar Fleet Systems + Commander Brandei + Dreaded Imperial Starfleet + TIE's with matching pilots.

Lore: Neimoidian Trade Federation Droid Control Ship officer. Specialized in battle droid control programming and interfaces. Does not enjoy being commanded by Daultay Dofine.
Gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. While aboard a battleship, that battleship is immune to attrition < 4 and draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.
Information: The mechanically-enhanced Neimoidian pilot is an effective +3 pilot in anything you choose to throw him in - MTT, AAT, star destroyer etc. His best place is in a battleship though, adding immunity and a destiny draw. This makes him a possible choice for the use of your Blockade Flagship game text.\par -----\par Battleships are:\par \par Blockade Flagship\par Trade Federation Battleship\par Trade Federation Droid Control Ship
IsPulled: Blockade Flagship\par Lord Sidious\par The Phantom Menace

Lore: "Excuse me, sir, might I in--"
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your side of table. Neither player may move or deploy cards as a 'react' to a location where a droid is present. May be canceled by Scomp Link Access.

Lore: Imperial council member. Senior political advisor to Emperor Palpatine. Never speaks. Like his master, shows remarkable patience and wisdom.
Gametext: Deploys -3 to Emperor's site. When with Emperor, adds one battle destiny. Once per turn, you may use 1 Force to peek at top card of opponent's Reserve Deck; may place that card on bottom of that Reserve Deck. Immune to attrition < 4.

Lore: STAPs are used by infantry battle droids to provide a variety of range-based advantages on the battlefield.
Gametext: May add 1 pilot. May move as a 'react.' When piloted by a battle droid, vehicle and pilot are immune to attrition < 4. Pilot's power = 0. If lost, character aboard may "jump off" (disembark).
IsPulled: Battle Deployment\par TT-9

Lore: Governor of Naboo. After initially opposing Amidala in her campaign to become Naboo's elected ruler, Sio Bibble is now one of her most ardent supporters.
Gametext: \b Agenda\b0 : order. While at same site as Amidala, your Force generation is +2 here. While on Naboo, subtracts one from opponent's Force drains at adjacent sites, and your other Republic characters present are power +1.
IsPulled: Supreme Chancellor Valorum (V)

Lore: At his peak, no one could stand up to the Dark Lord of the Sith. His superior tactics devastated those who opposed him.
Gametext: USED: During a battle, lose one of your lightsabers in that battle to cause all non-unique aliens present to be lost. LOST: If a duel was just initiated, draw 2 destiny. Opponent draws 3 destiny. If the player with the lower total loses the duel, that player loses 6 Force.

Lore: Patrol droids utilized by the Sith. Each droid has several multispectral imaging devices and a communications package. Used by Maul to track down Amidala.
Gametext: When deployed, immediately retrieve 1 Force. Limit 1 Sith Probe Droid per location. If present with Amidala during your control phase may use 3 Force to relocate this Sith Probe Droid to Maul's site, and relocate Maul to same site as Amidala.
Information: A no-brainer for any "Capture the Queen" deck, these little mechanoids have a number of outstanding features. Their retrieval text means that playing with a few of them can help out any deck. When you have a crucial card on the top of your Lost Pile, or if you had to forfeit a vital character on your opponent's turn, then the deployment of a Sith Probe Droid will allow for its rescue.\par \par They also serve as the ultimate hunters and trackers of Amidala. You don't have to play with too many copies, either, since the Epic Event If The Trace Is Correct allows them to be "downloaded." Get 2 or 3 roaming the same planet as the Queen, and she will be unable to escape the reach of the Sith Apprentice for long.
IsPulled: Captain Piett\par If The Trace Was Correct
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-14)\par The "limit 1 per location" text on this droid works as per the operative rules (see Characteristics - Operatives, Ap. D). A player may not voluntarily deploy or move a Sith Probe Droid to or across a location where another Sith Probe Droid is located. If this should ever happen accidentally, the owner must choose one to be lost. If they belong to different owners, the droid lost is determined randomly.

Gametext: *\b Deploy\b0  on Dagobah: Swamp or Dagobah: Bog Clearing. *\b Target\b0  a mentor on Dagobah and an apprentice who has completed Jedi Test #3. *\b Attempt\b0  when apprentice is present at the beginning of your control phase. Draw training destiny. If destiny + apprentice's ability > 15, test completed: *\b Place\b0  on apprentice. Immune to attrition < 3. Once during each of your control phases, you may use 2 Force to take any one card into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
IsPulled: Dagobah: Training Area

Lore: Repulsorlift engine. 9.2 meters long. Controlled by two directional steering vanes. Jabba's fleet of skiffs is maintained by Barada.
Gametext: Deploy -1 to a Tatooine site. May add 1 driver and 5 passengers. May move as a 'react.' If lost, any characters aboard may "jump off" (disembark).
Information: Skiffs are:\par \par Racing Skiff\par Skiff\par -----\par This open transport vehicle is one of the better rides available for Light Side and Dark Side characters alike. It deploys -1 to Tatooine sites, Tatooine being one of the fairly popular planets on the tournament scene.\par A Skiff has excellent capacity, easily accommodating one driver and up to five passengers. Remember that the driver need not be a pilot, and doesn't add a piloting bonus to the transport vehicle if he/she is a pilot. However, the driver makes use of his/her personal power along with the passengers since they're all on an open vehicle. Although this makes them vulnerable to weapons fire, any or all the characters on board may surely fire back. \par Dark Side Skiff users may wish to take advantage of an Anti-personnel Laser Cannon deployed on the vehicle as well. The most powerful feature of the Skiff is its ability to move as a react. Being able to move as many as six characters to a battle or Force drain is always advantageous. To protect those characters, they may all disembark should the Skiff become lost, unlike most other vehicles. Taking into account of its attractive features, the Skiff is best utilized with mains and other tough characters to protect multiple exterior sites by reacting to where they're needed. (Just beware of Sense!) Skiffs can play a powerful role in many decks encompassing ground forces by keeping them highly mobile. Mobility is a definite tactical advantage.

Lore: Top speed of 250 kph. Repulsorlift engine. Equipped with two electromagnetic load lifters. Frequently used by shipping companies to transfer cargo between freighters.
Gametext: Deploy -1 to a Tatooine site. May add 1 driver and 5 passengers. May move as a 'react.' If lost, any characters aboard may "jump off" (disembark).
Information: Skiffs are:\par \par Racing Skiff\par Skiff\par -----\par This open transport vehicle is one of the better rides available for Light Side and Dark Side characters alike. It deploys -1 to Tatooine sites, Tatooine being one of the fairly popular planets on the tournament scene.\par A Skiff has excellent capacity, easily accommodating one driver and up to five passengers. Remember that the driver need not be a pilot, and doesn't add a piloting bonus to the transport vehicle if he/she is a pilot. However, the driver makes use of his/her personal power along with the passengers since they're all on an open vehicle. Although this makes them vulnerable to weapons fire, any or all the characters on board may surely fire back. \par Dark Side Skiff users may wish to take advantage of an Anti-personnel Laser Cannon deployed on the vehicle as well. The most powerful feature of the Skiff is its ability to move as a react. Being able to move as many as six characters to a battle or Force drain is always advantageous. To protect those characters, they may all disembark should the Skiff become lost, unlike most other vehicles. Taking into account of its attractive features, the Skiff is best utilized with mains and other tough characters to protect multiple exterior sites by reacting to where they're needed. (Just beware of Sense!) Skiffs can play a powerful role in many decks encompassing ground forces by keeping them highly mobile. Mobility is a definite tactical advantage.\par \par \par A much more modern version of your transport vehicles. This is a truly a card showing you get what you pay for. For your 3 Force you are getting a 3 power, forfeit, maneuver and landspeed. Not too bad. It will deploy for a -1 on Tatooine and may carry 6 passengers. I can really see this becoming this years exciting new model, while Deserts are on the table.

Lore: Regarded as whiners. Skrillings are a scavenger species. Steal from corpses left behind on battlefields. Feed on carrion and uncooked meat. Avoided by many species.
Gametext: Once per turn, may steal a weapon or device from an opponent's character just lost or forfeited where present. When you play Tusken Scavengers, may steal vehicles, weapons and devices found (place them in your Used Pile).
Combo: Skrilling + Tusken Scavenger

Lore: Bidlo Kwerve was involved in both the procurement and (posthumously) the loss of the rancor.
Gametext: During a battle or attack, place out of play one non-droid character, creature or creature vehicle from your Lost Pile. Add its destiny number to your total power. OR Search your Reserve Deck, take Fallen Portal or Blast the Door, Kid! into hand and reshuffle.
Information: The Skull is a strange card in that it actually forces you to put your own character out of play. In general, this is a bad thing, but it's important to note that the out of play rules don't affect non-unique characters. Also, they don't stop you from putting multiple copies of a unique card out of play. If you can manage to get a high destiny character into your Lost Pile early (like Wedge Antilles or Leesub Sirlin), then you can use their skulls for a massive power boost. Jawas are naturally a destiny of 3, making them very good choices for skull-throwing.
Pulls: Blast The Door, Kid!\par Fallen Portal
Combo: Skull + Fallen Portal -- This combo is obvious, but is very helpful. Fallen Portal is a powerful card, especially if you can lure your opponent into one of the sites mentioned on the card. With the low-ability aliens running around, Fallen Portal can be a surprisingly effective way of taking out your opponent's characters.

Lore: Luke and Leia escaped to an unused portion of the Death Star, evading security checkpoints. At a retracted bridge, they swung across on a grappling line through enemy fire.
Gametext: If Luke and Leia are in a battle together, you may add two battle destiny. OR Cancel Imperial Barrier or Wrong Turn or Retract The Bridge.
Cancels: Imperial Barrier\par Retract The Bridge\par Wrong Turn

Lore: Han was gifted in the art of understatement.
Gametext: If your weapon (except a lightsaber) was just fired during a battle, add one battle destiny.
Combo: Starfighter or Vehicle + Rapid Fire + Slight Weapons Malfunction

Lore: Luke got the shaft.
Gametext: Relocate a card from the top of any Deck or Pile to the bottom (without looking). OR If you have a droid at a Scomp link on Cloud City, cancel Into The Ventilation Shaft, Lefty. OR Use 3 Force to cause a character at Weather vane to be lost.

Lore: Warning: The Alderaanian Medical Association has determined that inhaling carbon-freezing smoke can be hazardous to your health.
Gametext: During a battle at a site, if you are about to draw a card for battle destiny, you may instead use the ability number of one of your characters involved in the battle.
Information: The advantage of 'replacing' a battle destiny draw with the ability number is that opponent may not cancel your 'draw' (because it is no draw).

Lore: It's the lure of easy credits. It's got a very strong appeal. Perhaps you'd understand better wearing my flight suit. It's the ultimate special modification, it's the smuggler's blues.
