Lore: Imperial training allows scouts to use speed and stealth to their advantage. On Endor, they were also backed up by Commander Igar's AT-STs.
Gametext: USED:If all of your ability in a battle is provided by scouts and/or spies, they each add 1 to your total battle destiny (limit +6). LOST: For remainder of turn, your unique (*) scouts and unique (*) spies are each power +1 (or +2 while being attacked by a creature).
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-14)\par The Used function of this Interrupt card adds to total battle destiny for each spy and/or scout participating in that battle, including droids.

Lore: Imperial training allows scouts to use speed and stealth to their advantage. On Endor, they were also backed up by Commander Igar's AT-STs.
Gametext: USED: If opponent just initiated a battle, place a card from hand on top of Reserve Deck. LOST: Add one battle destiny where you have an AT-ST, scout, or lone Imperial of ability < 4.

Lore: Tusken Raiders often attack lone desert travelers at long range. Their cowardly nature leads them to rely on surprise attacks rather than direct engagement.
Gametext: During your control phase, fire one of your weapons. If URoRRuR'R'R firing, may add 2 to each weapon destiny draw. (A seeker may be targeted by a character weapon using defense value of 4.) Any 'hit' targets are immediately lost.
Information: These cards can be used to kill Undercover spies, which is extremely useful. They can be even more devastating though - allowing you to eliminate a character during the control phase is wicked.\par -----\par Combo Card: Sniper & Dark Strike

Gametext: If you just targeted with a lightsaber, add 3 to your total weapon destiny. OR During your control phase, fire one of your weapons. Any 'hit' targets are immediately lost. OR Lose 1 Force to place opponent's just 'hit' character in Lost Pile.
Counterpart: Sorry About The Mess & Blaster Proficiency
IsCanceledBy: It's A Trap!\par Strike Blocked\par Swing-And-A-Miss

Lore: Cadomai is the homeworld of the generally artistic Snivvians. Its cold, dark climate makes them excellent \b scouts\b0.
Gametext: May deploy as a 'react'. Power +2 under "nighttime conditions". When at a site, if opponent cancels Nightfall on the related system, causes Effect to go to Used Pile and may retrieve 2 Force.
IsPulled: General Crix Madine\par Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)\par Arleil Schous\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

Characteristics: \b Black Sun agent\b0, \b bounty hunter\b0, \b Wookiee\b0
Lore: Perhaps the only true Wookiee \b bounty hunter\b0  in the galaxy. Even high ranking members of the Alliance fear him. Favors a vibro-ax for his personal weapon.
Gametext: Deploys -3 to same site as any smuggler or bounty. During your deploy phase, a Vibro-Ax may deploy for free on Snoova from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. When Snoova excludes a target with a Vibro-Ax, he may capture target instead.
Pulls: Vibro-Ax
IsPulled: Double Back

Lore: Modified Incom T-47 airspeeder. \b Enclosed\b0. Adapted to the cold by installation of repulsor coil heaters. Rebels typically nickname converted speeders after the intended environment.
Gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1. May move as a 'react' to Hoth sites.
IsPulled: Combined Fleet Action\par Commander Luke Skywalker (V)\par Lone Rogue

Lore: Cold Assault troopers are specially trained and equipped to operate in frozen environments. Blizzard Force snowtroopers often work in tandem with AT-ATs.
Gametext: Deploys only on Hoth. Power -1 when not at a Hoth site.
IsPulled: Blizzard 4

Lore: Elite snowtrooper officers, like all Imperial Army officers, are well versed in Rebel tactics. They serve as infantry liaisons to AT-ATs.
Gametext: Deploys only on Hoth. Snowtroopers deploy -1 to same site. Your troopers may move to same Hoth site as a 'react.'
IsPulled: Blizzard 4

Lore: As a smuggler, Solo must always be alert for trouble, even when appearing relaxed. Bounty hunters are eager to claim the price on the Corellian pirate's head.
Gametext: If Han is defending a battle alone at a site, add two battle destiny. OR If any alien is defending a battle alone at a site, add one battle destiny.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-14)\par See Lone Warrior.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-11)\par Lone Warrior\par This Interrupt must be played on your own lone character to add to your battle destiny.

Lore: Veteran officer of the Old Republic who retired from active duty after the Clone Wars. Makes a living in the Outer Rim Territories passing on his scouting expertise.
Gametext: Deploy on your warrior to give that warrior \b scout\b0  skill. That warrior may move as a 'react.' OR Deploy on your scout. When that scout 'reacts,' it is power +2 for remainder of turn. (Immune to Alter.)
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Wokling (V)

Lore: Han's apprehension toward his mysterious liberator was rather quickly overcome.
Gametext: If Han was just lost and Leia is on table (or vice versa), place the just-lost character on your Used Pile instead. OR If Leia is present at a site where Han is a captive, release Han. OR Cancel a Force drain at a prison.
Cancels: A Force drain at a prison

Lore: Luke's sudden reversal of fortune allowed him to turn the tables on Vader.
Gametext: During a battle at a site, just before drawing battle destiny, if opponent has less than double your total power, use 4 Force to switch your total power with opponent's. OR If both players just drew one battle destiny, use 1 Force to switch numbers.
Combo: Somersault + Electrobinoculars

Lore: "That was no laser blast..."
Gametext: During a battle, lose 1 Force. \b Cumulatively\b0  adds 1 to attrition against opponent.

Lore: The high command of the Emperor's fleet is selected as much for loyalty and obedience as for martial skills. A wise admiral knows better than to question Palpatine.
Gametext: Deploy on table. For opponent to move a starship from same location as your Star Destroyer requires +2 Force. Also, when opponent has just retrieved Force using an Interrupt or Utinni Effect card, that card is placed out of play. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Prepared Defenses.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans\par You Cannot Hide Forever\par You Cannot Hide Forever & Mobilization Points

Lore: Luke Skywalker. Son of Anakin. Seeker of Yoda. Levitator of rocks. Ignorer of advice. Incapable of impossible. Reckless is he.
Gametext: Deploys only on Dagobah or Cloud City. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Once per game, during your deploy phase, a lightsaber may deploy on Luke (for free) from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 4.

Matching: Artoo-Detoo In Red 5\par Red 5\par Luke's T-16 Skyhopper\par Rogue 1
MatchingWeapon: Anakin's Lightsaber\par Luke's Blaster Pistol\par Luke's Blaster Pistol (V)\par Luke's Hunting Rifle\par Luke's Hunting Rifle (V)\par Luke's Lightsaber

Lore: Oouioouioouioouioouioouioouioouioouioouioouioouioouioouioouioouioouioouioouioouioouioouioouioouioouiooui-
Gametext: USED: Search your Reserve Deck, take any one prison into hand and reshuffle. LOST: If you have an opponent's alien captive at a prison, opponent loses 3 Force.

Lore: Typical old model Courier landspeeder such as the one used by Lars family for trips to Anchorhead. Has cargo compartment. \b Enclosed\b0  seating.
Gametext: May add 1 driver and 3 passengers. Moves free if Owen Lars, Beru Lars or Luke aboard. May move as a 'react'.

Lore: "I've been looking forward to this for a long time." "Yes, I'll bet you have." Han abruptly ended his conversation with Greedo and flipped Wuher a credit to pay for the cleanup.
Gametext: During your control phase, fire one of your weapons. If Han firing, may add 1 to each weapon destiny draw. (A seeker may be targeted by a character weapon using defense value of 4.) Any 'hit' targets are immediately lost.
Information: These cards can be used to kill Undercover spies, which is extremely useful. They can be even more devastating though - allowing you to eliminate a character during the control phase is wicked.\par \par One thing to keep in mind when considering inclusion of Sorry About The Mess is the fact that this card allows the use of starship weapons as well as character weapons.\par -----\par Combo Card: Sorry About The Mess & Blaster Proficiency

CardName: Sorry About The Mess & Blaster Proficiency

IsPulled: Finn
Combo: Sorry About The Mess & Blaster Proficiency + Impressive, Most Impressive (V): These two cards allow you to control the battle by eliminating one character before anything else happens.

Lore: Persuasive recruiter from Tefau. Possesses limited precognition. Used his contacts in Jabba's desert stronghold to find support for the Rebellion.
Gametext: Once during each of your control phases, when at a Jabba's Palace site you control, may use 1 Force to take one alien that is a smuggler, scout, thief or spy into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

Lore: Ewok warriors on patrol use primitive animal horns to coordinate their defenses.
Gametext: USED: Use 1 Force to take into hand one vehicle, weapon or interrupt with 'Ewok' in the title from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. LOST: If your Ewok is defending a battle, add one battle destiny.

Lore: Gigantic silicon-based lifeform. Exists in the vacuum of space. Devours small vessels whole. Has difficulty keeping its modified light freighters down.
Gametext: * Ferocity = two destiny. Habitat: Big One (Cave is now Belly). Attacks starfighters (defeated cards are eaten or relocated to Belly, opponent of victim chooses). Once per turn, may open or close mouth.
Information: A simple but effective strategy to use with this card is to have the Space Slug Belly site out as well. The reason for this is that if it eats a ship from your side you relocate it to the Space Slug Belly and fly it out in your move phase but if it eats one of your opponents starships make it so it is "eaten".
Rules: AR Appendix B:\par When this creature is deployed, its mouth begins in an 'open' state.

Lore: Immense spaceborn predator. Consumes minerals, mynocks and the occasional passing starfighter. Lives in asteroid caves. Only one meter long at birth.
Gametext: * Ferocity = two destiny. Habitat: Big One (Cave is now Belly). Attacks starfighters (defeated cards are eaten or relocated to Belly, opponent of victim chooses). Once per turn, may open or close mouth.
Rules: AR Appendix B:\par When this creature is deployed, its mouth begins in an 'open' state.

Lore: Spaceport Speeders buys, trades and sells floaters. Wioslea is known as a shrewd bargainer. Luke got 2,000 credits for his X-24 speeder.
Gametext: Sell one of your vehicles or droids at Mos Eisley or same site as Wioslea. Draw two destiny (three destiny if vehicle is Luke's X-34 Landspeeder). The total is the 'offer,' which you must accept. Activate that much Force; then vehicle or droid is lost.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, A-15)\par This Interrupt is now restricted (***) and should read as "***Spaceport Speeders".

Lore: Qui-Gon knew that urgency was required. What had transpired on Tatooine demanded the attention of the Council.
Gametext: USED: If the Jedi Council Chamber is not on table, you may deploy it from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. LOST: Deploy one Jedi Council member to the Jedi Council Chamber from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
Information: Jedi Council members are:\par \par Depa Billaba\par Jedi Advisor (V)\par Ki-Adi-Mundi\par Ki-Adi-Mundi (V)\par Mace Windu\par Mace Windu (V)\par Mace Windu, Jedi Master\par Mace Windu, Master Of The Order (V)\par Plo Koon\par Plo Koon (V)\par Yoda, Master Of The Force\par Yoda, Senior Council Member

Lore: Because bounty hunters are untrustworthy, the Empire relies on its troopers for efficient prisoner delivery.
Gametext: Deploy on a prison. When one of your troopers 'delivers' (imprisons) a captive here, you may search your Lost Pile, take any one card into hand and then lose this Effect (each captive may be 'delivered' only once until they are released or leave table).
Information: Prisons are:\par \par Cloud City: Security Tower\par Death Star: Detention Block Corridor\par Jabba's Palace: Dungeon
IsPulled: Corporal Drazin\par Fett's Blaster Rifle (V)\par Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Combo: Special Delivery + any Trooper

Lore: Han's "special modifications" for \ul Millennium Falcon\ul0  included security mechanisms, deflector shields, hull plating, faster hyperdrive and enhanced weapons.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on any starship to add 2 to its armor or maneuver. If on \ul Falcon\ul0  with Han, Lando or Chewie piloting, also adds 2 to power and forfeit.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once
Combo: Special Modifications + Light Maneuvers Special Modifications is doubled until end of turn.

Lore: Aratech 74-Z military model. Preferred by troops operating far from Imperial maintenance facilities. Flight ceiling of 25 meters.
Gametext: May add 1 pilot and 1 passenger. May move as a 'react.' When piloted, vehicle and scouts aboard are immune to attrition < 4. Pilot's power = 0. If lost, characters aboard may "jump off" (disembark).
IsPulled: Aratech Corporation (V)\par Battle Deployment\par Biker Scout Trooper

Lore: Aratech speeder bikes often found their way into Rebel hands. Stolen from troops operating far from Imperial maintenance facilities.
Gametext: May add 1 pilot and 1 passenger. May move as a 'react.' When piloted, vehicle and scouts aboard are immune to attrition < 4. Pilot's power = 0. If lost, characters aboard may "jump off" (disembark).
IsPulled: Combined Fleet Action

Lore: Used for strafing runs during hit and fade tactics. Often difficult to target for an inexperienced pilot.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your speeder bike, 2 on your swoop. Vehicle is power +2. May target a character, creature or vehicle for free. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value.
IsPulled: Vizam (when with Advosze)

Lore: Captives sent to the Kessel spice mines spend the rest of their lives digging for glitterstim, a spice sold throughout the galaxy by smugglers and crime lords.
Gametext: Deploy on Kessel (may not be moved). Target one captive and one trooper to escort captive. When targets reach Utinni Effect, retrieve Force equal to captive's forfeit (captive and Utinni Effect lost). If trooper lost en route, captive released.
Information: If Sergeant Tarl is the trooper targeted by Spice Mines of Kessel, that Utinni Effect is immune to Alter and Tarl adds 4 to Force retrieved when completed.
IsPulled: Corporal Vandolay\par Corporal Vandolay (V)\par Spice Mine Operations (V)\par Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: Has conducted several successful ambushes on Imperial convoys. Veteran crew. Has a reputation for arriving when least expected.
Gametext: May deploy -3 as a 'react.' May add 3 pilots, 4 passengers and 1 vehicle. Has ship-docking ability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2.
Combo: Bright Hope (V) + Wedge Antilles, Red Squadron Leader + Spiral + Derek 'Hobbie' Klivian cancels one destiny and substracts another from opponent's total power and attrition.

Lore: To simply be a sitting member of the Galactic Senate consumes a lot of time and energy. The opposition that is arrayed against you does not make it any easier.
Gametext: Once per game, retrieve 1 Force for each of your senators at Galactic Senate. (Immune to Sense.) OR Take one senator (or Coruscant Guard) into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
Information: This is the ultimate utility card for your senatorial needs. If you're using the new objective My Lord, Is That Legal?, you'll want to use multiples of this card to get your key senators and their bodyguards, Coruscant Guards, out. And once you have all the key characters you need at the senate, this doubles as late-game force retrieval.\par \par But you can also use this in a non-senate deck to get a key senator on a matching effect. For example, you can use Squabbling Delegates to get Orn Free Taa to put on Motion Supported and get a very useful ability, all without needing the Galactic Senate.
Pulls: One senator\par One Coruscant Guard\par Aks Moe\par Baskol Yeesrim\par Edcel Bar Gane\par Lott Dod\par Orn Free Taa\par Passel Argente\par Tikkes\par Toonbuck Toora\par Yeb Yeb Adem'thorn\par Coruscant Guard\par Keder The Black
Combo: Squabbling Delegates + Orn Free Taa + Motion Supported\par All the high destiny you'll ever need!

Lore: Rebel starfighter squadrons take great pride in their proficiency and dedication. Alliance pilots train relentlessly until man and machine function as one.
Gametext: Deploy on table. During your deploy phase, you may reveal one unpiloted starfighter from hand to take its matching pilot character from Reserve Deck (or vice versa) and deploy both simultaneously; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Heading For The Medical Frigate.\par -----\par Maneuvering Flaps (V) has same game text for unpiloted combat vehicles.\par -----\par Get To Your Ships! has same game text (EP1)
IsPulled: Laudica (V)\par The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Your Insight Serves You Well\par Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-14)\par See Combat Response.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-4)\par Combat Response\par Once an unpiloted starfighter (or pilot) is revealed, if no matching pilot (or unpiloted starfighter) is found, the opponent is permitted to verify. If a match has been found but the player does not have enough Force to deploy the cards (or there is no location where they can be legally deployed), then the card revealed from hand is returned to hand, and the card taken from the Reserve Deck is placed back in the Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

Lore: Security battle droid whose programming assured him a Jedi could be subdued. Supposed to be designated SSA-101, but a mistake in production pushed him back to 1015.
Gametext: While with an opponent's Jedi, your other battle droids present are power +1. Opponent's Jedi are deploy +4 to same site. While with another battle droid at a site, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.
IsPulled: Naboo: Theed Palace Hallway
Combo: SSA-1015 + Daultay Dofine

Lore: Security battle droid assigned to guard duty at Theed Palace. His shift can only be ended by a blaster shot.
Gametext: At same site, opponent's spies and smugglers are deploy +4 and may not apply their ability toward drawing battle destiny. While with another battle droid at a site, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.
IsPulled: Naboo: Theed Palace Hallway
Combo: SSA-306 + Daultay Dofine

Lore: Security battle droid assigned to quell uprisings before they have a chance to gather momentum. Believes the best form of defense is offense.
Gametext: While with another battle droid, power +3. If with a battle droid on Naboo and you just verified opponent's Reserve Deck, may lose 2 Force to search that Reserve Deck and place one card you find there out of play.
Information: Did you ever imagine that a Security Battle Droid would alter the way your opponent plays his entire game? SSA-719 will do just that. Looking through his Reserve Deck for cards you know aren't in there using interrupts or "once per turn" texts on Effects could now cost him dearly. If you are playing battle droids on Naboo, opponent downloading is a much reduced concern, and anything that makes your opponent think twice and alter his approach means a headstart for you.
IsPulled: Naboo: Theed Palace Hallway
Combo: SSA-719 + Daultay Dofine

Lore: The Alliance carefully chooses docking bays from which to launch limited offensives.
Gametext: Deploy on table. Your Force generation is +1 at each docking bay you occupy (or +2 if you control). Your non-unique Star Cruisers are deploy -1 and may deploy to same battleground system as any Rebel starship. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Heading For The Medical Frigate.\par -----\par Staging Areas is suspendend by Fanfare (+ the Defensive Shield), while opponent occupies no battleground systems.\par -----\par The only non-unique Star Cruiser is Mon Calamari Star Cruiser.\par -----\par Combo Card: Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Your Insight Serves You Well\par Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-14)\par The "may deploy" text on this Light Side Effect overrides the deployment restrictions listed on a non-unique Star Cruiser card only. It does not, for example, permit the deployment of a non-unique Star Cruiser to Dagobah, or 'behind' the Endor Shield.
IsCanceledBy: Fanfare and Fanfare - Defensive Shield suspends Staging Areas while Light Side player occupies no battleground systems.

Lore: Originally assigned to search the Outer Rim for new worlds to subjugate. Launched the probe droid that found Echo Base. Later reassigned to Death Squadron.
Gametext: May add 6 pilots, 8 passengers, 2 vehicles and 4 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Probe droids deploy free to sites related to same system.
Information: Admiral Motti (V) makes unique (*) Star Destroyers power +2 and add 1 to their immunity to attrition.\par -----\par Probe droids are:\par \par Probe Droid\par Sith Probe Droid

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-14)\par Although this site is not a docking bay, starfighters may deploy here as if it were a docking bay. The site's game text is clarified as follows:\par Shuttle - Your cards that may shuttle to this site's star destroyer may instead shuttle here; likewise, your cards here may shuttle to a site related to that star destroyer.\par Transfer - You may dock another starship with this site's related star destroyer (following the normal rules of moving between docked starships) and transfer cards between that starship and this site (when doing so, the cost of docking is free).\par Embark - Your starships may land at this site as if it were a docking bay.\par Disembark - Your starships may take off from this site as if it were a docking bay.\par These actions cannot be combined with similar actions involving this site's star destroyer; for example, you may shuttle a group of characters to this site and a group of characters to the star destroyer itself, but these are both separate actions and are handled accordingly (the ones shuttled to the star destroyer would not be free).

Lore: "Aacccck!"
Gametext: Target an escort alone and its captive. Draw destiny. Escort lost if destiny + captive's power > escort's ability + power. OR During a battle at a site where Leia is an escorted captive, add one battle destiny.
Information: Ah, one of the very rare 7 destiny cards in the game. Typically these cards fall into the "never used except for destiny draws" category but this one may be different. Not only will it give your captive a shot at freedom from a weaker escort, but it will allow you to add one battle destiny whenever Leia is an escorted captive at the same site. This card has actually been used often in conjunction with deploying Leia to Jabba. Drop your captive Leia onto Jabba and then "Aacccck!" no more Jabba. Of course, you need to draw a good destiny to pull it off, but hey use enough Strangles and you got it made!
Combo: Strangle + Princess Leia Organa\par This is an obvious combo that is used quite often. As mentioned above, use this to either destroy Jabba during a critical turn, or to get your Leia out.

Lore: Stormtroopers are trained to stun, not kill, priority targets in order to split enemy forces and hold the leaders for interrogation. Stun effects wear off, requiring efficient action.
Gametext: If a battle was just initiated at an interior site, use 1 Force; for remainder of battle, all characters of ability > 2 and all leaders (on both sides) are simultaneously excluded from that battle.
Information: This is another equalizer for you anti-Mains and Toys players out there, especially with the release of Cloud City. Two things in Cloud City made this card especially great: interior draining and Trooper Assault.\par \par Since Stunning Leader only works at interior sites, most people found little use for it before Cloud City. After all, the best draining sites for the Dark Side were almost exclusively exterior! Virtually every Dark Side site with a Force drain for two or more was an exterior site like the Tatooine: Lars' Moisture Farm, Tatooine: Jundland Wastes, or Hoth: Defensive Perimeter.\par With the release of Cloud City, the Dark Side now has a set of interior sites with decent draining opportunities. Unlike the Death Star or Executor sites, these have Light Side icons allowing a modest drain. Adding Dark Deal to a Cloud City deck could be devastating to an ill-prepared Light Side deck. With lightsabers and Dark Deal, Cloud City is an okay place to Force drain for the Dark Side. Oh, and don't forget about Bounty Hunting opportunities.\par \par Along with Cloud City's interior sites came a nice Used Interrupt called Trooper Assault. This card simulates the endless hordes of troopers the Imperial Army seems to muster by making all Dark Side troopers in a battle power +2 and immune to all attrition. This one interrupt almost single-handedly made troopers viable again.\par \par So where does Stunning Leader fit into the equation? Well, consider a Cloud City Force drain deck with troopers as its primary site defenses. Every site (don't use the Docking Bay) is interior, meaning Stunning Leader can be played at a site battle anywhere. All troopers are ability 2 or lower, so they won't be excluded from the battle when Stunning Leader is played - this interrupt isolates your troopers against the Light Side's non-mains.
Combo: Stunning Leader + Cloud City sites + Lift Tubes\par A great point defense system that'll allow you to spread a bit thinner than normal and still be able to bring all your low ability characters to brawl in a mainless battle.\par -----\par Stunning Leader + Ability > 2 Imperials + Stormtroopers + Trooper Assault\par This is awesome because you get a speed gain and a defensive gain; the Stormtroopers deploy for free and Stunning Leader excludes the high ability Imperial, leaving only totally immune troopers in the fight. Add a Comlink for more fun.\par -----\par Stunning Leader + Cloud City Troopers + Imperial Trooper Guards + E-3P0\par Bring out the odds cards! With this kind of Cloud City defense force, you could have a blast with Light Side Mains. Trooper Assaults would make the power here obscene. Don't forget the E Chu Ta for maximum insult to injury.\par -----\par Stunning Leader + IT-0 + IG-88 + Probe Droid\par How about a droid strike team? Exclude all their mains and send your droids on suicide missions. Retrieve with the Cloud City: Incinerator and repeat ad infinitum. With a spy on the team, it can't be kept out of the action.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-14)\par (Errata) See Blast The Door, Kid!\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-2)\par Blast The Door, Kid!\par (Errata) Characters of ability > 2 or leaders introduced to the battle after this Interrupt has been played are also immediately excluded from the battle.

Lore: Veteran Rebel engineers know that weapon systems positioned for adequate coverage are vulnerable themselves.
Gametext: Deploy on table. Each turn, each of your characters, vehicles and starships may forfeit one of its weapons (except a lightsaber) using forfeit value = 3. Also, your forfeited weapons go to Used Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Heading For The Medical Frigate.

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-14)\par See Inconsequential Losses.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-9)\par Inconsequential Losses\par The game text "may forfeit one of its weapons" means that a character, starship or vehicle may only forfeit a weapon deployed on that character, starship or vehicle. Thus a character cannot use this Effect to forfeit an artillery weapon at the same location, a starship cannot forfeit an Orbital Mine at the same system and so on. The game text that allows your forfeited weapons go to your Used Pile applies to any weapon you forfeit (including artillery weapons that already have a forfeit value).

Lore: Although Finis Valorum maintains the Galactic Senate's ultimate title, his real power is mired by endless bureaucracy, petty corruption, and incessant plotting.
Gametext: \b Agendas\b0 : justice, order. While in a senate majority, once per turn may use 2 Force to cancel a just drawn battle destiny at another site where you have a Republic character. Opponent may use X Force; Valorum is politics -X for remainder of turn.
Information: People call Finis Valorum the Bill Clinton of Star Wars. I like to call him the General Zod of SWCCG. If you plan to base your deck around the Galactic Senate, or if you just want to mop the floor with those weenie Dark Side Senators for laughs, Supreme Chancellor Valorum is your man.\par \par With a hefty 5 Politics, Valorum has the highest concentration of political power in the game. Even better, Valorum has excellent stats outside of the Senate, with 4 Ability (all the better to draw battle destiny when alone at the Senate) and a whopping 7 Forfeit. Top it all off with a multiple-use-friendly 3 Destiny, and the Supreme Chancellor's a shoe-in for any deck.\par \par But it's his skill in the Senate that makes Valorum a top choice for any deck. While in a Senate majority, he's a one-man Tarkin, with the power to cancel an opponent's battle destiny at any site, anywhere, any time, for only 1 Force. That's what I like to call sledgehammer politics. And it's all from the safety of the Galactic Senate, where Walkers and Sith Lords are strictly pooh-poohed.\par \par Of course, Valorum's power comes with a price. You remember all those "baseless" accusations we heard about in the movie? Well, they're back with a vengeance. As long as your opponent has Force to spend, he can reduce Valorum's Politics infinitely. While this doesn't hinder Valorum when it comes to guerilla "votes" in the Senate, it does make controlling the Senate with him alone a risky proposition. Be prepared to back him up with other political figures, like Queen Amidala... or a certain future Supreme Chancellor...
IsPulled: Supreme Chancellor Valorum (V)
Combo: Supreme Chancellor Valorum + General Solo + Chewbacca: cancel two battle destiny? I'm there!\par -----\par Supreme Chancellor Valorum + Stay Here, Where It's Safe: Extra power, extra politics, and attrition immunity. No one is safe from Zod - er, Valorum!

Lore: "The battle station is heavily shielded and carries a firepower greater than half the starfleet."

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-14)\par See Don't Tread On Me.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-6)\par Don't Tread On Me\par If your starting location (or a location you have deployed with an objective) was a battleground when deployed, but is converted into a non-battleground, you may still use the starting text of this interrupt.

Combo: Surprise + Dark Waters\par The little known ability of Dark Waters to reduce Force drains makes it a fairly powerful card, especially if it can be used to follow your opponent's drains.\par -----\par Surprise + Death Mark\par Since many decks play with Han and Chewie, you can retarget the Death Mark to whoever happens to be farther away at the time.\par -----\par Surprise + Death Squadron\par The only thing that weakens this otherwise pretty good card is that the Rebellion tends to stay away from it. Well, with Surprise, you can bring the Squadron to them.

Lore: Imperial troops with strict orders are often caught off-guard by innovative Rebel ambushes, sneak attacks, or sabotage efforts.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to cancel a Force drain at one location. Draw one destiny for each character, starship and vehicle the opponent has present. Compare your destiny total to opponent's power total. Player with lowest total loses Force equal to the difference.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par See Counter Assault.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-4)\par Counter Assault\par The total power and number of destinies to be drawn is determined immediately when this Interrupt card begins resolving, and neither changes during the resolution. Thus if a character, starship or vehicle is introduced to the location during resolution of the Assault (such as via Tauntaun Bones) it does not add power and does not permit an additional destiny draw. Similarly, if cards are removed from the location during the resolution (such as by a Program Trap), they will still contribute power and still add a destiny draw for purposes of resolving the Counter Assault. This Interrupt does not cause a battle and thus cards may not be forfeited to reduce Force loss. Remember that, at a system location, characters and vehicles aboard starships are not present at the system. Therefore, for Counter Assault there will ordinarily only be one destiny draw per starship at the system but none for any cards aboard. Counter Assault may technically be played at a holosite but, since there are no characters present (only dejariks and holograms), no destiny will be drawn and zero will be compared to the opponent's total power.
Cancels: Surprise Assault may not be played when The Way Of Things on table.
IsCanceledBy: Boring Conversation Anyway\par Cold Feet (V)\par Counter Surprise Assault\par Tarkin's Orders

Lore: Chief Chirpa led his Ewok warriors in a counterattack that captured many Imperial soldiers outside the Endor control bunker.
Gametext: Cancel Counter Assault. OR Use 4 Force to cancel opponent's Force drain at an exterior Endor site. Deploy (for free) from Reserve Deck any number of non-unique Ewoks to that site (Dark Side characters, vehicles, and starships here may 'escape' to Used Pile).
Information: The Light Side version of the Special Edition card Counter Surprise Assault is certainly a handy way to kick your Ewok deck into fast deploy!\par \par Often an issue with "weenie decks" is that you take a bit longer to get enough into hand to deploy "safely". This usually translates to having to put more of the weenies in your deck, reducing room for other vital defences. Surprise Counter Assault will get your fuzzies our quick smart, and what's cheaper than free?\par \par Use this to get your Ewok Tribesmen, Ewok Sentries and Ewok Spearmen onto Endor in large quantities. Equally useful in an Ewok based Endor Booster Draft deck, as lesser quantities available in your Deck can often make them a little harder to find when you need them.
Pulls: Any number of non-unique Ewok to an Endor site.\par Ewok Sentry\par Ewok Spearman\par Ewok Tribesman
IsPulled: I Hope She's All Right (V)
Combo: lotsa Ewok Sentries + Surprise Counter Assault + Endor: Hidden Forest Trail = the drain is cancelled, the Ewoks get deployed from Reserve Deck for free at a site with 2 Light Side icons, and if you scare the Dark Side characters to the Used Pile, then from the Forest Trail you can get them to any exterior Endor site you wish!
Cancels: Counter Assault

Lore: After working together for a long time, Lando and Lobot developed a speechless form of communication.
Gametext: If Lobot and your Lando are in a battle together, cancel one opponent's destiny draw immediately after it is revealed. OR use 4 Force to cancel Dark Deal.
Information: \par Cloud City is flooded with cards that work as teamwork cards do, but with different effects. The only true requirement to these cards is, they must be played where two "mains" are present. This adds to the popularity and strength of the main characters as a whole, especially for the Dark Side.\par \par Surreptitious Glance is easy to play with, simply because of Lobot's deployment restrictions. Chances are, he's going to appear where Lando is. With Surreptitious Glance, you can duplicate Tarkin's ability with Vader, canceling your opponent's destiny draw. The advantage is obvious. The Light Side has an edge, though. Kal'Falnl C'ndros lets you (semi-reliably) cancel your opponent's draws, since the Light Side tends to have better destiny draws. Unfortunately, recent rulings have weakened Kal when she is present with Tarkin. Captain Han Solo forces your opponent to re-draw a destiny. Understand, he might just draw a better destiny!\par \par You can use Surreptitious Glance as a safety net should any of these strategies fail. Saving this card for when you truly need it tests your patience, but you can't wait too long, as Lando and Lobot tend to die faster than other mains.\par \par It's sub-text also makes it extremely useful, cancelling the Dark Side version of Echo Base Operations, Dark Deal, which is ordinarily extremely hard to counter.
Cancels: One opponent's destiny draw.\par Dark Deal

Lore: ArMek SW-4 turret-mounted ion cannon. Bursts of ionized energy fuse and overload target's mechanical and computer systems. Allows ships to be captured and boarded.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your Y-wing or B-wing. May target a starship using 1 Force. Draw destiny. If destiny > target's defense value, all starship weapons deployed on target are lost, armor or maneuver = 0 and hyperspeed = 0.
Information: Deploys and fires free aboard Gold 4.\par -----\par Deploys and fires free aboard Gold 6.\par -----\par May fire free and each of its weapon destiny draws is +2 aboard Gray Squadron 1.\par -----\par When a starship piloted by Gray Squadron Y-wing Pilot fires an ion cannon, once per turn, may draw two weapon destiny and choose one.\par
IsPulled: Lieutenant s'Too Vees (when at a docking bay)\par Portable Scanner\par Rapid Fire

Gametext: May not deploy to Bespin, Coruscant, Hoth, Kessel or Tatooine. To initiate battle here, you must use +3 Force. You may not 'react' to or from here.   May not deploy to Bespin, Coruscant, Hoth, Kessel or Tatooine. Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one creature here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
LightSideText: May not deploy to Bespin, Coruscant, Hoth, Kessel or Tatooine. To initiate battle here, you must use +3 Force. You may not 'react' to or from here.
DarkSideText: May not deploy to Bespin, Coruscant, Hoth, Kessel or Tatooine. Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one creature here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
Pulls: One creature\par Bubo\par Dragonsnake\par Mynock\par Rancor\par Rock Wart\par Sleen \par Vine Snake\par Womp Rat

Gametext: May not deploy to Bespin, Coruscant, Hoth, Kessel or Tatooine. Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one creature here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle   May not deploy to Bespin, Coruscant, Hoth, Kessel or Tatooine. To initiate battle here, you must use +3 Force. You may not 'react' to or from here.
LightSideText: May not deploy to Bespin, Coruscant, Hoth, Kessel or Tatooine. Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one creature here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle
DarkSideText: May not deploy to Bespin, Coruscant, Hoth, Kessel or Tatooine. To initiate battle here, you must use +3 Force. You may not 'react' to or from here.
Information: Kaadu adds 1 to Force drain here.
Pulls: One creature\par Mynock\par Nudj\par Scurrier\par Vine Snake\par Worrt

Lore: Petty criminals throughout the galaxy often earn extra money by teaching their trade to initiates. Thievery has become more popular as the Empire tightens its grip.
Gametext: Deploy on your non-thief to give that character \b thief\b0  skill. Once during each of your control phases, may target one device at same site. Draw destiny. If destiny < target's destiny number, it is stolen. OR Deploy on a weapon to prevent theft. (Immune to Alter.)
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: It's the bottom of the ninth level of Cloud City. Vader steps up to the platform. Here's the delivery. . . oooh, he took a big cut there! The Force sure wasn't with him on that one!
Gametext: If opponent just used a lightsaber to target, draw one destiny and subtract that amount from opponent's weapon destiny. OR Cancel one Mostly Armless card just played. OR Cancel Dark Strike, End This Destructive Conflict or Focused Attack.
Information: This card can be used to augment the strength of the Light Side players characters during ground battles. It can be used in a variety of different defensive situations, and is a Used Interrupt. This can be a nice advantage as many of the cards that it cancels by title are Dark Side Lost Interrupts. It is also a nice advantage to have the defense from lightsabers recur throughout the course of the game.\par \par With the addition of a couple more relatively high ability Light Side character cards in Cloud City, subtracting one destiny from the total of a lightsaber draw may go a long way to making the Light Side safe from marauding Dark Side saber users. Also, since Swing-And-A-Miss has three dots, it may be played at three separate times throughout the course of a turn, protecting from lightsaber swings as well as some of the Dark Side's nastier battle related interrupts from the Cloud City set.\par \par In battle heavy Cloud City playtesting, this card led to one of my favorite exchanges of quotes as the Dark Side player used Mostly Armless accompanied by the Pythonian quote "Your arms off", to which the Light player responded "No it isn't," when they played Swing-And-A-Miss.
Rules: This Interrupt subtracts from the total weapon destiny for a lightsaber, not from an individual destiny draw.
Cancels: Dark Strike\par End This Destructive Conflict\par Focused Attack\par Mostly Armless\par Sniper & Dark Strike

Lore: Members of swoop gangs on Tatooine often have experience piloting larger craft. Many wear tall shock-helmets.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots or drives and, when driving a swoop, adds 3 to landspeed. When present at a site with another Swoop Mercenary, may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.

Lore: Pa'lowick \b musician\b0. Manager of The Max Rebo Band. Reports on Jabba to Lady Valarian. Bib Fortuna uses her as a double agent, feeding her false information.
Gametext: During your deploy phase, where present, allows J'Quille or Bib Fortuna to deploy from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once each turn when you have at least 3 musicians on table, may play Ommni Box to cancel opponent's Force drain at a related site.
Pulls: Bib Fortuna\par Bib Fortuna (EP1)\par J'Quille
IsPulled: Ak-rev

Lore: Airspeeders operate in coordinated patrols, supporting Rebel ground troops and denying infiltration of key planets.
Gametext: If your T-47s occupy three battleground sites on same planet, your Force drains at same and related battlegrounds this turn are +1 (or +2 if at Hoth). OR Cancel a Force drain at a site if your T-47 occupies an adjacent site. OR Cancel Walker Garrison.
IsPulled: Commander Luke Skywalker (V)
Cancels: A Force drain at a site if your T-47 occupies an adjacent site.\par Walker Garrison\par Walker Garrison (V)

Lore: Sophisticated communication equipment hidden in the ruins of the extinct Massassi race is used to coordinate forces and to re-call Rebel officers for debriefing and orders.
Gametext: Deploy on any Yavin 4 site immediately after winning a battle elsewhere. Target a warrior involved in that battle. Target's power and forfeit are -2 (-3 if Leia) until target reaches this Utinni Effect (which is then canceled).
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: Highly organized Imperial infantry units can mobilize with incredible speed, often putting their surprised adversaries on the defensive.
Gametext: Lose 1 Force to take up to three troopers into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
Information: Suppose you have General Veers in your hand and you're playing on Hoth. Use Tactical Support to bring three Stormtroopers into your hand. Deploy General Veers and the Stormtroopers, and for three Force you've just given yourself a power of 9 and a bunch of forfeit. The trick with Tactical Support is to do it before you activate any Force so that way you don't have to worry about your troopers being in your Force pile instead. The fact that you have to lose a force to use it isn't great, but I think it's a fair trade, especially if you make sure you lose from your hand so you don't end up losing a key character.\par -----\par Quarren at a planet site makes Tactical Support a Used Interrupt.\par -----\par Raithal makes Tactical Support a Used Interrupt.
Pulls: Three troopers
IsPulled: Lieutenant Suba

Lore: Military version of a 'remote.' Programmed to stalk specific targets or secondary targets. Heat and light sensors track with fatal accuracy. Can stow away on starships.
Gametext: Deploys for 1 Force to an unoccupied site. Deploys and moves like an undercover spy. When present with Tagge (or warrior) of ability < 3, choose one to be immediately lost (treat as an "all cards" situation). Seeker is also lost.
Information: Attark:\par When at a site you control, allows your Seekers to deploy free there. Attark also allows your Seekers to move for free and to ignore any or all potential target(s) whenever you choose.
IsPulled: Portable Scanner\par Throw Me Another Charge
Combo: Tagge Seeker + Attark

Lore: Aoooga! Aoooga!
Gametext: Cancel Egregious Pilot Error, Out Of Nowhere, Collision! or Don't Get Cocky. OR Use 1 Force to subtract 3 from all asteroid destiny draws against you for remainder of turn.
Cancels: Collision!\par Don't Get Cocky\par Egregious Pilot Error\par Houjix & Out Of Nowhere\par Out Of Nowhere\par Out Of Nowhere (V)

Lore: The ability to think and act indepedently gave the Rebels an advantage over their Imperial foes.
Gametext: USED: If all your ability in a battle is provided by scouts and/or spies, they each add 1 to your total battle destiny (limit +6). LOST: For remainder of turn, your unique (*) scouts and unique (*) spies are each power +1 (or +2 while being attacked by a creature).
Information: This card can be useful in constructed, but also strong in an Endor Booster draft. To use this card to its fullest in draft takes a commitment to draft scouts. This usually means drafting mostly Rebels since most Endor Rebels are scouts. Also, doing this reduces your reliance on Ewoks and makes the opponent's cards which target Ewoks a little less effective. The more common use for this interrupt is the Used portion. Adding up to 6 attrition can really help clear out the site, especially in draft where the opponent is likely to have low forfeit characters. The lost version can also be useful. You can use it to save an undercover spy from a Bubo attack to get one more turn of blocking drains, or if not all your ability is from scouts and spies, you can use it to add a few more power in battle either increasing damage for your opponent or saving you a few cards.
Combo: Take The Initiative + Threepio + Ewok Sentries - the Sentries deploy (or move!) as a react, and each one adds 2 to attrition. Ouch time!
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par See Sneak Attack.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-14)\par Sneak Attack\par The Used function of this Interrupt card adds to total battle destiny for each spy and/or scout participating in that battle, including droids.

Lore: During the occupation of Naboo, battle droids were ordered to arrest any Naboo citizens on sight.
Gametext: USED: Subtract one from a just drawn battle destiny. LOST: During opponent's control phase, use X Force to 'break cover' of an opponent's undercover spy at same site as your battle droid or Neimoidian, where X = spy's deploy cost.
Information: Nice undercover spy nuetralizer for Neimoidian or battle droid decks, and its USED function adds a sweet recycling mechanism. For true opponent irritation, get it and use it every turn theres a battle with Nute Gunray, Neimoidian Viceroy.
IsPulled: Nute Gunray, Neimoidian Viceroy

Lore: "And this!"
Gametext: If you are about to draw weapon destiny for Proton Torpedoes, instead draw 3 and choose 1. OR For rest of turn, add 2 to any attempt to 'blow away' Blockade Flagship. OR Take Proton Torpedoes or Bravo Fighter into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
Information: This is the best utility card if you think you need to clear the Blockade Starship form Naboo by blowing it away. This gets all the components you need (besides the Docking Bay), can add 2 to the blow-away attempt, and what's more, it's a 5! If you drew it with the torpedoes out, Take This! would blow him away!
Pulls: Bravo Fighter\par Proton Torpedoes\par Proton Torpedoes (EP1)
Combo: Take This! + Proton Torpedoes

Lore: Takeel, a burned-out Snivvian mercenary known as a double-crosser. Spice addicted. Frequents the Cantina looking for work, but has also turned lawbreakers over to the Empire.
Gametext: If both players just drew one battle destiny, use 1 Force to switch numbers.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par This Interrupt may be initiated only after all destiny draws are performed by both players. Thus, this action requires that both players draw exactly one battle destiny each. For all intents and purposes, the two destiny numbers trade places. Any further actions or modifiers which affect a player's destiny (e.g., Han's Dice) will affect that player's new number.

Gametext: Each player, if that player has a capital starship armed with a starship weapon in a battle, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise and, once per battle, may reduce the defense value of one opponent's capital starship present by 4 for remainder of the battle. At sites related to systems you occupy, your non-pilot warriors are deploy -1, defense value +2, and forfeit +1.
IsPulled: Admiral Ackbar

Lore: Heavily modified Headhunter. Operationally assigned to support Madine's commando team. Hyperdrive added to allow it to operate independently of capital starship support.
Gametext: May add 1 pilot. May be carried like a vehicle. Power and maneuver +2 at opponent's system (except battlegrounds) or at any sector. Immune to attrition < 4 when Colonel Cracken piloting.
IsPulled: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

Lore: Equipped with sophisticated sensor suite to monitor Imperial activity during Rebel commando operations. Hyperdrive allows long-range reconnaissance.
Gametext: May add 1 pilot. May be carried like a vehicle. When your spy aboard, opponent's spies and scouts are deploy +2 to related sites. Immune to attrition < 4 when Lieutenant Blount piloting.
IsPulled: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

Lore: Maneuver named after Adar Tallon, tactician of the Old Republic who revolutionized starfighter combat. Pursuing fighter rolls and turns, maintaining speed and target lock.
Gametext: Target two starfighters (your TIE/ln and any Rebel starfighter) present at same system or sector. Each player draws destiny. Opponent totals destiny and starship's power. You total destiny, TIE's power and TIE's maneuver. Lowest total loses starfighter.
Information: Combo Card: Dark Maneuvers & Tallon Roll\par -----\par TIE/ln are:\par \par Black 2\par Black 2 (V)\par Black 3\par Black 4\par Black 11\par Black Squadron TIE\par Obsidian 10\par Obsidian 7\par Obsidian 8\par Obsidian Squadron TIE\par OS-72-1 In Obsidian 1\par OS-72-2 In Obsidian 2\par Scythe 1\par Scythe 3\par Scythe Squadron TIE\par The Emperor's Shield\par The Emperor's Sword\par TIE Assault Squadron\par TIE Fighter
Combo: Tallon Roll + unique TIE/ln with matching pilot + Lateral Damage
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par (Errata) You may use this Interrupt to target an unpiloted Rebel starfighter. If both players have the same total, neither starfighter is lost.

Lore: \b Smuggler\b0  and \b information broker\b0. Operates intelligence network. Pragmatic businessman. Strong sense of personal honor. Bounty placed on his head by Grand Admiral Thrawn.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Once during each of your control phases, may peek at one card from opponent's hand or top card of opponent's Reserve Deck. At same location, your smugglers are each forfeit +2 and defense value +2.
IsPulled: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control).

Lore: Muftak is a typical male Talz from Alzoc III, a system enslaved by the Empire. A Talz's second pair of eyes provide excellent night vision. Muftak is a friend and protector of Kabe.
Gametext: May forfeit in place of any other character hit by a weapon at same site, restoring that character to normal. Any Talz is power +2 under "nighttime conditions."
IsPulled: Arleil Schous\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes\par Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere
Combo: Talz + Nightfall + 2X-3KPR
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par During the damage segment of a battle, you may forfeit this alien in place of a 'hit' character. This capability may be used even if Talz has been 'hit' (the forfeiture of Talz satisfies both 'hits'). Neither the Talz nor the original target is affected by any other results of the weapon, such as "forfeit = 0" or "may not be used to satisfy attrition."

Lore: A native of Esseles. Resigned from Esselian defense force after the Imperial Senate was disbanded. Senior deck officer of Echo Base responsible for docking bay operations.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Your starships may move from same exterior site for free. While at Echo Docking Bay, once every turn, may allow one character on Hoth to be immune to The Shield Doors Must Be Closed.
IsPulled: General Solo (V)

Lore: \b Gambler\b0. Lando Calrissian posed as a guard for Jabba in order to \b spy\b0  on the Hutt. Feared that he would be recognized by some of Jabba's companions.
Gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Once per game, Undercover may deploy on Tamtel from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. While at a site you control, Rebels are immune to None Shall Pass at that site.
Information: Lando Calrissian personas are:\par \par General Calrissian\par Lando Calrissian\par Lando Calrissian (V)\par Lando Calrissian, Scoundrel\par Lando Calrissian, Unlikely Hero (V)\par [Lando In Millennium Falcon]\par Lando With Blaster Pistol\par Lando With Vibro-Ax\par Tamtel Skreej\par \par Lando Calrissian (Dark Side)\par Lando Calrissian (V) (Dark Side)
Pulls: Undercover
IsPulled: Seeking An Audience\par Seeking An Audience (V)\par Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control).
Combo: Tamtel Skreej + Undercover + Double Agent
Matching: Gold Squadron 1\par Lando's Luxury Yacht (V)\par Millennium Falcon
MatchingWeapon: Lando's Blaster Rifle

Lore: AATs require officer battle droids to command them and relay orders from the Droid Control Ship. Programmed with sophisticated tank warfare tactics.
Gametext: Adds 3 to the power of any AAT he pilots. While piloting an AAT, forfeit +2, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise, and your other [Presence] droids at this site are immune to attrition < 4.
IsPulled: Admiral Piett\par Naboo: Theed Palace Hallway\par There They Are!
Combo: Tank Commander + Daultay Dofine\par -----\par Tank Commander + Armored Attack Tank\par Pulls two battle destinies, even if there are none of your other characters at the site.

Lore: Royal House of Alderaan consular ship. Used by Princess Leia for Imperial Senate business (and secret Rebel espionage). Captured by the \ul Devastator\ul0  over Tatooine.
Gametext: May be deployed even without presence or Force icons. May add 3 pilots and 4 passengers. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2.
Information: This is one of the true greats for the Light Side - and not just in a space deck. You can deploy the Tantive IV to any system (except Dagobah) - it's a spy ship. This means you can put it at the Death Star. It also has a massive forfeit which means it can take care of itself - as well as having ability of 2 and power of 5. This is an exceptional card, and one well worth trying to get hold of.\par -----\par On DS system Ralltiir Tantive IV is power +1.
IsPulled: Fly Casual

Lore: Royal House of Alderaan consular ship. Used by Princess Leia for Imperial Senate business (and secret Rebel espionage). Captured by the \ul Devastator\ul0  over Tatooine.
Gametext: May deploy without presence or Force icons. May add 3 pilots and 4 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Adds one [Light Side Force] icon here.
Information: On DS system Ralltiir Tantive IV is power +1.
IsPulled: Fly Casual

Lore: Male Elom. Former \b spy\b0  for the Rebellion. Hired by the Alliance to carry messages between Alderaan and the Rebel base on Yavin 4.
Gametext: When at a Yavin 4 site, adds 1 to your Force drains at Alderaan system for each Yavin 4 site you control. While at Audience Chamber, all your other Elom are power and forfeit +1.
Information: Tanus Spijek is a card that allows the Light Side an opportunity to use Alderaan for its own benefit. His text for the +1 Force drain bonus at the Alderaan system for each Yavin 4 site you control is simple to use because there are a decent amount of Light Side Yavin 4 sites, and most are without Dark Side icons, which serves two purposes. This allows the Light player to accumulate Force without supplying the Dark player with much and it keeps most Dark characters away. However, spies should not worry you.
IsPulled: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control).
Combo: Tanus Spijek + Double Agent\par -----\par Our Most Desperate Hour + Tatooine System + 3+ Ability Characters\par Since you're already playing the Alderaan system, why not use it to your advantage. Captain Han in the Falcon works well in pulling this one off, plus you can avoid all the nasty stuff down below by remaining in space and on Yavin 4. One of the easiest ways to retrieve Force.\par \par Death Star Docking Bay + Death Star Trash Compactor + Death Star Plans + A Droid\par Fairly simple to pull off since you're playing all the Yavin 4 sites. Simple cards like Tunnel Vision or Hiding In The Garbage will help you get those Death Star sites.\par \par Kessel System + Kessel Run + A Smuggler\par OK, I like to retrieve Force. A Force drain for three may be easier than usual because many Dark players are focused on capturing at sites with Bounty Hunters. Deploy another ship to the Alderaan system where Captain Han is hovering in the Falcon and send him to Kessel.\par \par Effective Repairs + Utinni Effects\par Not only does it cancel the annoying Limited Resources, but this card also allows you to retrieve any Utinni Effect into your hand, which is what all those precious Force retrieval cards just happen to be.\par \par Tanus Spijek doesn't actually play much of a part in the Force retrieval, but after reading his card I came up with all of this. The few card which his game text makes essential for a deck around him is so nicely complimented by the Force retrieval opportunities. This deck has already won a couple times for me and is a lot of fun to play. Your opponent begins to become angry the third or fourth time you've successfully retrieved your entire Lost Pile! If you're still worried about Dark Side spies popping up or other ways for the Dark player to infiltrate Yavin 4, a card like Houjix is excellent in case you get totally taken by surprise and majorly overpowered in a battle, but the deck is character-heavy and those high destinies on the Force retrieval cards will serve you well in firing weapons and battle destinies.

Gametext: During your control phase, fire your AT-AT Cannon (if within range of the Main Power Generators) as follows: \par \b Prepare To Target The Main Generator\b0: Draw destiny. \par \b Maximum Firepower!\b0: If (destiny + X + Y) > 8, Main Power Generators site is "blown away" and this card is lost. Otherwise this card is used. \par X = ability of one of AT-AT's pilots. \par Y = total Hoth sites you control.
Information: When trying to blow away the Hoth: Main Power Generator and an Electro-Rangefinder is deployed on the AT-AT Cannon, the Hoth: Main Power Generator can be blown away from an adjacent site.\par \par When the Hoth: Main Power Generator is blown away, there are no Force icons anymore. The normal rules for deployment apply - you need presence or force icons to deploy there (or a spy).\par \par When Imperial Decreee on table, the blown away site can be controlled as a Rebel Base location.\par -----\par Blizzard 1 adds 1 to total to Target The Main Generator when using AT-AT Cannon.

Lore: Specially designed for use on Rebel starfighters. Assists pilots on torpedo runs. Automatically locks on pre-programmed target points.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on any starship. Adds 1 to starship's maneuver. If this starship is using a weapon during a battle, you may fire that weapon twice, separately or combined. Subtract 1 from each destiny draw when firing.
IsPulled: Corporal Beezer\par Portable Scanner
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par Using this device to fire a weapon twice requires normal use of the Force for both firings. When firing separately, you may fire at the same target twice or at two different targets. When combined, add both destiny totals together against a single target.

Lore: Imperial Governor of the Seswenna Sector. Conceived and implemented the Death Star project. A \b leader\b0  in the effort to crush the Rebellion.
Information: Tarkin personas are:\par \par Tarkin\par Tarkin (V)\par Grand Moff Tarkin\par Grand Moff Tarkin (V)
IsPulled: The Empire's Back

Lore: Military version of a 'remote.' Programmed to stalk specific targets or secondary targets. Heat and light sensors track with fatal accuracy. Can stow away on starships.
Gametext: Deploys for 1 Force to an unoccupied site. Deploys and moves like an undercover spy. When present with Tarkin (or alien) of ability < 3, choose one to be immediately lost (treat as an "all cards" situation). Seeker is also lost.
Information: Attark:\par When at a site you control, allows your Seekers to deploy free there. Attark also allows your Seekers to move for free and to ignore any or all potential target(s) whenever you choose.
IsPulled: Portable Scanner\par Throw Me Another Charge
Combo: Tarkin Seeker + Attark

Information: Have you had enough of the old boring Tatooine system? Then check out this card. While the power bonuses from the old Tatooine may be useful sometimes, this version is more versatile. No matter what deck you have, whether it's Hidden Base, or Watch Your Step, or anything in between, if you upgrade to this Tatooine, it will provide you with benefits. Over the course of the game, you will be able to draw more Force since you won't have to spent any to move here. And against many Dark decks, your opponent will be handicapped by the battle destiny limitation.

Rules: Bluff Rules\par \par Bluff rules means that the Dark Side may place "bluff cards" (a card from hand) at the Tatooine: Bluffs site. Thus, Revolution, Expand The Empire, or canceling the\par game text of only one side of this site has no effect; the Light Side cannot bluff, and the Dark Side may not bluff at other sites.\par \par Once during each of your turns (at any time) you may place a bluff card face down under the Bluffs site. Each bluff card cumulatively adds 1 to your total Force drain at that site. During your deploy phase, your opponent can choose to flip over any of your bluff cards:\par If it is a character or vehicle, you may attempt to deploy it (deploy cost = 0) to the Bluffs using normal rules of deployment (obeying uniqueness, deployment restrictions [including having presence or Force icons], etc.).\par \par If it is not one of those cards, or you could not legally deploy it there, you lose 2 Force and the bluff card.

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par This non-unique location's game text prevents characters with landspeed less than 2 from moving away; however, it does not affect the movement of vehicles or other kinds of movement such as shuttling, landing and taking off. Characters with landspeed greater than 1 (e.g., Kal'Falnl C'ndros, Boba Fett) can move away from the desert, but the average character needs some kind of assistance. (For example, a vehicle could be deployed to rescue characters trapped in the desert, and some Interrupt cards temporarily add landspeed.)

Information: The first non-unique site, the Desert increases further the vast wasteland that is the Tatooine Desert. The vast nature of the desert can be used as an effective deterrent for the Dark side if he is attempting to reach Jabba's Palace or Obi-Wan's Hut from Mos Eisley. Also, 2 Deserts make for incredibly slow travel, and can be extremely annoying in conjunction with sites such as the Light Side Jundland Wastes.
IsPulled: Yarna d'al' Gargan (V)
Combo: 2 Deserts -- With two of these in hand, you can effectively trap a character at a site. This is especially nasty if you can trap Vader or someone similarly important at a relatively harmless site such as the Dune Sea or the Jawa Camp. They can also help in trapping someone at the Jawa Camp if you have dreams of free Jawas streaming from your hand to defeat the Imperial Army. Just make sure you have a Sandcrawler!

Information: Since the Dawn Of Time (or at least the Premiere release), Tatooine: Jundland Wastes has been the best starting location for the Dark Side in sealed deck competition. Now each Light Side player gets a chance to bounce that evil site back to the Dark Side player's Reserve Deck.\par \par The Light Side Jundland Wastes also gives a Force drain bonus when a Vaporator is played there. This provides a boost when combining with other cards often found in Premiere packs for sealed-deck competition.\par \par In constructed-deck play, this site becomes an effective weapon to fight a ground-based, Tatooine Force drain strategy. The ability to convert the site and capitalize on its own Force drain bonus lets the Light Side grab the initiative.
IsPulled: A Weakness Can Be Found\par Diplomatic Mission To Alderaan\par Mindful Of The Future\par Yarna d'al' Gargan (V)
Combo: Tatooine: Jundland Wastes + Vaporator + Owen Lars + Beru Lars + Hydroponic Station\par Let's total it up... for 5 Force and 5 cards, that's ability 4, power 4, forfeit 9 and a Force drain of 3 (and draw the first 2 Force activated directly into your hand). Not bad for a couple of middle-aged Rebels.\par -----\par Tatooine: Jundland Wastes + Vaporator + Luke Skywalker + Anakin's Lightsaber + Obi-Wan + Obi-Wan's Lightsaber + Lightsaber Proficiency + Chewbacca + Jedi Lightsaber\par A total ability of 12, power 14, forfeit 22 and a Force drain of 6! Talk about an Undercover spy magnet...

LightSideText: During your control phase, you may move free from here directly to Cantina (or vice versa).
Information: Tatooine: Mos Eisley is the cornerstone for a Tatooine ground Force drain deck. The key to this strategy is to stay away from the Dark Side ground forces while continuing to force drain. Eventually, an opportunity usually presents itself to make a crippling counter-attack. This site, when combined with Tatooine: Cantina, form a strong site combination.\par \par Of primary importance is the ability to move Light Side characters for free during the control phase. This affords the Light Side player a number of large strategic advantages. First, this provides excellent force generation and Force drain opportunities. That the Dark Side gains some force generation is somewhat negated by the fact that they will have to play a sufficient Force at both sites to force a battle. With the Tatooine: Mos Eisley game text, avoiding the Dark Side task force is free, while the Dark Side player must pay to chase from site to site. The Light Side player can keep her entire force strong and protected at one location and still Force drain at both sites. If the Dark Side has no presence at either site, and the Light Side has at least two characters deployed at one of the sites, just move one character to the second site, execute both Force drains, and then move the rest of the characters over. Keep in mind that this counts as their movement for the turn.\par To completely halt the force drains, the Dark Side will have to split her forces between the two sites. When it is advantageous, the Light Side player can use the free move in the control phase to move her whole Force over and attack immediately.\par \par Two types of cards will augment this deck greatly. First, the Light Side player must keep the Dark Side from deploying and immediately initiating a battle. Narrow Escape and Rebel Barrier can both help with this, and the A NEw Hope cards I Have a Very Bad Feeling About This and R2-D2 with a Fire Extinguisher work as well. If the battle does start, Houjix can keep the results from being crippling by eliminating force loss. Lightsabers and Lightsaber Proficiency increase the Force drain at the sites, also a key. Quite a Mercenary will keep the Dark Side from launching a surprise attack via Elis Helrot. Include multiple Tatooine: Mos Eisley to keep them from being reversed.\par \par Cards to watch out for: Dark Side Tatooine: Mos Eisley, Counter Assault.
IsPulled: A Weakness Can Be Found\par Diplomatic Mission To Alderaan\par Mindful Of The Future\par Yarna d'al' Gargan (V)
Combo: Tatooine: Mos Eisley + Tatooine: Cantina\par Keep the Dark Side troops away and Force drain while awaiting an opportune time to counter attack.\par -----\par If you're going to play with Tatooine sites, these are a must. Cantina is a 2/2 site and Mos Eisley lets you move to and from there for free during your control phase.\par So, stack your characters on one of those two sites to better withstand a battle, then on your control phase move some of them over to the other, drain at both, and then move the ones you didn't move yet to re-consolidate your forces.\par -----\par Tatooine: Mos Eisley + Spaceport Speeders\par Once you're there movement is free, so you don't need the speeder anymore. Why not sell it for 2 or 3 destiny worth of force?\par -----\par Fun Combo: Everybody likes bar games. Toss down a Holoboard and play a little Dejarik while throwing back a little Blue Milk in the Cantina.

Information: Circus Maximus. Indianapolis Motor Speedway. Tatooine: Podrace Arena. What do they have in common? SPEEEED! And what greater way to drive like a madman than podracing at the Podrace Arena?\par \par But if you want your deck to speed up on podracing, don't forget to pack Start Your Engines! and a Podracer to get a jump start. Sebulba's Podracer is a fan favorite, but don't preclude Teemto Pagalies' Podracer, which can race pretty well on its own too.\par \par Check out the Light Side version of the Podrace Arena for a few additional tips!

Information: Another location that isn't too spectacular for Force generation or Force draining, but it is absolutely essential for a Boonta Eve Podrace. Most likely, you will want to include Podrace Prep and Anakin's Podracer to get a boost for podracing.\par \par But don't forget the game text of the site. It is a great way to hide your weaker characters for the first few turns. You can deploy support characters such as Mirax Terrik or Leesub Sirln to help you manipulate your deck or do some direct damage to your opponent. Just watch out for local indigenous creatures like Bubo.
IsPulled: A Weakness Can Be Found\par Diplomatic Mission To Alderaan\par Mindful Of The Future\par Yarna d'al' Gargan (V)

Gametext: If you control, once per turn may exchange your top race destiny with top card of Lost Pile.   If you control, once per turn may exchange your top race destiny with top card of Lost Pile.
LightSideText: If you control, once per turn may exchange your top race destiny with top card of Lost Pile.
DarkSideText: If you control, once per turn may exchange your top race destiny with top card of Lost Pile.
Information: Not the greatest of locations judging by the Force icons, but looks are deceiving as they say. If you are heavily into podracing, this site can be a great boon. As long as you control the site, you can swap a card once every turn at just about anytime. So, now you can purposely lose high destiny cards and switch them as soon as you lose it.\par \par But to get better use of this site, you should use Entering The Arena. Not only will the interrupt fetch the site, it will help you keep the site clear of any opposing forces. Also, since Entering The Arena has high destiny, it would be ideal to swap it with the top race destiny to ensure that you win the race.
IsPulled: A Weakness Can Be Found\par Diplomatic Mission To Alderaan\par Entering The Arena\par Mindful Of The Future\par Yarna d'al' Gargan (V)
Combo: Tatooine: Podracer Bay + Entering The Arena\par Add one battle destiny during battle

Gametext: Once per game may deploy Shmi here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.   If Watto present, Force drain +1 here.
LightSideText: Once per game may deploy Shmi here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
DarkSideText: If Watto present, Force drain +1 here.
Information: Cool! Another 2/0 site like Obi-Wan's Hut for Tatooine! With "Shmi's Hut" you can get her out to quickly set up for Threepio With His Parts Showing. Although both characters are not very strong, their strength lies in their game text.\par \par One good use of another 0 Dark Side Force icon location is to set up Tatooine so that you can control where the actions take place. By placing locations in a certain order, you can make Tatooine into a rat trap for the Dark Side. You can put one battleground in between the Slave Quarters and Obi-Wan's Hut. Doing so will force the opponent to deploy to the middle and if they try to escape, you can nab them at either non-battleground with less fear of a counterattack. Another way is to put both Slave Quarters and Obi-Wan's Hut together to create a partial haven for utility characters (e.g., Figrin D'an or Oola).
Pulls: Shmi Skywalker

Gametext: You generate +X Force here, where X = power of your highest forfeit character here.   If you occupy, opponent's Tosche Station game text is canceled.
LightSideText: You generate +X Force here, where X = power of your highest forfeit character here.
DarkSideText: If you occupy, opponent's Tosche Station game text is canceled.
IsPulled: Diplomatic Mission To Alderaan\par A Weakness Can Be Found\par Mindful Of The Future\par Yarna d'al' Gargan (V)

Gametext: If you control, Force drain +1 here (+2 if a Gaderffii Stick present).
DarkSideText: If you control, Force drain +1 here (+2 if a Gaderffii Stick present).
Information: Expanding on the already-sprawling planet of Tatooine, Tusken Canyon helps a Sealed Deck game in a number of ways, as well as opening up interesting options in standard Swiss play.\par \par First, in Sealed Deck, the Gaderffii Stick is now a card to be reckoned with, giving a drain of three at a site. It also expands on the capabilities of Tusken Raiders in Sealed Deck.\par \par In a non-Sealed Deck game, this site provides an additional Force drain location, while not giving your opponent too much Force. Combined with a Trooper strategy, Tusken Raiders can be fearsome, giving an immense amount of power in 4 characters. Add in a few Gaderffii Sticks to increase this site's Force drain and make this group even deadlier.
IsPulled: Imperial Entanglements\par Neimoidian Advisor
Combo: Tatooine: Tusken Canyon + Tusken Raiders + Gaderffii Sticks + Darth Vader + Vader's Lightsaber\par This is a powerful combination. With four Raiders plus Vader, you have 16 power and a destiny draw, as well as a swipe with the Lightsaber. If your opponent threatens to kill Vader or one of the Raiders, simply knock away his weapon as quickly as possible. Add in Snipers to take care of Undercover spies, and you have a fairly stable Force drain.

Gametext: While Watto here, you may not draw battle destiny here.   Once per game, may deploy Watto here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Watto deploys -2 here.
LightSideText: While Watto here, you may not draw battle destiny here.
DarkSideText: Once per game, may deploy Watto here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Watto deploys -2 here.
