Lore: First native creature found on Hoth. Roam the icy plans in herds. Ill-tempered and easily spooked. Smell bad on the outside. Trained as steeds for Rebel patrols.
Gametext: May add 1 'rider' (passenger). Deploy only on Hoth. Ability = 1/4. May move as a 'react' from a battle. May be 'sacrificed' (lost) to make rider immune to Exposure this turn.

Lore: The bones of a tauntaun represent both death and life: death for the prey, life for the predator. A symbol of the ebb and flow of the Force through all things.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on table. Each opponent's destiny draw, you do the following: (0) Put top used card in hand; (1) lose 1 Force. (2) activate 1 Force; (3) lose this Effect; (4) retrieve 1 Force; (5) deploy a character for free; (6+) nothing.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once

Lore: Corman Quien is a typical \b scout\b0  at Echo Base. Captured, tamed and trained the native tauntauns.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of any creature vehicle he rides. When riding a tauntaun, also draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
IsPulled: General Crix Madine\par Mon Mothma\par Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

Lore: Bones strewn around the cave lair of the wampa are proof of the beast's prowess.
Gametext: During a battle or attack, place out of play one non-droid character, creature or creature vehicle from your Lost Pile. Add its destiny number to your total power. OR Take one Stop Motion or Yaggle Gakkle into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
Pulls: Stop Motion\par Yaggle Gakkle

Lore: Female Nimbanel fortune teller. Roams the wastes of Tatooine. Trained in the ways of a Sakiyan hunter. Now tracks them for the Alliance. Risk-taker.
Gametext: If you just initiated a battle where present, predicts the winner. If correct, randomly retrieve 1 Force. If incorrect, lose 1 Force. Power +3 when present with opponent's alien of ability > 3. Immune to attrition < 3.

Lore: Instigator of several Sand People raids on Tatooine. Keeps the Tusken Raiders well supplied so they can keep local authorities distracted from Jabba's activities.
Gametext: When on Tatooine, may cancel any result of Krayt Dragon Bones. While at Audience Chamber, all your Tusken Raiders are power = 3 and forfeit +2.
IsPulled: Bantha Fodder
Combo: Taym Dren-garen + Krayt Dragon Bones
Cancels: Any result of Krayt Dragon Bones when on Tatooine.

Lore: Trade Federation-owned protocol droid used by the Neimoidians to distract the Jedi until a plan could be conceived to deal with them.
Gametext: Opponent's Jedi using landspeed from here require +2 Force. During any control phase may place TC-14 out of play to target one opponent's Jedi present. Target Jedi loses all immunity to attrition and is power = 0 for remainder of turn.
Information: With the introduction of so many new Light Side Jedi, the Dark Side needs everything it can muster to deal with these powerful characters. TC-14 makes things tough on them in a couple of different ways, and should join IG-88, 4-LOM, U-3P0 and the new Destroyers as one of the most versatile droids in the Dark side arsenal.\par \par Most of the Jedi choose to stay within the comfy confines of the Council Chamber where they are best able to use their game text. You can still expect to see others, like Mace and Ki-Adi-Mundi, join the ranks of the existing heavy hitters (like Luke, Obi, and Qui-Gon) on the front lines of battle in cameo support roles.\par \par When TC-14 joins your forces against one or more Jedi, your opponent will be faced with two choices when it is their turn. Stay, and put their strong Force-wielding hero at risk, or run away (at a cost of 3 Force each). If they decide to stick it out, TC-14 can be sacrificed (during EITHER player's control phase) to make the Jedi of your choice vulnerable and weak.\par \par The ability to turn Jedi Luke from an 8 to a 0, where even a destiny draw of 1 can take him out, is well worth TC-14's life.
Combo: TC-14 + 4-LOM With Concussion Rifle\par -----\par TC-14 + E Chu Ta\par Cancel game text of an opponent's character present without sacrificing TC-14.\par -----\par TC-14 + Oh, Switch Off

Lore: Male Bith \b musician\b0. Plays Ommni Box in Figrin D'an's band. Lost ownership of instrument to Figrin while gambling.
Gametext: After using Ommni Box, peek at top X cards of pile or deck just shuffled, where X = number of other musicians at same site. May re-shuffle without peeking.
IsPulled: Ak-rev

Lore: Male Bith \b musician\b0. Member in good standing of the Intergalactic Federation of Musicians. Plays the Fanfar in Figrin D'an's band. Once worked for the Empire as a \b scout\b0.
Gametext: For each other musician at same site, during any control phase you may use 1 Force to choose one opponent's alien present. That alien cannot utilize its game text for remainder of that turn.
IsPulled: General Crix Madine\par Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control).

Lore: Ewok watcher of the stars. \b Musician\b0  and poet at heart. Wears a horned Gurreck skull decorated with Churi feathers. Carries a stone hatchet. Student of Logray.
Gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each (Light Side Force icon) at same Endor site. While on Endor, adds 1 (or 2 if present with Logray) to forfeit of each of your Ewoks at Endor sites.

Lore: IPG-X1131 Longtail Podracer. Unusual circular shape is designed around an internal metal cycling ring which stabilizes the non-aerodynamic vehicle.
Gametext: Deploy on Podrace Arena. Adds 2 to each of your race destinies here. Once during each of your turns, may use 1 Force to place a race destiny here (random selection) in owner's Used Pile, draw one race destiny and place it here.

Characteristics: \b Black Sun agent\b0, \b information broker\b0, \b leader\b0
Lore: \b Leader\b0  of Tatooine's Street Performers And Panhandler's Guild. Televan can survive on almost nothing, and he keeps tight controls on other Guild members. \b Information broker\b0.
Gametext: Beggar and Frozen Assets are canceled. Your thieves, gamblers, and information brokers at related Tatooine sites are power +1. While at Cantina, Mos Espa, or Marketplace, may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
IsPulled: Murttoc Yine
Cancels: Beggar\par Frozen Assets

Lore: Command vehicle for Commander Igar. Uses an adapted TIE targeting system to combat maneuverable T-47s. Utilized in the subjugation of Kashyyyk. \b Enclosed\b0.
Gametext: May add 1 pilot and 8 passengers. Immune to attrition < 4. Landspeed may not be increased. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Each of its weapon destiny draws is +1.
Information: Imperials and combat vehicles are deploy -1 at Hoth: Mountains.
IsPulled: Battle Deployment\par Walker Garrison
Combo: Tempest 1 + Trample

Lore: Manufactured by Kuat Drive Yards under the close supervision of the Empire. Often used in conjunction with AT-ATs in an anti-personnel role. \b Enclosed\b0.
Gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. May move as a 'react' for 1 additional Force. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Your Elite Squadron stormtroopers are deploy -1 to same site.
Information: AT-STs not only give you a little more power compared to the Speeder Bike, but also gives you protection from the pesky lightsabers and permanent weapons. While you lose out on the immunity to attrition, the ability to react is still there, and along with some AT-ST pilots, can become a well rounded addition to any serious exterior ground deck.
IsPulled: Aratech Corporation (V)\par Battle Deployment
Combo: Tempest Scout + Trample

Lore: \b Enclosed\b0  AT-ST assigned as first response to incidents at Endor control bunker. Piloted by Lieutenant Arnet.
Gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers. May move as a 'react' for free. When Arnet piloting, immune to attrition < 4 and adds 1 to attrition against opponent here.
IsPulled: Aratech Corporation (V)\par Battle Deployment
Combo: Tempest Scout 1 (piloted) + Trample

Lore: AT-ST assigned to coordinate battle activities with the Endor biker scout detachment. \b Enclosed\b0. First saw battle in Kashyyyk forests.
Gametext: Deploy -1 to Endor. May add 2 pilots or passengers. May move as a 'react'. Immune to attrition < 3 when Marquand piloting. Your scouts may move here as a 'react.'
IsPulled: Aratech Corporation (V)\par Battle Deployment
Combo: Tempest Scout 2 + Lt. Watts + Major Marquand\par Power 8, draws two battle destiny, +2 to weapon destiny of vehicle weapon aboard, immune to attrition < 6 and can move as a react.\par -----\par Tempest Scout 2 (piloted) + Trample

Lore: \b Enclosed\b0. Assigned to the task of searching for potential Rebel traps. Modified to help cover more territory to accomplish this task.
Gametext: May deploy or move as a 'react' to a forest or Endor site. May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2.
IsPulled: Aratech Corporation (V)\par Battle Deployment
Combo: Tempest Scout 3 + Trample

Lore: \b Enclosed\b0  vehicle. Equipped with a prototype targeting computer. Maintains accuracy even in dense foliage. Energy diverted from propulsion to weapons systems.
Gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. AT-ST Dual Cannon deploys free aboard and may target at an adjacent site.
Information: Welcome to Billy-Bobs Imperial Vehicle Lot! Here's a nice model for the safer driver. If firepower is your aim, and you don't need to get there in a hurry, then Tempest Scout 4 (we like to call it The Volvo) is the Scout for you. It is the only power 4 Scout, and it comes with a permanent pilot all for deploy 3. And there's still room aboard for one more pilot. Why don'y you squeeze on in there and try her on for size! Add to that the fact that it is higher destiny than any other Tempest (equal to Blizzard Scout 1) and it is looking like the vehicle of choice for your Forest Moon!
IsPulled: Aratech Corporation (V)\par Battle Deployment
Combo: Tempest Scout 4 + AT-ST Dual Cannon + Imperial Gunner\par Enclosed vehicle with a free deploying, repeat firing +2 weapon that can shoot from an adjacent site.\par -----\par Tempest Scout 4 + Trample

Lore: Uses experimental command and control software to coordinate combat data. \b Enclosed\b0.
Gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. May move as a 'react.' Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Adds 1 to your total power in battle at same site for each of your other piloted combat vehicles present.
IsPulled: Aratech Corporation (V)\par Battle Deployment
Combo: Tempest Scout 5 + Trample

Lore: \b Enclosed\b0. Modified for perimeter patrol. Elite crew trained for many months over heavily forested terrain.
Gametext: May deploy -2 as a 'react.' May move as a 'react' for free. Permanent pilots provide total ability of 2.
IsPulled: Aratech Corporation (V)\par Battle Deployment
Combo: Tempest Scout 6 + Trample

Lore: Sullustan \b gunner\b0. Pilot of Blue 5. Ordered to head a B-wing attack against Imperial command ships at the Battle Of Endor.
Gametext: Deploys -2 aboard Blue Squadron 5. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Adds 2 to total weapon destiny of any B-wing he pilots.

Lore: Ithorian \b senator\b0. Called on by his people to represent them in the Senate, even though his heart is not in politics. Voted against the taxation of trade routes.
Gametext: \b Agendas\b0 : justice, peace. While in a senate majority, if you have at least one card in hand, once during your control phase may place your hand in Used Pile to draw up to four cards from Reserve Deck.
Information: One of the bad things about Senators is that they tend to have low power when they're called upon to fight outside of the Senate. Not so with Tendau Bendon! This little Ithorian Senator is handy both in the political arena and in the knock-down, drag-out brawl of the SWCCG universe at large. With 3 power and 4 forfeit for only 2 Force, he's a bargain anywhere.\par \par But lots of Light Side characters have similar stats, and Bendon's Politics is a less-than-impressive 2. So why use him? Because he's a walking Reactor Terminal, that's why! While Bendon's in a senate majority, you can place your hand - no matter how large - in your Used Pile to draw up to four cards from your Reserve Deck. If you need a new hand, need to reduce your hand size, or just need to increase your differential to top off a tournament win, Tendau Bendon is your man.\par \par He's also an integral part of any "Senate Invasion Package," along with Valorum, Amidala, and other Senators who can fight both inside and outside of the Senate. Once an opponent's political dreams are dashed, Bendon is a handy way to keep recycling any duplicate Senators you may have back into your deck while constantly drawing new resources. New cards, extra Life Force, Politics and power?
IsPulled: Might Of The Republic
Combo: Tendau Bendon + Plea To The Court\par Cancel a Force drain and protect your characters from weapons!\par -----\par Tendau Bendon + Yoda Stew\par The perfect late-game combo. Stew on his turn to place 4 you want in Force Pile. Bendon on your control phase to move the rest of your hand into Used. Now you are good shape "differentially", and you can draw back the 1-4 you actually want!

Lore: Dianogas use their seven tentacles for both locomotion and catching food. The few survivors of such attacks claim that a dianoga tentacle has the strength of a hydro-clamp.
Gametext: If opponent just played an Interrupt, use 1 Force to deploy on table. That Interrupt is played out but is then 'grabbed' (played here but is out of play). Any new Interrupts of the same name are unique (*). (Immune to Control.)
Information: Dark Side grabbers are:\par \par Allegations Of Corruption\par Allegations Of Corruption - Defensive Shield\par Do They Have A Code Clearance? - Defensive Shield\par Do They Have A Code Clearance?\par Something Special Planned For Them (V)\par Tentacle\par There'll Be Hell To Pay
IsPulled: Fanfare\par Fanfare - Defensive Shield\par Fanfare (V) - Defensive Shield\par I'll Take Them Myself (V)\par Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par See Grappling Hook.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-7)\par Grappling Hook\par Once this Immediate Effect has its result, it causes new copies of the targeted Interrupt to be unique (*) for both players. Because that Interrupt is now limited to one per turn, no additional cards with the same name may be played this turn.

Lore: Quarren accountant. Embezzling from Jabba. \b Leader\b0. Escaped Mon Calamari after its subjugation by the Empire. Plotting to kill Jabba and free the Hutt's captives.
Gametext: Whenever your opponent deploys a character of destiny 1, you may activate 1 Force. While at Audience Chamber, adds 1 to your Force drains where you have a non-unique alien and all your non-unique aliens are deploy -1.
Information: Tessek's game text is very useful in that, over time, he pays for himself. Chances are your opponent is going to play as many as three or four 1-destiny characters. After 3, he's paid for himself, and you begin to bring a profit from his text. His ability to add to Force drains as well as reduce deploy costs can be extremely helpful, especially if you spread out across multiple planets. Most decks aren't prepared to handle a battle on many fronts, unless they use Elis Helrot. With Quite A Mercenary, you can nail quite a few characters. Make sure you have a weapon to fool him into thinking you're saving the Force for something else, though, or have All Wrapped Up on the table.
IsPulled: Princess Organa\par Yarna d'al' Gargan (V)

Lore: Neimoidian Trade Federation communications officer to Nute Gunray. Had audio and visual mechanics surgically implanted to assist her in shipboard operations.
Gametext: Adds 2 to the power of anything she pilots. While aboard a battleship, whenever you must lose Force from a Force drain at a system within 2 parsecs of How, may use X Force to reduce the loss by X.
Information: Tey How is a great support character to use in any Dark Side deck that dreads putting anything space. She allows you to essentially "block" drains much like Harc Seff (from the Special Edition set) does at sites so you will not need to deal with it. The easiest thing to do is place Tey How aboard a battleship and then make sure that starship has plenty of support. With her at any parsec 6 system, such as Kashyyyk which is a great drain location, you will be able to stop drains anywhere from Kessel to Corulag!
IsPulled: Blockade Flagship\par Lord Sidious\par The Phantom Menace

Lore: Reference to "One Who Creates;" used by droids in an almost-religious way. C-3PO used phrase upon getting a much-needed cleansing oil bath.
Gametext: Use 1 Force during opponent's control phase if you have a droid on the table and were drained of at least 5 Force. Draw destiny. That number of cards are randomly selected and retrieved from your Lost Pile.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par The phrase "drained of at least 5 Force" on this Interrupt means that you lost a total of 5 or more Force during the same control phase as a result of one or more Force drains.
IsCanceledBy: Shut Him Up Or Shut Him Down

Gametext: Deploy on Reactor Core. Death Star II may move (hyperspeed = 3). While Death Star II orbits a system you occupy (except Endor), once during each of your control phases, opponent loses X Force, where X = 2 plus number of related battleground sites you occupy. Once during each of opponent's control phases, opponent's piloted starfighter here may attempt to "blow away" Death Star II. Draw destiny. Add 3 if armed with torpedoes or missiles. Add pilot's ability. If total destiny > 8, starships here may attempt to 'escape' and Death Star II is "blown away" (lose double Force).
IsPulled: Death Star II: Reactor Core

CardName: That's It, The Rebels Are There!
Lore: "That is the system and I'm sure Skywalker is with them."
Gametext: If you have a probe droid at a site during your control phase, move one of your starships to the related system. That starship cannot move again this turn.
Information: Probe droids are:\par \par Probe Droid\par Sith Probe Droid\par Sith Probe Droid (V)

Lore: Considering the life debt he owed to Han and his personal commitment to the Rebel Alliance, Chewie quickly volunteered to fly the stolen shuttle to Endor.
Gametext: Deploy on Chewie. He is immune to attrition < 4 at exterior sites. Visored Vision is immune to Sense. While at same battleground site as Han, Chewie adds 1 to each of his weapon destiny draws and Life Debt is a Used Interrupt during a battle there.
IsPulled: I Wonder Who They Found\par The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Wokling (V)\par Your Insight Serves You Well\par Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par This Effect adds to Chewie's weapon destiny draws (not Han's).

Lore: Figrin D'an and the Modal Nodes play at the Cantina with a distinctive rocking motion. When Luke arrived, they were playing one of their favorite songs, "Mad About Me."
Gametext: Shuffle any player's Reserve Deck or Lost Pile or Used Pile.
Information: Combo Card: The Bith Shuffle & Desperate Reach

Gametext: Shuffle any player's Reserve Deck or Used Pile. OR During your move phase, relocate one of your characters (unless Disarmed) from Weather Vane to any Cloud City site. Character may not move for remainder of turn. OR Cancel Imperial Barrier or The Shield Doors Must Be Closed.
Cancels: Imperial Barrier\par The Shield Doors Must Be Closed

Lore: An isolated camp protected by Obi-Wan and Captain Panaka was established at the Queen's starship while Qui-Gon searched for a way to repair the leaking hyperdrive.
Gametext: Deploy on table. Each non-battleground docking bay generates no more than one Force for either player. Opponent's aliens deploy +1 on Tatooine (or +2 if non-unique or to same Tatooine site as your Jedi, or +4 if both). (Immune to Alter.)
Information: Startable with Heading For The Medical Frigate.\par -----\par First, while you have The Camp out, your opponent will be less likely to activate a high amount of Force on turn 2 like in the past. No more camping at non-battleground docking bays with some cheap characters using the Imperial Arrest Order + Mobilization Points combo. If they want to, they must pay the price... occupy or control a battleground docking bay instead. Some will say that this will hurt decks like Ralltiir Operations, but that deck worked fine without that combo, and note that it affects both players. This card puts the "Wars" back in Star Wars. :)\par \par Second, this card mitigates the bonuses the Dark Side reaps with Scum And Villany. Alien base decks can still be popular but they won't get the nearly free deploy that they used to get. Most aliens will end up costing what is printed on the card, but they should stay far away from the Jedi since that is Maul's and Vader's department.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par The deploy modifiers listed within brackets all apply to your opponent's aliens when they are deploying to Tatooine only.

Lore: Vader and Obi-Wan Kenobi fought a final lightsaber duel near Hangar Bay 327 on the Death Star. "When I left you I was but the learner; now I am the master."
Gametext: If Vader and Obi-Wan are present at same site, use 1 Force to initiate a duel between them. Compare their power, and add 2 if that character is armed with a lightsaber. Loser (lowest total) of duel is placed out of play.
Combo: The Circle Is Now Complete + Lord Vader + any lightsaber\par No destiny draw, bye-bye any power 6 Obi Wan (Team Stephenville favorite) (Lord Helmet)

Lore: "If once you start down the dark path, forever will it dominate your destiny. Consume you it will, as it did Obi-Wan's apprentice."
Gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Once per turn, you may peek at the top three cards of your Reserve Deck. Place any two of those three in your Lost Pile.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

CardName: The Deflector Shield Is Too Strong
Gametext: Landed starfighters and vehicles aboard starships are forfeit = 0. Once during your control phase may target your droid starfighter and opponent's starfighter present at same system. Both players draw destiny. You add your starfighter's power and maneuver. Opponent adds starfighter's power. Starship with lowest total is lost.
Information: Battle Deployment\par Black Sun Fleet\par Fighter Cover\par Fighters Coming In\par Intensify The Forward Batteries\par Nothing Can Get Through Our Shield\par The Deflector Shield Is Too Strong\par We're In Attack Position Now
IsPulled: Admiral Piett

Lore: Lightsaber confrontations are a complex dance of feints, strikes, parries, and footwork. Mistakes are rarely forgiven.
Gametext: Activate 1 Force. OR Add 1 to your just-drawn duel destiny. OR If under your Dark Jedi as one of that character's combat cards, reveal to opponent and place in your Lost Pile to cancel an opponent's Force drain. (Immune to Sense.)
Cancels: An opponent's Force drain

Lore: \b Leader\b0. Secretive manipulator of the galaxy. Played Darth Vader and Prince Xizor off against one another in his relentless pursuit of 'young Skywalker.'
Gametext: Deploys only to Coruscant or Death Star II. Never moves to a site occupied by opponent (even if carried). If Vader or Xizor here, and Luke is not on table, adds 2 to attrition against opponent at other locations. Immune to attrition.
Information: Emperor Palpatine personas are:\par \par Emperor Palpatine\par Emperor Palpatine, Forseer\par The Emperor
IsPulled: According To My Design (V)\par Sith Fury (V)
Combo: The Emperor + I Have You Now\par Add one battle destiny (two if Rebel is Luke) if a Dark Jedi and a Rebel with ability > 2 are involved in the same battle.\par -----\par The Emperor + Force Field\par Cancels an attempt to target a Dark Jedi with a character weapon.\par -----\par The Emperor + Janus Greejatus\par -----\par The Emperor + Overseeing It Personally
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, D-4)\par Personas - Palpatine, Sidious, And The Emperor \par While in the saga of Star Wars we learn that the Emperor, Senator Palpatine, and Darth Sidious are one in the same, for game purposes they are treated as three distinct people. They will be referred to as Emperor, Palpatine, and Sidious, respectively.

Lore: Vader thought that by capturing Luke, he would crush the Alliance's last hope. But, there was another...
Gametext: If Luke was just 'frozen,' deploy on Emperor or Detention Block Corridor. Target Luke and Vader. When reached by targets, place Utinni Effect on Luke and opponent must lose half of Life Force (round down). If Luke released, lose Utinni Effect. (Immune to Alter.)
Information: When a slam-bang card like The Emperor's Prize comes along, jaws drop. It will hack off half your opponent's Force, unless it takes you so long to pull it off that there's not much left. So speed it up. You'll find the cards you need to inflict massive damage in most Bounty or Carbon Freezing decks.\par \par First, get Docking Bay Control Room into play. It lets you spit out every Docking Bay in your deck, including those for Cloud City and the Death Star.\par \par Starting with the Detention Block Corridor or Carbonite Chamber is good too.\par \par Second, weasel your opponent into playing Luke. Play Mii'yoom Onith and conveniently forget to use her for a couple of turns. See if your opponent puts Luke out. Or start early with a Scanning Crew philosophy, and see if that brings Luke out to play. When Luke is on the table, the number one rule is: don't kill him unless you have a We Have A Prisoner in your hand. You can afford to take some losses in this effort, you'll be doing a whole lot more later on.\par \par Third, get Luke frozen. Whether this means jacking up a Force drain at the Carbonite Chamber, and then pushing him in with All Too Easy, or going the long route and capturing him, and then Carbon Freezing him, Luke has to be frozen.\par \par Fourth, and this is what you have to stock up for, put out the Prize, and make sure it and the frozen Luke are well protected. Make sure you have a steady stream of characters escorting Luke so that he's never alone. He'll be frozen for the rest of the game, but you don't want your opponent piling up with him. You'll also want to keep pesky rebels out of the Detention Block Corridor. This will make your life a whole lot easier.\par \par This card's problem is actually getting Luke to the Detention Block Corridor after he's Frozen. There just isn't too much mobility in the game for interior sites, except for the card that could save your life. Lift Tube is a Premiere common that rarely sees use, but, if your plans are centered around the two systems with mobile sites, Lift Tubes can be invaluable. It can carry four passengers, more than enough for Luke and some protection, and, since both docking bays are Mobile sites, it can move through the Docking Bay, although you shouldn't need it on the Death Star.\par \par After that, you're set. Half of your opponent's Life Force is gone, and you'll have a nice little force with which to Force drain. It seems like a very hefty task, and it will probably take up most of your time simply trying to pull it off. Once you do, however, you notice quickly that is was all worthwile.
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
Combo: The Emperor's Prize + Vader's Bounty\par Not only do you deal massive amounts of damage, but you also retrieve a hefty amount of Force as well. As long as Vader is nearby, which he should be if you want to keep Luke unharmed, you can regain a lot of the loss that you'll take in setting up this combination.

Lore: Top outer rim pilots hand picked by Admiral Thrawn. Sent to protect the Emperor during his inspection of the second Death Star.
Gametext: Deploys -2 to Endor, Death Star II or same location as Thrawn. May deploy as a 'react.' Permanent pilots provide total ability of 3. Power +3 at Endor or when Emperor is at same or related location.
Information: TIE/lns are forfeit +2 at same location as Vengeance.\par -----\par SFS L-s7.2 TIE Cannon may deploy on one of this TIE's. That squadron is composed of three TIE/ln's, so you may deploy and fire up to three appropriate weapons on there.\par Just to be clear, the reason why this works is because this weapon deploys on a "TIE". If it deployed on a "starfighter" it would not work; a TIE squadron is 3 TIEs but it is not a starfighter, it is a squadron.\par \par See "starship - squadron class" in the rules docs for more information.

Lore: Elite pilots sworn to defend the Emperor to the death. Assigned older TIEs due to their years of experience with them. Stationed at Coruscant but always travel with the Emperor.
Gametext: Deploys -2 to Coruscant or Death Star II. May deploy as a 'react.' Permanent pilots provide total ability of 3. Power +3 at Coruscant or when Emperor is at same or related location.
Information: TIE/lns are forfeit +2 at same location as Vengeance.\par -----\par SFS L-s7.2 TIE Cannon may deploy on one of this TIE's. That squadron is composed of three TIE/ln's, so you may deploy and fire up to three appropriate weapons on there.\par Just to be clear, the reason why this works is because this weapon deploys on a "TIE". If it deployed on a "starfighter" it would not work; a TIE squadron is 3 TIEs but it is not a starfighter, it is a squadron.\par \par See "starship - squadron class" in the rules docs for more information.

Gametext: If Vader, Tarkin, Motti or Tagge is lost, use 2 Force to retrieve one of them from the Lost Pile. OR Use 4 Force to search through your Reserve Deck and take Vader, Tarkin, Motti, or Tagge into your hand. Shuffle deck, cut and replace.

Lore: "When you've gotten past the energy shield, proceed directly to the rendezvouz point. Understood? Good luck!"
Gametext: Deploy on any system (except Hoth). Target a Medium Transport at a Hoth site. When reached by target: Retrieve X Force, where X = twice the number of passengers. Relocate Utinni Effect to Hoth system. Your total power is +2 in battles at Hoth sites.

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par Once this Utinni Effect has been used to retrieve Force, it remains in play only as a marker for the Hoth site power bonus. It may not be used to retrieve Force again.
IsCanceledBy: Our First Catch Of The Day

CardName: The Force Is Strong With This One
Lore: Luke's piloting skills and Force abilities made his X-wing a difficult target for Darth Vader as they raced down the Death Star trench.
Gametext: If Luke and an Imperial with ability > 2 are involved in the same battle, you may add one battle destiny (add two destiny if Imperial is Vader).
IsPulled: Twilight Is Upon Me

Lore: "The Naboo system has been invaded by the droid armies of the Trade Federation."
Gametext: Deploy on table. If no senator here, you may place a senator here from hand to add 3 to a battle destiny just drawn. If a \b taxation agenda\b0  here, during your turn may place any one card from hand on Used Pile; opponent must use 1 Force or lose 1 Force.
Information: This Political Effect is one that helps your Senators Deck overcome a low battle destiny draw. What's more, it is one of the few ways to adjust a battle destiny draw AFTER it is actually drawn, thus giving you maximum flexibility to determine the best outcome.\par \par If you can drop someone with a taxation agenda here (Horox Ryyder or Yarua), then on your turn you can recycle a card to force your opponent to use 1 or lose 1 (opponent's choice). That's a nasty way to remind the Dark player to save some Force during your turn or pay the penalty.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once\par Sanity And Compassion
Combo: The Gravest of Circumstances + Sanity And Compassion + draw Horoxx Ryyder\par Horox is a destiny 3, +3 for a flipped Senators objective, +3 if you can drop a senator from hand on the Political Effect. Congratulations, you just drew a 9 for destiny.\par -----\par The Gravest of Circumstances + Taxation Agenda there + I Did It!\par Your Senators/Podracing deck is now a nasty inflicting direct damage/choke combo. The opponent's choices are basically: lose 2 on his turn, use 1 on your turn OR save no Force on his turn and lose 1 on your turn. (Joh) Yowza!\par -----\par Anecdote: All effects and the objective were playtested initially, and then the agenda's and secondary texts were added later for the second phase of playtest. Political Effects only became "Political Effects" at this time.

Information: Luke(s) with Death Star II icon are:\par \par Luke Skywalker, Jedi Knight\par Luke Skywalker, Rebel Scout\par Luke Skywalker, Rebel Scout (V)\par -----\par ASP-707 (Ayesspee)  can be used in conjunction with the destiny-7 Ewok Catapault and I Can Save Him (flip side of There Is Good In Him) to automatically win the game if you have 3 cards stacked on I Feel the Conflict. Once you have those cards stacked, activate your entire Reserve Deck, use ASP-707 in your control phase to make the Ewok Catapult the only card in your reserve deck and then draw it to win the game. (Psychobabble)
Combo: I Can Save Him + ASP-707 (Ayesspee) + Ewok Catapult + 3 cards stacked on I Feel The Conflict (Psychobabble)\par
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par The capture action targeting Luke on the destiny 0 side of this Objective card may only be initiated if Luke can be seized by an Imperial. This is a specific exception to the normal capturing rules.

Lore: "That name no longer has any meaning..."
Gametext: USED: If your Imperial of ability > 2 just won a battle, randomly take into hand one card stacked on I Feel The Conflict. (Immune to Sense.) LOST: If Vader in battle, subtract 2 from each of opponent's battle destiny draws.
Information: Luke: "Your thoughts betray you, Father. I feel the good in you... the conflict."\par Vader: "There is no conflict."\par \par Gotta love cards that you can play during a game as if you were quoting from the movie! Like in the movie, you will also get to respond to the Light Side's "I Feel The Conflict" and take back a card to prevent Vader from becoming Anakin again.\par \par Players will compare this to the Light Side counterpart Our Only Hope (from the DSII set) but there is a subtle difference. Note that the Lost part of this card has no special restrictions like Our Only Hope. This means that you can send Vader into battle even against Luke - as long as your opponent isn't playing There Is Good In Him (TIGIH) - and still keep Vader alive by reducing attrition a bit.

Information: This droid fetcher has a little more utility than similar trooper, alien etc based downloaders in that it can do double duty and get you a ground or a space-capable Trade Federation droid. For utility, this used interrupt also doubles as a power adder for your non-unqiue battle droids. A few copies of this card are vital component if you are planning a Droids-A-Go-Go deck.\par \par Design note - this card was originally had a "+2 and immune to attrition" text in the vein of Trooper Assault, but proved a little, ummm... let's just say that many Jedi died to bring you this +1 bonus.

Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 10 during battle, adds one destiny to total power only. When at Ord Mantell system, adds 1 to each of your Force drains there.

CardName: They've Shut Down The Main Reactor
Lore: "We'll be destroyed for sure!"
Gametext: If you have a piloted capital starship armed with a starship weapon or equipped with a tractor beam, use 2 Force to target an opponent's starship present. Until end of your next turn, target cannot move and its pilots may not apply ability toward drawing battle destiny.
Information: It plays as a unique Used Interrupt to target an opponent's starship that's present with your capital starship that's armed with a starship weapon or tractor beam, using 2 Force. Until the end of your next turn, the target can't move and its pilots may not apply their ability toward drawing a battle destiny. They'll be destroyed for sure! This reduces the battleworthiness and mobility of a starship for such a long period of time that your opponent would most likely just forfeit it.

Lore: "He's my brother."
Gametext: If Han and Leia are present together at a battleground site (and neither is undercover), choose one of the following: Your Force drain is +1 at that site this turn. OR Opponent's Force drains at related locations are -1 next turn. OR Cancel This Is Still Wrong.
Information: The long line of kissing cards that started in Hoth, and has swung between Dark Side and Light Side, reaches a possible conclusion in Endor!\par \par Finally Han can be happy with the news that any thing Luke and Leia feel for each other is purely "familial".\par \par Good news for Han and Leia, bad news for the Dark Side. If Han and Leia are together, you get the choice, add 1 to your drain at that site, or make all opponents drains on this planet -1 next turn. A very useful slow-down mechanism against those fast drain operative deck or ISB deck your opponent is hurting you with.\par \par If your mains deck that focuses on one main planet (or goes to the opponents planet), then this is a great Used Interrupt. That 5 destiny will be very handy, and you will get lots of chances to play it! What's more, you can play it at any time they are together, not limiting it's usefulness at all!
Combo: A brief list of some cards that work explicitly with Han and Liea: I Know, Count Me In, Wookiee Guide, Someone Who Loves You, This Is Even Better.
Cancels: This Is Still Wrong

Lore: "We seem to be made to suffer. It's our lot in life."
Gametext: Lose a droid to cancel all attrition against you at same site this turn. OR Re-target an opponent's weapon to one of your droids at same site as target. If droid is 'hit', use original target's forfeit number.
IsPulled: Hopping Mad
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par (Errata) See Self-Destruct Mechanism.\par \par (AR 1.7.1, B-14)\par Self-Destruct Mechanism\par (Errata) When this Interrupt retargets a weapon to a droid, that droid must be a valid target for the weapon (e.g., a Power Harpoon may not target droids). If 'hit' by the retargeted weapon, the droid inherits the target's forfeit value before any further weapon effects are applied (such as forfeit reduction text).

Lore: It took escape from Hoth, asteroids, slugs, capture, refreshments with Vader, torture and the inevitable carbon-freezing to get Leia to reveal her true feelings for Han.
Gametext: If Han and Leia are together in a battle you just lost, forfeit one of them to satisfy all battle damage and attrition against you. OR If Han is a captive and a battle was just initiated where you have Leia (or vice versa), add one battle destiny. OR Cancel This Is Still Wrong.
Cancels: This Is Still Wrong

Lore: "Why, I guess you don't know everything about women yet."
Gametext: Deploy on any male character. Target a female character. Target is power -2. Utinni Effect canceled when present with target.
IsPulled: This Is Still Wrong\par Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans
IsCanceledBy: This Is More Like It\par Who's Scruffy-Looking?

Lore: "You like me because I'm a scoundrel. There aren't enough scoundrels in your life." "I happen to like nice men." "I'm a nice man." "No you're not, you're ..."
Gametext: During a battle, lose X Force to reduce attrition against you by X. OR Cancel This Is Just Wrong.
Information: Don't you just hate it when your opponent draws a Battle Destiny of 1 and it forces you to lose a great character like Lando? Well, now you can virtually give all your characters an immunity to attrition with the Used Interrupt: This Is More Like It.\par \par Although it makes you still lose Force to reduce attrition against you, at least you can protect an important character or even group of characters and have them around for future battles. In many games that I have played, I'm certain that the outcome would have been different if I had a particular character around for just one more turn.\par \par Besides this excellent use, it has a secondary use as well...it cancels This Is Just Wrong. Two uses in one card is great, especially since there are so many cards and only 60 card deck sizes.
Combo: This Is More Like It + Obi-Wan OR Son of Skywalker OR Princess Leia OR anyone else with a minor immunity to attrition: Reduce any excess attrition just enough to protect your heroes.\par \par This Is More Like It + Any other valuable characters: If the attrition against you is minimal, you can eliminate it totally.\par \par This Is More Like It + Courage of a Skywalker + Luke OR Leia: Give yourself a power boost, and if your opponent causes any attrition upon your now un-immune Skywalker, who cares? :)\par \par This Is More Like It + Force Retrieval cards: Get the Force back that you lost from This Is More Like It via On/Off the Edges, Death Star Plans, Kessel/Rycars Runs, Reflection, etc.
Cancels: This Is Just Wrong

Lore: Against his programming to impersonate a deity. Worshiped by the Ewoks. "Aaaahhhhh-uuuuhhhhh. Aaaahhhhh-uuuuhhhhh. Aaaahhhhh-uuuuhhhhh."
Gametext: Deploys -2 on Endor. Adds 1 to attrition against opponent for each Ewok in battle at same site. If just lost from table during battle, may go to Used Pile. At same and related sites, [Cloud City], [Jabba's Palace], and [Endor] characters are immune to Bad Feeling Have I.
Information: C-3PO personas are:\par \par Artoo & Threepio\par C-3PO (See-Threepio)\par See-Threepio\par Threepio\par Threepio With His Parts Showing\par -----\par The golden droid has finally secured himself a new persona! Threepio is built for Endor and Ewoks, but is handy anywhere in a pinch. Just like the real droid!\par \par For one thing, he makes a host of you mains immune to the deploy costs of Bad feeling Have I on the same planet. Captain Han Solo, Lando Calrissian, Princess Leia, Princess Leia Organa, Tamtel Skreej, General Solo, Daughter of Skywalker and Chewbacca of Kashyyyk. Theres got to be something in there that takes your fancy!\par \par His "go to Used Pile" ability is dovetailed from his role in the movies - although Threepio seemed to always be in sticky situations, his good fortune seemed to always hold up! As far as the Imperials were concerned, he was impossible to kill! And at forfeit 5, sending him to the Used Pile may just save most of your other characters at the site.
IsPulled: Seeking An Audience\par Seeking An Audience (V)\par Were You Looking For Me?
Combo: Threepio + Here We Go Again\par Initiate a second battle this turn, and add two battle destiny!\par -----\par Threepio + Don't Forget The Droids = send Threepio to the Used pile to cancel the last battle destiny drawn.\par -----\par Threepio + Artoo = reduce all opponent's battle destiny by 1.\par -----\par Threepio + Artoo + Artoo, I Have A Bad Feeling About This = NO battle destiny for your opponent.\par -----\par Threepio + Chewie With Blaster Rifle\par Chewie With Blaster Rifle adds one battle destiny if with C-3P0.

Lore: Protocol Droid designed by Anakin in order to help his mother. C-3PO was not to be sold when Anakin left with Qui-Gon Jinn for Coruscant.
Gametext: If in a battle with Shmi at a site, once per battle may place top card of your Used Pile on top of your Reserve Deck. Once per turn may place a card from hand on Used Pile to draw top card from Reserve Deck.
Information: C-3PO personas are:\par \par Artoo & Threepio\par C-3PO (See-Threepio)\par See-Threepio\par Threepio\par Threepio With His Parts Showing\par -----\par The Episode 1 version of Threepio is a great card for anyone who likes to have full control over their deck. Threepio shares Mirax Terrik's ability to circulate high destiny cards back into your deck and replace them with new cards from the Reserve Deck. What's even nicer about Threepio's ability is that, unlike Mirax, his ability can be used for free, and instead of placing the card on the bottom of the Used Pile, he places it on the top of the Used Pile for easier tracking when your Reserve Deck is larger.\par \par The other nice thing about Threepio's ability to place a high destiny card on top of your Used Pile is that if he's in a battle with Shmi, he can then take that high destiny card and place it on top of your Reserve Deck, ensuring a nice pull for weapon or battle destiny. And since Shmi can download Threepio right out of the Reserve Deck, the odds of you having them in a battle together are pretty good.\par \par The fact that this is a persona of C-3PO also has enormous benefits. Because most versions of C-3PO have only been strong in specialized decks, many of his support cards are quite powerful. For example, Were You Looking For Me? is a handy 5 Destiny Used Interrupt that allows you to pull Threepio and/or another protocol droid (like R-3PO) from your Reserve Deck. You can also use the same Interrupt as a Lost Interrupt to either retrieve Threepio from the Lost Pile or to add a battle destiny when Threepio is helping his friends out in battle (two battle destiny if he happens to have a few furry friends with him). Unlike most "back" cards, this card is very appealing because it's recyclable, free, high destiny, and has the battle destiny bonus.\par \par There are tons of other C-3PO suppport cards, including the ever-popular How Did We Get Into This Mess?, but one of my favorites is Artoo, I Have A Bad Feeling About This, which has three different uses, the best of which allows you to squash your opponent's battle destiny completely if both Artoo and C-3PO are together in battle. Put Shmi, Artoo and Threepio together in a battle, and with the right support cards you can really put the hurt on the Dark Side.
IsPulled: Seeking An Audience\par Seeking An Audience (V)\par Shmi Skywalker\par Were You Looking For Me?
Combo: Threepio With His Parts Showing + Chewie With Blaster Rifle\par Chewie With Blaster Rifle adds one battle destiny if with C-3P0.\par -----\par Threepio With His Parts Showing + Eventually You'll Lose

Rules: (AR 1.7.1, D-2)\par Operatives are identified by their title, X Operative, with X being a system. The operative is considered a 'matching operative' for system X (e.g., Kiffex Operative is a matching operative for Kiffex). \par Operatives are restricted by special rules as follows: \par - You may not voluntarily deploy or move your operative to (or through) a location on its matching planet where you already have an operative (even if inactive) of the same card title. \par - If, at any time, two of your Operatives (even if inactive) of the same card title are at the same location on their matching planet, you must choose one to be lost (you may choose an inactive operative to be lost). \par - Your operative character on its matching planet may not apply its ability toward drawing battle destiny. Your operative may not control a location on its matching planet for any reason unless you have other cards there capable of controlling the location (e.g., an ability-1 character or a battle droid). Your operatives still occupy that location (and may battle or be battled), but may not Force drain or flip an objective alone.

Lore: Limited production, light reconnaissance starship. Minimal armor and weapons. Long-range sensor and communications array. Scouts for Rebel activity.
Gametext: May add 1 Pilot and 1 passenger, or 2 passengers. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.
IsPulled: All Power To Weapons\par Commander Brandei\par Early Warning Network\par Short Range Fighters
Combo: TIE Scout + I've Lost Artoo!!!\par Make room for a real astromech and still add a pilot and passenger.

Lore: Several TIEs were assigned to patrol Cloud City prior to the Imperial occupation of Bespin. Their instructions were to herd any vessels attempting to escape toward the Executor.
Gametext: If opponent just initiated a Force drain at a system, cloud sector or asteroid sector, you may 'react' by deploying TIEs and pilots to that location (at normal use of the Force).

Lore: Reconnaissance starfighter. Often deployed first to gather detailed information on enemy starship movement before full fleet engagement.
Gametext: Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. You may deploy cards to same system or sector as a 'react'.
IsPulled: All Power To Weapons\par Commander Brandei\par Early Warning Network\par Short Range Fighters

Lore: Rebel pilots often join the Rebellion from Outer Rim worlds. Bush pilots fly by the seat of their pants, giving them a huge advantage in close quarters.
Gametext: If you have a lone vehicle or starfighter in a battle or Attack Run at Beggar's Canyon, Cloud City, Death Star: Trench or an asteroid sector, use 1 Force. At the end of that battle or Attack Run, opponent must forfeit two participating vehicles or starfighters.

Lore: Senior logistics officer from Onderon. Left Dantooine to serve on Yavin 4 before coming to Hoth. All personnel entering Echo Base must report to him.
Gametext: Deploys only on Yavin 4 or Hoth. Opponent's aliens and Imperials may not move from same site as Tigran to an Echo or an interior Yavin site.
Information: When the Light Side is playing on Hoth or Yavin IV, he can come in quite useful. He stops the opponent moving from his site to an interior Echo or Yavin IV site. You can keep your important but vulnerable characters there, and Tigran will protect them by not allowing the Dark Side to get to them. Simple, yet effective.

Lore: Quarren \b senator\b0  elected by the people of Mon Calamari. Has amassed considerable wealth through a multitude of political deals, but still moves to gain more.
Gametext: \b Agenda\b0 : wealth. While in a senate majority, your Force generation is +2 at battlegrounds you control, and Honor Of The Jedi is suspended. Once during your deploy phase, may draw bottom card of your Force Pile into hand.
IsPulled: Squabbling Delegates
Cancels: Suspends Honor Of The Jedi while in a senate majority.

Lore: A timer-activated explosive device designed to be placed by a mining droid. Originally used in ore and spice mines for demolition. Altered for military applications.
Gametext: Deploy on opponent's side at same site as one of your mining droids. 'Explodes' at beginning of your next turn. Draw destiny. That number of opponent's characters there are immediately lost (owner's choice). Timer Mine is also lost.
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par See Mining Droid Rules, Ap. C.

Lore: A timer-activated explosive device designed to be placed by a mining droid. Typically used in ore and spice mines for demolition. Also has many military applications.
Gametext: Deploy on opponent's side at same site as one of your mining droids. 'Explodes' at beginning of your next turn. Draw destiny. That number of opponent's characters there are immediately lost (owner's choice). Timer Mine is also lost.
IsPulled: Portable Scanner\par Throw Me Another Charge
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par See Mining Droid Rules, Ap. C.

Lore: Piloted Gold 2 as defensive cover for Gold Leader during attack run in Death Star trench at the Battle of Yavin.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Gold 2, also adds 1 to maneuver and (when in Death Star: Trench) adds 1 to total of Attack Run.

Lore: Corellian \b smuggler\b0. \b Spy\b0. Han stole the armor and identity of an enemy soldier that boarded the \ul Millennium Falcon\ul0. Bluffed his way into the detention area.
Gametext: Deploys only as an Undercover spy at same site as an Imperial. While Undercover, Imperials are deploy +1 at related sites. May voluntarily "break cover" only during your move phase by using 3 Force. Captured if "cover broken" by opponent.
Information: Han Solo personas are:\par \par Captain Han Solo\par General Solo\par General Solo (V)\par Han\par Han (V)\par [Han, Chewie, And The Falcon]\par [Han, Chewie, And The Falcon (V)]\par Han Solo\par Han With Heavy Blaster Pistol\par Solo\par TK-422
IsPulled: We'll Find Han
Combo: TK-422 + Sabotage or Sabotage (V)\par -----\par TK-422 + Double Agent
MatchingWeapon: Han's Heavy Blaster Pistol

Lore: Twins. \b Thieves\b0. Con artists. \b Spies\b0. Swindlers. Double agents. Brea and Senni use their natural charm to sway the unwary on the fringe of society.
Gametext: Twice during each of your control phases, may use 2 Force to draw 2 destiny for 2 chances at a destiny = 2. If successful, may steal or destroy up to 2 weapons or 2 devices present.
IsPulled: Murttoc Yine
Combo: Tonnika Sisters + Kiffex\par -----\par Tonnika Sisters + Nevar Yalnal
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-15)\par (Errata) While the Tonnika Sisters are often referred to as "they," nevertheless, they are a single character card and are treated as such for all purposes. The Tonnika Sisters may destroy any weapon or device, but may steal only something they can carry (such as a character weapon). The Tonnika Sisters may steal or destroy up to two weapons present or up to two devices present - not one of each. (See Kiffex.)
IsCanceledBy: If Vul Tazaene present with Tonnika Sisters, Vul and Tonnika Sisters are lost.

Lore: Anakin needed all the help he could get to evade Sebulba's tactics.
Gametext: USED: If your character was just targeted by a weapon, opponent must use 2 Force or the targeting is canceled. LOST: Cancel Hit Racer or Podracer Collision.
Information: This interrupt is a great alternative to Put That Down from the Cloud City set. While it doesn't guarantee the ability to cancel a weapon from targeting one of your characters, this version is much cheaper - it's free! Instead of having you use 3 Force, you make your opponent use 2 Force or they missed with their weapon.\par \par As an added bonus, you can also use it to prevent your opponent from using tricks like Hit Racer or Podracer Collision while your Podracer attempts to take the checkered flag.
IsPulled: We Wish To Board At Once
Combo: Too Close For Comfort + Put That Down: A bit excessive, but this will really frustrate your opponent when they use 2 Force and miss regardless.
Cancels: Hit Racer\par Podracer Collision

Lore: "We're having some trouble adapting them to the cold."
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your side of table. Each non-creature vehicle at marker sites under "nighttime conditions" is power = 0, maneuver = 0 and landspeed = 0.
Information: Combo Card: Sunsdown & Too Cold For Speeders
IsPulled: Twi'lek Advisor\par We Must Accelerate Our Plans

Lore: Female \b senator\b0  and member of her planet's ruling class. Her original optimism in the political process has vanished, and she now partakes in the corrupt activities she once abhorred.
Gametext: \b Agendas\b0 : ambition, taxation, wealth. While in a senate majority, once per turn may add 1 to your total attrition in battle for each character with an ambition agenda at Galactic Senate.
IsPulled: Squabbling Delegates

Lore: "We have been without an interpreter since our master got angry with our last protocol droid and disintegrated him."
Gametext: USED: Cancel Never Tell Me The Odds if it was just inserted or revealed. (Immune to Sense.) LOST: Target a droid at Droid Workshop that you have captured or stolen. Droid is lost. Retrieve Force equal to droid's forfeit (doubled if stolen).
IsPulled: EV-9D9\par Interrogation Array
Cancels: Never Tell Me The Odds

Lore: Chief Controller at Echo Command. Responsible for communicating orders to the troops. Personally gives firing orders to Ion Cannon Control.
Gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots. When at any war room, adds 1 to weapon destiny draws of your Planet Defender Ion Cannon on same planet.

Lore: Captures enemy vessels for boarding. When used in conjunction with an ion cannon, tractor beams can ensnare even the most maneuverable starships.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your Star Destroyer. At the end of a battle at same system or sector, may target an opponent's starship present (except Mon Calamari Star Cruiser) using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Target captured if destiny > defense value.
Information: Our First Catch Of The Day adds 2 to a tractor beam destiny draw.\par -----\par When Tyrant is using Tractor Beam, adds 1 to destiny draw.
IsPulled: I Can't Shake Him!\par Warrant Officer M'Kae
Combo: Tractor Beam + In Range + Our First Catch Of The Day\par -----\par Tractor Beam + Captain Lennox + Besieged\par -----\par Tractor Beam + Flawless Marksmanship\par -----\par Tractor Beam + I Want That Ship\par -----\par Tractor Beam + Ion Cannon

Lore: Massive cargo vessels that were converted by the Trade Federation into armed battleships. Each is equipped with a large contingent of droid starfighters and battle droids.
Gametext: May add 4 pilots, 4 passengers, 2 vehicles, and 4 starfighters. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. While with any starfighter, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.
Information: The Trade Federation Battleship is the standard capital ship in the Trade Federation fleet. Its solid stats include a healthy power, armor, and forfeit.\par With four empty pilot slots to fill, this ship can quickly become a juggernaut when piloted by Neimoidian Pilots or "classic trilogy" pilots like Danz Borin.\par With space to carry 4 starfighters, the Trade Federation Battleship can easily transport its own armada of Droid Starfighters. This combination of ships is further encouraged by the deploy bonus Droid Starfighters get when they deploy at the same system as a battleship.\par \par The Trade Federation Battleship benefits from these starfighters by drawing a battle destiny if unable to otherwise when present with a fighter. This text comes in handy when you have a squadron of Droid Starfighters that lack the ability to draw destiny on their own.
Combo: Trade Federation Battleship + Naboo + Neimoidian Pilots\par Neimoidian Pilots deploy free and activate 1 Force each time they deploy. How often do you have more active Force after your deploy phase than before?\par -----\par Trade Federation Battleship + Droid Starfighters + Battle Deployment\par Each player's ships are power -2 at systems where he doesn't have both a capital ship and a starfighter. Since Trade Federation Battleships and Droid Starfighters are meant to go together, you already have that covered. Does your opponent?\par -----\par Trade Federation Battleship + Sil Unch

Characteristics: Trade Federation (starship), Droid Control Ship, ship-docking capability
Lore: These heavily modified battleships are used to control and direct the Trade Federation automated army. Easily identified by its array of sensors and antennae.
Gametext: May add 4 pilots, 4 passengers, 2 vehicles, and 4 starfighters. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Has ship-docking capability. While a droid starfighter here, adds one battle destiny.
Information: This unique ship... wait a second, let's look at that card again! This ship isn't unique. Instead, the diamond-shaped symbol before the title indicates that the Trade Federation Droid Control Ship is limited to one copy per system. Previously, these markings have mostly appeared on locations. Indeed, this is the first ship to use this icon.\par \par The numbers on Trade Federation Droid Control Ship compare favorably with the non-unique Trade Federation Battleship. Its power and forfeit are reduced by 1, but this reduction is balanced by the increased armor, ability, and the reduced deploy cost.\par \par The Droid Control Ship is crucial for the proper functioning of the Trade Federation's droid starfighters, reflected by both the power penalty the droid starfighters suffer when not present with this important ship as well as the deploy bonus they receive when deploying to the same system. Needless to say, it is recommended that your droid starfighters stay close to this ship.\par \par Deploy the Laser Cannon Battery aboard to not only hit your opponent's ships, but cause a 1 Force loss to direct damage when you do so. Add Imperial Artillery to add another Force loss, either during your Control phase or after successfully hitting a ship with the Battery (or both, since Imperial Artillery can be used twice per turn!). Deploy the Neimoidian Pilot aboard (for free at Naboo) and activate an extra Force when doing so. Tey How can also make herself useful here, giving you the ability to reduce Force lost to drains at nearby parsecs.
Combo: Federation Droid Control Ship + Neimodian Pilot + Tey How + Droid Starfighter\par Power 12 plus 2 battle destiny. Add a few more pilots and/or ships to maintain control of a system while Tey How reduces your Force loss to drains at systems within 2 parsecs.\par -----\par Federation Droid Control Ship + Sil Unch

Lore: C-9979 landing craft designed to transport and unload Multi Troop Transports and its battle droid cargo as rapidly as possible.
Gametext: May add 2 pilots and 6 vehicles. Deploys and moves like a starfighter. While at a site, once during your deploy phase may take an MTT into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
Pulls: An MTT.\par Multi Troop Transport\par TT-6\par TT-9
IsPulled: Commander Desanne

Lore: Organizations as wealthy as the Trade Federation can afford large amounts of military hardware, all purchased under the guise of protecting their commercial interests.
Gametext: Use 2 Force to target a starship at same system as your [Trade Federation] starship armed with a weapon. Target is forfeit = 0 until end of turn. OR During battle, add X to your total power, where X = armor of one of your [Trade Federation] starships in that battle.

Lore: Expert traffic controllers coordinate launches faster than automated launch systems. Rebel bases scramble fighters quickly during Imperial attacks.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your side of table. During your control phase, you may return any cards from your hand to the top of your Used Pile.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once

Lore: The enormous feet of a walker are designed for mobility on many types of terrain. They also can be used by merciless pilots to crush the Rebellion.
Gametext: If you have a piloted AT-AT or AT-ST present at a site, target opponent's character, 'crashed' vehicle or unpiloted vehicle without armor present. Draw destiny. Character lost if destiny > ability. Vehicle lost if destiny < 7.
Information: Trample is very efficient in a Walker deck. It can be played at almost any time, giving it a wide range of situations where it is extremely useful. Also, Trample can be used to clear out problem characters before a crucial battle.\par This Interrupt is very good against undercover spies as well.
IsPulled: Blizzard 2 (V)
Combo: Trample + any piloted AT-AT or AT-ST present at a site\par -----\par Trample + Walker Garrison

Lore: Trandoshans refer to themselves as T'doshok. Hate Wookiees. Many have come to work for Jabba, attempting to emulate the success of Bossk.
Gametext: Power and forfeit +1 at same site as a Wookiee or while Bossk at Audience Chamber. When in battle at same site as a bounty, adds 1 to attrition against opponent.
IsPulled: Chevin (V)

Lore: After the mission, the Death Squadron HoloNet communications system reported fifteen system errors: ten computer malfunctions, four power failures and one asteroid.
Gametext: Cancel one hologram. OR Use 3 Force. Draw destiny. Add 1 to destiny for each asteroid sector on table. If total destiny > 3, Imperial Holotable site is "blown away" (opponent loses 4 Force).
Information: Combo Card: Out Of Commission & Transmission Terminated
Rules: (AR 1.7.1, B-16)\par This Interrupt cancels any card either on table or just played with the hologram characteristic.
Cancels: One hologram.\par HoloNet Transmission\par Image Of The Dark Lord  \par Image Of The Dark Lord (V)  \par The Phantom Menace  \par Visage Of The Emperor

Lore: "Boscka!"
Gametext: If you have no characters at Rancor Pit at end of your deploy phase, target a character (even a captive) at Audience Chamber. Draw destiny. If destiny +2 > ability, target relocated to Rancor Pit and, if a captive, released to the Light Side of Rancor Pit (not Used Pile).

Lore: Lutrillian. Primary saleswoman and executive planner for Planet Dreams, Inc. Monitors production schedules and accounting. Really enjoys making a sales pitch.
Gametext: During your control phase, may 'sell' one Interrupt card from hand. Opponent must use X Force, where X = destiny of that card or entire Force Pile (opponent's choice). Place sold card on opponent's Used Pile and activate X Force.
Combo: Treva Home + Draw Their Fire\par If you have a deck which is designed around setting up big beatdowns (eg. with Jedi Presence and supporting cards like Courage of a Skywalker), Treva is your most effective way of stopping your opponent using Ghhhk to avoid the battle damage when combined with Draw Their Fire. The other methods of achieving this result - Frozen Assets and Beggar - are each canceled by the Fanfare shield, so Treva is probably the best way to abuse Draw Their Fire in this way. (Psychobabble)

Lore: A Stennes Shifter, a near-human race. Have ability to blend unnoticed into crowds. Trinto profits from turning lawbreakers over to Imperial authorities.
Gametext: If there are cards in the opponent's Used Pile during your battle phase, draw one destiny. All cards there with the same destiny number are lost.
Combo: Trinto Duaba + Monnok\par -----\par Trinto Duaba + Dune Sea Sabacc (or any Sabacc really) + Voyeur\par Play Sabacc to get cards in their used pile, then the other 2 Interrupts to make them lose force/other cards. (maxbeedo)

Lore: An assault of stormtroopers caused Leia, Chewie and Lando to retreat. When working together, the troopers' powerful onslaught can appear unstoppable.
Gametext: If a battle was just initiated at a site, each of your troopers present is power +2 and immune to attrition for remainder of turn.
Information: This card gives a shot in the arm to trooper decks. With this card and a couple of little tricks can allow troopers to be competitive in a number of different environments. Of course, the key to this deck is protecting the Trooper Assaults from Sense. Seven or eight Controls and a couple of Tentacles might be the advisable course of action for this mission.\par \par This deck can revolve around the classic Force drain locations such as the Moisture Farm, Judland Wastes, Cantina and Defensive Perimeter. Control of the location can be established with about 4 Imperial Trooper Guards. With a Trooper Assault in hand, these guys are power 24 and immune to attrition. If more characters show up for the Light Side, a few more guards can be thrown into the mix and they all add six power each.\par \par This is great for defending these locations, but of course doesn't do much for the attack. This is where another card can come in handy. Deploy Trooper Davin Felth or an Imperial Squad Leader and give them a Light Repeating Blaster Rifle and a power source. Blasted Droid will then allow the trooper to fire the LRBR with a destiny bonus pretty much until the Dark Side runs out of Reserve Deck. If the power source is a Portable Fusion Generator and the trooper is at the Moisture Farm or Defensive Perimeter, all of the shots will be at weapon destiny + three. Even Obi-Wan is fairly likely to run into a 4 destiny Trooper Assault from the Reserve Deck, wiping him out. And since the Imperial Trooper Guards are destiny 3, Son Of Skywalker can be hit when they are drawn using the LRBR add all of it's adders. Again, this combination needs protection from Sense.

Lore: Imperial troopers are fearless and totally indoctrinated. Backed by the most powerful weapons and starships in the galaxy, they tend to consider themselves invincible.
Gametext: Select one of your troopers in a battle to make a 'charge.' If that trooper is a Death Star Trooper, it is power +3 the battle. If any other trooper, power +2. However, that trooper must be forfeited at end of battle.
Information: Sergeant Major Enfield makes Trooper Charge a Used Interrupt at same or related site.\par -----\par Death Star troopers are:\par \par Corporal Grenwick\par Corporal Prescott\par Death Star Trooper\par Imperial Trooper Guard\par Sergeant Major Enfield\par Sergeant Torent

Lore: Dispatched to Tatooine to apprehend renegade droids fleeing the \ul Tantive IV\ul0. Suspected to have misgivings about Imperial methods. Allegedly shot his commander in the back.
Gametext: While he is on Tatooine, Local Trouble and Look Sir, Droids are Used Interrupts. Opponent may select target when using Friendly Fire at same site as Felth.
IsPulled: Blizzard 4

Lore: Corrupt captain of the Cloud City Wing Guard. Began working during the administration of Baron Raynor. Easily bribed. Keeps the peace through intimidation.
Gametext: Deploys only on Cloud City, but may move elsewhere. Power +2 when participating in a battle you initiate. Opponent may use 2 Force to 'bribe' (exclude) Blendin from battle.
Information: He looks pretty weak...after all, your opponent can make Blendin not battle just by using two Force. And, admittedly, you probably don't want Blendin to be the focus of your deck, because of his unreliability. But Trooper Jerrol Blendin can help you make a few key moves and give you the advantage you need.\par \par The first thing to look at is Blendin's deploy cost -- he doesn't have one! That isn't a bad thing. And, if you initiate battle, he gets +2 power (4 total). He can be great for catching an opponent who doesn't keep anything in his Force Pile. For zero Force you can get +4 power in a battle and, effectively, increase the damage to your opponent by four. And, when the battle's over, you can forfeit Blendin to ensure that you don't get burned by his detrimental game text.
Combo: Blendin + Trooper Assault + Trooper Charge : Power *8* if you initiate the battle, all at the cost of zero Force! Makes a great surprise for your opponent in a 'react' deck.\par \par Blendin + Lone Warrior : Leave him alone at a site and give him defensive cards. Then, if your opponent chooses not to let him participate in a battle, the battle is just cancelled.

Lore: Sabacc is a popular pastime for off-duty Imperial stormtroopers throughout the galaxy.
Gametext: \b Requirements:\b0  A gambler or trooper at a site. \b Wild cards (2-7):\b0  Imperial and Rebel leaders. (Troopers may use weapons as wild cards.) \b Clone cards:\b0  Locations and droids. \b Stakes:\b0  One transport vehicle without armor or one character weapon.

Lore: Troopers stationed at various outposts play this sabacc variant to pass the time between assignments.
Gametext: \b Requirements:\b0  A gambler or trooper at a site. \b Wild cards (2-7):\b0  Imperial and Rebel leaders. (Troopers may use weapons as wild cards.) \b Clone cards:\b0  Locations and droids. \b Stakes:\b0  One transport vehicle without armor or one character weapon.

Lore: Imzig Cloud City trooper and Wing Guard \b leader\b0. Attempts to protect Cloud City citizens from less reputable members of local constabulary. Never accepts a bribe.
Gametext: Deploys only on Cloud City, but may move elsewhere. Deploys free to same Cloud City site as Lando. Power +2 when defending a battle. Your other Cloud City troopers are forfeit +2 where present.
Information: Looking for a boost for that Lobot Cloud City Trooper deck? Make sure you have Trooper Utris M'Toc stocked in your deck, ready to serve.\par \par Trooper Utris M'Toc is a power 2 ability 2 character with a destiny of 2. If Lobot is present at a site, M'Toc would deploy for free as a Cloud City trooper. He also deploys free to the same site as Lando. This works with either the Dark Lando or even the Light Lando, so it could be an effective way to ambush the Dark Side Lando. He is power +2 when defending a battle, so that could be a nasty surprise for the Dark Side if they choose to attack. When present with M'Toc, all of your other Cloud City Troopers are forfeit +2, allowing you to suck up more damage in a fight.\par -----\par Your Cloud City Troopers deploy free and are power +1 at same site as Lobot at a Cloud City site.\par -----\par Cloud City troopers are:\par \par Cloud City Trooper\par Sergeant Edian\par Trooper Utris M'Toc
IsPulled: Lando Calrissian (V)\par Princess Organa
Combo: Trooper Utris M'Toc + Any Lando, or Lobot. M'Toc deploys for free.\par -----\par Trooper Utris M'Toc + Lobot + Cloud City Trooper. A powerful force with a cheap deploy cost.

Lore: Primary command liaison transport. Contains the majority of officer battle droids. Has priority to unload as soon as the area is secured. \b Enclosed\b0.
Gametext: May add 7 passengers. Once per turn, may deploy a battle droid leader to same site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 3 (< 5 if your AAT or STAP present).
Information: This is the Multi Troop Transport that actually does have a permanent droid pilot (see pilot and presence icons)! Although a small combat vehicle by power standards, these supply craft are designed to transport and unload mechanized forces. Thus lots of passenger capacity, and you can 'unload' a battle droid leader during each of your deploy phases. That gives you three choices with Theed Palace. OOM-9, the Battle Droid Officer, or the mighty OWO-1 With Backup. May be worth the investment!
Pulls: Battle Droid Officer\par OOM-9\par OWO-1 With Backup
IsPulled: Battle Deployment\par Trade Federation Landing Craft

Lore: Auxillary mobilization supply transport. Coordinates with the Droid Control Ship to determine whether additional STAPs are needed in any given area. \b Enclosed\b0.
Gametext: May add 4 passengers and 3 STAPs. Once per turn, may deploy a STAP to same site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 3 (< 5 if your AAT or STAP present).
Information: AAT's are:\par AAT Assault Leader\par Armored Attack Tank\par \par STAP is:\par Single Trooper Aerial Platform
Pulls: Single Trooper Aerial Platform
IsPulled: Battle Deployment\par Trade Federation Landing Craft

Lore: Han could always see the light at the end of the tunnel.
Gametext: Take one card into hand from Force pile; reshuffle.
Information: Combo Card: Control & Tunnel Vision
Pulls: One card from Force Pile.

Lore: High-powered blasters. Require power generators, cryogenic cooling units and large crews. More effective against capital starships than starfighters.
Gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on your Star Destroyer or any mobile system. May target a starship using 2 Force. Draw two destiny. Subtract 2 if targeting a capital starship. Otherwise, subtract 5. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
Information: Turbolaser Battery deploy and fire free on Thunderflare.\par -----\par Turbolaser Battery deploys on Jabba's Space Cruiser for free as a 'react.'\par -----\par Turbolaser Battery may deploy aboard Dreadnaught-Class Heavy Cruiser.
IsPulled: I Can't Shake Him!
Combo: Turboaser Battery + Ion Cannon\par -----\par Turbolaser Battery + Rendili StarDrive

CardName: Turn It Off! Turn It Off!
Lore: "Turn it off! Turn it off! Off! TURN IT OFF!"
Gametext: USED: Cancel any attempt to place a 'hit' starship, vehicle or droid in the Used Pile rather than the Lost Pile. OR Cancel Han's Toolkit. LOST: Cancel Crash Site Memorial.
Cancels: Any attempt to place a 'hit' starship, vehicle or droid in the Used Pile rather than the Lost Pile.\par -----\par Crash Site Memorial\par Han's Toolkit

Lore: Sand People use a special mask to reclaim exhaled moisture in the hot, harsh environment of Tatooine. Protects by filtering blowing sand and dispersing excess heat.
Gametext: Deploy on any Tatooine site where you have just won a battle. Target one of your characters not at Tatooine. Upon reaching, target takes mask. While on Tatooine, target's power and forfeit are +2 and has immunity to attrition of exactly 3.
IsPulled: The Signal\par We Wish To Board At Once

Lore: "Sand People." Ride banthas. Wield gaderffi (gaffi) sticks. Wear eye protectors and breath masks. Violent, nomadic, desert survival experts. "Urrrg! Ur Ur Uur!"
Gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Power + 1 if another non-unique Tusken Raider present. If you have four or more non-unique Tusken Raiders present, your total power here is +2.
IsPulled: Bantha Fodder

Lore: Tusken Raiders are constantly taking bets to see who can hit the most Podracers on the Boonta Eve racetrack.
Gametext: While at Podrace Arena, if opponent just placed race destiny on their Podracer, once per turn may use 3 Force to 'shoot' (no other Tusken Raiders may 'shoot' this turn). Draw destiny. If destiny > 3, place race destiny in opponent's hand.
IsPulled: Bantha Fodder

Lore: "Sand People always ride single file to hide their numbers." They frequently attack strangers as they scavenge for useful equipment. Looted Luke's landspeeder.
Gametext: Use 1 Force to draw destiny. If destiny < the number of Tusken Raiders on table, you may scavenge (search through) the opponent's Used Pile. All vehicles, weapons or devices you find there are lost.
Combo: Tusken Scavengers + Skrilling

Lore: "He's no Jedi."
Gametext: USED: Use 3 Force to search your Reserve Deck and take one Effect of any kind into hand; reshuffle. STARTING: Deploy from your Reserve Deck one Effect which has no deploy cost; reshuffle. Place Interrupt in Lost Pile.
Information: We Must Accelerate Our Plans also uploads an Effect of any kind.\par -----\par Please check Sonn's list here:\par http://www.swccgpc.com/forums/viewtopic.php?t=6507\par \par This list is only of legal targets for Twi'lek Advisor if deployed at start of game. You must still obey all deployment restrictions listed on those cards, so there are some on the list that cannot actually be started with at this time, but may in the future.
